loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
“Patience and sacrifices are the major steps towards success” says Mrs. Ofelia C. of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya.

She is married to Mr. Felix C. and they are gifted with three children. Being industrious parents, two of their children graduated from college and presently applying for a job. The youngest is still studying in tertiary education.

The main source of their living is through farming. They till their land twice a year by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Ofelia engages in selling vegetables in their village and also at Solano Public Market during market days. She wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to Php 13,000 to be used to acquire more vegetables to be sold in their village.

She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: Additional capital to help in selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 36 year old married woman, with four children aged between 10 and 16. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a three room house where she lives with four people. Aisha takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Aisha works in a semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She incurs transportation costs traveling to and from the African Village along Buganda Road in Kampala city to buy merchandise and uses public transport to and from shopping. Aisha works six days a week. She receives an average of twenty customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She pays a monthly rent of 45000 UGX. Her major business challenges are the increasing prices of crafts and transportation. She has been in this business for fifteen years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her eleventh loan. Aisha wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for crafts for her retail shop. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crafts for resale

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 43 years old and married with three children.

He owns a welding business that has been in operation for six years and also earns some extra income through small-scale farming. He successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for 35,000 KES. This loan is for 50,000 KES, and he will use the funds to buy more welding materials.

Leo describes himself as hardworking and optimistic and hopes to improve his standard of living by expanding his business. He says that through Faulu, he has learned how to better manage his business and believes that in ten years he will own a very large welding company.

loans.use: To buy welding materials

loans.name: Lakulo

texts.en:
Lakulo J. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour in the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Lakulo is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 7 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for the school fees for children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Đặng Thị's Group

texts.en: T. Đặng Thị (10105050014) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Hội (1). T. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. T. is now requesting a new loan of 4,578,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be her 6th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lương Thị H. (10105050024) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 4,578,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. 2. Bùi Thị S. (10105050016) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 4,578,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. 3. Phạm Thị N. (10105050018) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 4,578,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 4. Trịnh Thị Thư (10105050015) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 4,578,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** T. Đặng Thị (10105050014) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Hội (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,142,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,578,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lương Thị H. (10105050024) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,578,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 2. Bùi Thị S. (10105050016) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,578,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 3. Phạm Thị N. (10105050018) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,578,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 4. Trịnh Thị Thư (10105050015) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,578,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita M. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Pacita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as milo, nestea juice, coffeemate, coffee, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Pacita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is 51 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her son has been working as a trainee at the Temuujin theater, and her daughter is a first-year university student. They have been living in their current home for four years. Since they started their business, their quality of life has improved. Erdenetsetseg and her husband are planning to repair one of their rooms for their oldest son.

Recently, Erdenetsetseg has been operating a food kiosk beside their home. Her working capital is 400,000 tugrugs (~ 281 USD). Previously she worked as an attendant in a hospital until she retired. She is a very hardworking person and planning to expand her food kiosk, to repair their apartment and to purchase a variety of products.

She says, “I would like to be supportive and financially stable for my two children until they can live without our help.” She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~ 844 USD) loan to afford payment of the room where the food kiosk has been running. Erdenetsetseg will spend 750,000 tugrugs (~ 492 USD) of the loan to rent the room and will purchase inventory for her food kiosk with the remaining 450,000 tugrugs (~ 316 USD).

loans.use: To rent a room and purchase inventory for her food kiosk

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.es:
la señora Iris Yolanda C. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Julio Cesar Nuñez quien labora como guardia de seguridad en una agencia banco Atlantida en San Lorenzo. tienen un hijo que depende de ellos.

la señora C. se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña pulperia y venta de golosinas. 
En su casa de habitacion tiene su negocio en donde vende arroz, frijoles, maiz, refrescos, jugos, harina y otros,  ademas hace golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, y pastelitos. Esta solicitando un credito para surtir su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
 
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Iris Yolanda C., 34, lives with Julio Cesar Nuñez, who works as a security guard for a branch of Atlantida Bank in San Lorenzo; they have a son that depends on them. Mrs. C. has a small grocery store and she sells snacks. She has her store in her home where she sells such things as: rice, beans, corn, soft-drinks, juices, flour, etc. In addition, she makes snacks like: tacos, enchiladas and little cakes. She is asking for funding to stock her store so that she can produce better profits. Her goal is to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereal, toilet paper, soap, rice, beans, lard, tortillas, flour, soft-drinks, juices, pastas, candles, matches, eggs and salt.

loans.name: Zilpha

texts.en:
Zilpha D. is from the village of Dela Paz, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Zilpha is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Zilpha owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as canned goods, soap, cigarettes, shampoo & toothpaste in the local community. Zilpha has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Zilpha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zilpha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zilpha is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Zilpha from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San Jose Mayobamba Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José D. Mayobamba, inicia su primer ciclo con 7 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Vinchos, Comunidad D. Mayobamba.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cereales, animales menores, abarrotes, agricultura.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Maura es casada y 2 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio cuando comenzó a convivir con su pareja, con sus ingresos ayuda a los gastos del hogar, el préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar. Los sueños D. Maura son ampliar su negocio y surtir con mas productos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total D. 1,600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank San José D. Mayobamba begins its first loan cycle with 7 members, who are from the the Vinchos district, Mayobamba community. The members do different activities such as selling cereals, small animals, groceries and agriculture. Señora Maura is married with 2 children and has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries. She began this business when she started living with her husband. With her earnings she helps with the household costs. This loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Maura's dreams are to expand her business and stock more products. The members require different loan amounts such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles, making a total of 1,600 soles in loans with the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Vannak D. is 44 years old and is the village bank president of his group consisting of fourteen people, located in Krang Koam village in Kandal province. Each member of the group will use the loan for different purposes and hopes to increase income to improve his or her family's standard of living.

Mr. Vannak D. is a motorbike taxi driver and his wife, Mrs. Srey Mom Chhorn, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With these two businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. Mr. Vannak D. is now requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this new business, he hopes to increase income to improve his family's standard of living. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other two attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying beans and rice

loans.name: Wilrose

texts.en: Wilrose G. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. Wilrose has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Wilrose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Wilrose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Wilrose is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shaheen Kousar's Group

texts.en: Shaheen Kousar lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has two children, one son and a daughter. Her daughter is getting an education, and her son is not of school age yet. She works very hard to fulfill the basic needs of her family, along with her husband, who sells rice from a cart. Shaheen is applying for a loan to buy rice in bulk, expanding her husband’s business. This will help him in fulfilling larger orders and also cut his expenses by purchasing the rice in bulk. Shaheen Kousar is sure that this step will put more income in her husband’s pocket and bring happiness to her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk to sell

loans.name: Ta Ram Nu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Ta Ram Nu” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K., pictured on the left. She is age 35 and was born in a village called Yela. She is married with two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For two years now, Kadiatu has been selling cooked rice, fish, meat and vegetables. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc., wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, Margi, onions, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Nilma's Group

texts.en:
Nilma A. is from the town of gabunon tambulig. She is 28 years old. Nilma is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nilma is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Nilma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as eggs, noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Nilma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Nilma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda A. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector El Verde, un área rural perteneciente al distrito de Jayanca, uno de los distritos agrícolas que pertenecen a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura desde que era joven, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar granos como maíz, de la cosecha de este producto depende el sustento de la economía de su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo para así poder obtener una buena cosecha.

Manuel desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Gracias a las acciones que realizará con este préstamo tendrámas posibilidades de obtener una buena consecha.

Manuel es un padre bastante entregado a su familia, siempre se esfuerza a diario para poder brindarles el bienestar y la calidad de vida que ellos necesitan. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 47-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in El Verde, a rural area that is part of Jayanca district, one of Lambayeque province’s agricultural districts, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was a young man he has worked in agriculture. He has a field where he grows corn. His family’s support depends on this harvest so he always puts in the maximum effort into his work in order to obtain a good crop yield. Manuel wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to provide maintenance to his crop and to reach this goal he has deemed it convenient to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Thanks to the actions he’ll be able to take with the loan he will have more possibilities of getting a good harvest. Manuel is a father who is quite dedicated to his family. He always tries every day to provide them with wellbeing and the quality of life they need. He has had prior loans with Our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility where repayments are concerned.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: Solina

texts.en:
Solina T. is from the city Dipolog. She is 42 years old. Solina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Solina owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Solina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately PHP6,000 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Solina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solina has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP5,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Solina is requesting a new loan of PHP5,000, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Solina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Evelyn Leonor

texts.es:
Evelyn de 27 años, es vendedora de productos Yambal (empresa de cosméticos vende productos a un bajo costo para mujeres emprendedoras) vive con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo. 

Debido a su divorcio ella tubo que comenzar a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, escucho de Yambal y se inscribió como vendedora a domicilio por catalogo. Poco a poco a tenido ingresos para solventar los gastos. Vende perfumes, cremas, etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y otra parte dirigirla para comprar una cocina y sillas y así vender almuerzos.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 27, sells Yambal products (Yambal is a cosmetics company that sells low-cost products to female entrepreneurs). She lives with her two children in an urban area called Guasmo. Due to a divorce, she had to start looking for a way to make an income so she could support her children. She heard of Yambal and signed up as a vendor who sells at home through catalogs. Little by little she has made an income to cover her expenses. She sells perfumes, creams, etc. In order to keep her business going, she will use part of the loan to buy perfumes and creams, and the other part to buy a kitchen and chairs so that she can also sell lunches.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and a kitchen

loans.name: Walker Aladino

texts.es:
Walker Aladino V. S. tiene 65 anos. Es casado y vive con su esposa en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos de 35 hasta 25 anos. 

Walker es un socio de la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario, que está ubicada a dos horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura. Es productor de cacao, naranja, y platano. Vende los productos que produce en Babahoyo y San Jose del Tambo. 

Solicita el credito para invertir y mejorar sus huertos de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podria mejorar y mantener sus huertos de cacao. Su sueno es comprar un vehiculo para transportar sus productos a los mercados. Sus cultivos han sido afectados por unos enfermeddes como el ¨mal de machete,¨ y ¨escoba bruja.¨
texts.en:
Walker Aladino V. S. is 65 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province.  He has 8 children ranging in age from 25 to 35 years.

Walker is a member of the rural communal bank "Progreso Comunitario," which is located 2 hours from Chillanes.  There are 11 members in all, and most of them cultivate cocoa or have their own businesses.

Walter is a farmer.  He produces cocoa, oranges and bananas.  He sells the products that he produces in Babahoyo and in San Jose del Tambo.

He requests a loan to invest in improving his orange groves.  With the support of this loan he will improve and maintain his cocoa plantings.  His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport his products to the markets.  His cultivations have been affected by some diseases, such as the "mal de machete," (bad machete) and "escoba bruja" (witch's broom.)

loans.use: to invest in supplies for cocoa

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa T. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her children attend a local kindergarten and her husband is a taxi driver in their town. She graduated from Agricultural University as a hairdresser in 2003 and began to cut men's and women's hair in a beauty center.

Bayarmaa now works as a hairdresser in a rented space at a hair salon. She has been working in a rented space in Image Salon and has built a successful operation with many permanent customers. She pays a 100,000 MNT each month for a rented chair.

Bayarmaa is a very modest person and hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase equipment and tools for her hairdressing business. In the future, she plans to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and tools

loans.name: Anne Wanjiru

texts.en:
Anne opened her cyber cafe in Naivasha town late last year and so far she says it's profitable.  She is 41 years old, married to Simon M., and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to expand her cyber cafe and she will use the loan amount to buy two more computers for her cyber cafe.

In future, Anne hopes to develop her cyber cafe further and also start offering computer courses.

loans.use: To buy two computers for her cyber cafe

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is married to J. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan, which is famous for its agricultural industry. She has been a part of this city for over 10 years.

Her husband operates a cold drink corner in the market where he sells cold drinks and juices like pepsi, coca-cola, etc. He started this business a few years ago, and it has proved to be a profitable one for him.
 
Shahnaz has given birth to a daughter and 3 sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education, except the youngest one who is just 5 years old and has not started to attend school. Shahnaz herself is a housewife, and prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more cold drinks and juices to help him increase sales and provide timely fulfillment of the needs of his customers. He has been doing this business for over 10 years and Shahnaz is confident that after this loan investment her husband’s business will grow further, making him even more money every month.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She is a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. This is a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks and juices.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old and widowed, with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena makes and sells snacks and other delicacies such as banana kabobs and rice cakes. Rowena has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rowena is requesting a new loan, her second, for 7000 PHP to be used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Zyinat's Group

texts.en:
Zyinat M. is 49.  She is married and has four adult children. All of them have their own job, except the youngest one who is still a schoolboy.

The family budget is contributed to by the parents and elder children:  the head of the family is a secretary, the son earns income by working in a military department, the daughters are engaged in farming, and Zyinat herself has a job as head of the teaching department. Out of the total earnings,  the family has managed to prepare for their daughter’s dowry. 

The main aim of getting this loan is to start a livestock breeding business. Zyinat and her family are planning to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.  In the future, their intention is to purchase lot in order to build a new house for their eldest son.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three young children. She has 15 years of experience in the tailoring field and started to manage her own work from her house in 2005. She cooperates with her husband in the family’s income to maintain a minimum fair average of profit to provide better living conditions for her family.

She obtained her first Kiva loan and she was satisfied from the results. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a tailoring machine to enlarge her business so that she will be able to produce her services faster and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo, de 55 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Julia (52)  y su joven hija, juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.A lo largo de su vida, Hermenegildo a trabajado en diferentes oficios, ahora se decida al trabajo de  albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, pues hay bastante demanda por la zona y  él es el albañil con mayor  experiencia, al que todos recurren. Disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con este digno oficio  puede pagar la educación de sus hijos, lleva 21 años realizando su dedicada labor  y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados ladrillos para manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que le ha perjudicado porque sus  manos han envejecido rápidamente. Para el futuro desea renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace, y brindar un servicio de calidad.Es el noveno préstamo de Hermenegildo con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias.Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados, comprará tablones nuevos y aumentará su número de puntales (herramientas de apoyo), con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo, 55, is an unassuming, kind man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Julia, 52, and young daughter.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.

Throughout his life Hermenegildo has worked at various jobs; he’s currently a bricklayer and very sought after by his neighbors because there is a lot of demand in the area and he’s the most experienced bricklayer so everyone comes to him. He enjoys working in construction.  He knows that this honest work will allow him to pay for his children’s education.

He’s been in this line of work for 21 years and considers the most difficult part of it carrying the heavy bricks and mixing cement sometimes by hand, something that has damaged his hands and caused them to age quickly.  In the future he’d like to upgrade his work tools to improve the work he does and provide quality customer service.

This is his 9th loan with MFP and he does not want to miss payments for lack of money so he is already making contacts for more construction jobs.  
He is the only male in his communal bank so he always strives to be respectful and responsible towards his fellow members.

He plans to use the requested 2000 soles to buy new beams and supports so that he can work at several construction jobs at once thus hoping to improve his income.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Guerrero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guerrero lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas, una de ellas es Estela S., coordinadora del grupo.  Esta señora  de 31 años es propietaria de una mini pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de recarga hace tres años y poco a poco fue surtiendo su negocio con productos como chiverías, gaseosas y granos básico. 

Ella expreso que se siente apoyada por su familia ya que tanto su esposo como su pequeña hija de 7 años le ayuda en sus tiempos libres.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Lucila G. de 47 años quien vende leña, Catalina S. vende tomates de manera ambulante y desea tener un tramo y Arlen H. comercializa tomates desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The 'Guerrero' (Warrior) group is made up of four hard-working, enterprising women.  One of them is Estela S. who is the group's coordinator.  This 31 year-old lady is the owner of a small grocery store.  She started out in her business three years ago, selling pre-paid cell phone cards and then gradually began to stock her business with products such as snacks, soda and basic grains.

Estela tells us that she feels supported by her family since both her husband and her 7 year-old daughter help out in their spare time.

The other members of this group are 47 year-old Lucila G., who sells firewood; Catalina S., who sells tomatoes as an itinerant street vendor and would like to own a spot from which to make her sales; and Arlen H. who has been selling tomatoes for two years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Never Fail Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Never Fail” group. They are small scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and earn better profit. 

Abibatu J. is the leader of this group. Abibatu was born in one of the several villages that make up Sanda. She is 22 years of age and married to a student. The couple has 1 child who is attending primary school. Abibatu has been producing and selling soap and palm oil for 2 years. With the help of this loan, Abibatu will buy gallons of palm oil and soap-making materials in order to produce a larger quantity of soaps for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil and soap-making materials

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Hin R. is a 51-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom province. She is married to Mr. Sim Touch, age 51, who works with her in the farming business. They can earn an average profit of $6 each day to use for the family's daily expenses. The couple is blessed with six children, five who are single and one who is married. All of their children work in a variety of occupations and contribute their earnings to the family almost every month. In order to earn additional income, Hin R. has requested a loan for her husband to buy a used motorbike in order to begin a new business as a motor taxi driver. This loan will help her family achieve a good standard of living. This couple is pictured in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for her husband to begin a new business as a motor taxi driver.

loans.name: Mwanandonga

texts.en:
Mwanandogo is a married woman with four children, all graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

Mwanandogo has operated a business selling charcoal for the past fifteen years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells firewood, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanandogo faces a major business challenge of high transportation costs for charcoal. She hopes to establish real estate houses in the future.

Mwanandogo plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun is married to Mr. Tha.  Both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice.  Some of the rice is sold and some is kept for the family.  Mr. Tha is a palm juice collector. They can only earn a small income although they work hard. 

Mrs. Roeun would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. This couple has two children who are grocery sellers and who earn a low salary.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Danilo Esteban

texts.es:
Danilo es un joven luchador que desde hace un año decidió montar su propio negocio después de haber vivido una tragedia familiar en la mina donde él y su padre trabajaban, y donde prometió no volver después de haber visto a su padre morir en este mismo lugar. Danilo es emprendedor y sueña con tener un almacén que sea reconocido por muchas personas en el municipio donde él vive ubicado en el departamento de Antioquia, convirtiéndolo en un legado que le dejará a su familia generación tras generación. 

Danilo trabaja 5 días a la semana con mucho empeño, le gusta atender bien a sus clientes y tener constantemente el negocio surtido para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesitan. Actualmente Danilo quiere ampliar de cierta manera su microempresa por lo que quiere invertir un capital que le permita comprar  mercancía a su negocio, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para cumplir sus metas, quiere así brindarle proyección al almacén, atraer más clientes e incrementar las ventas, igualmente generar mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Danilo is a determined young man who decided to set up his own business one year ago after having lived through a family tragedy in the mine where he and his father both worked.  He promised himself that he would not go back to the mine after having seen his father die there.  Danilo is an entrepreneur and he dreams of owning a store which will become well known by many people in the town where he lives, in Antioquia department.  He dreams of turning his business into a legacy that he will leave to his family to be handed down generation to generation.

Danilo works five days a week with a lot of determination.  He likes to serve his customers well and to constantly have his business stocked so that his customers can always find what they need.  Danilo would currently like to expand his small business and would like to invest capital which will allow him to buy more merchandise.  However, he doesn't have enough capital to achieve his goals.  In this way, he would like to broaden the reach of his store, attract more customers, increase his sales and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta  es una madre de 45  años de edad, casada y con dos hijos menores de edad uno de ellos en edad escolar. Actualmente vive en el caserío Lagartera,  ubicado a 20 minutos  de la ciudad de Mórrope –Lambayeque. Esta es una comunidad rural muy pequeña donde viven aproximadamente 500 familias.

Alberta se gana la vida desde hace 4  años criando animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, que luego comercializa a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Alberta suele criar ganado porcino, ovino  así como  pavos y patos. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres desde que era pequeña, así que conoce el rubro a la perfección.  

Asimismo, tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes.  Esta bodega está ubicada en su domicilo, allí atiende a su clientela con la amabilidad que la caracteriza.

Alberta solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  3000 nuevos soles que invertirá en su negocio. En comprar más aves de corral y por supuesto en el alimento balanceado para éstas y para sus ganados ovinos y porcinos.

Alberta desea ampliar su negocio y comercializar sus animales, no sólo en su zona, ella quiere mejorar su calidad de vida. Cuenta con un buen historial crediticio en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Alberta is a 45 year old, married mother of two minor children one of whom is school age.  She currently lives in Lagartera located 20 minutes from the city of Mórrope-Lambayeque.  This is a very small rural community where approximately 500 families live.

Alberta has earned a living raising small farm animals for the last 4 years.  They are corralled in her back yard.  She then sells them to merchants that always come by the area where she lives.  Alberta tends to raise pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks.  She learned this activity from her parents while still a little girl so she knows the line of work to perfection.

Alberta asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to invest in her business buying more barnyard fowl and, of course, nutritionally balanced feed for them and for her sheep and pigs.

Alberta wants to expand her business and sell her animals not only in her own area.  She wants to improve her quality of life.  She has a good credit history with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, époux et coépouse. Ces femmes résident à Torakabougou l’un des quartiers de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire la restauration, le commerce des glacières, des tasses  thermos et le commerce d’arachide avec Adiara. 
Elles sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Adiara compte acheter, 4 sacs de 100 kg de graines d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à BOUGOUNI et auprès paysans des villages environnants pour ensuite faire sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Danaya Group ("Confidence") is composed of four married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children. They live with their children, husbands and cowives in traditional extended families in Torakabougou, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital and boost their activity level, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and finance their activities in catering and trading with iceboxes, thermos cups and groundnuts (the latter is Adiara's activity). This is their second loan, the first one having been repaid on schedule.

Adiara intends to use this new loan to buy 4 sacks of 100 kilograms of groundnuts in Bougouni and from farmers in nearby villages. She retails the products at the great market in Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele mostly made up of women.

Thanks to this loan, Adiara expects to make an average profit of 17,500 CFA francs a month. She will use it to repay the loan, and any amount left will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Cecilia es una persona ya separada D. su esposo desD. hace  cinco años tiene un hijo D. 7 años Edwar la señora trabaja en el aeropuerto D. Viru Viru que esta como a 45 minutos D. la ciudad y a hora y media D. su casa se D. su padre ya que no tiene casa propia y vive en la casa D. sus padres ella trata D. superarse pero el sueldo no es mucho y para ayudarse con sus ingresos

Ella necesita capital porque quiere poner una pensión para vender comidas en las noches porque su horario D. trabajo es hasta las 4 D. la tarD., así poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su hijo
texts.en:
Claudia Cecilia has been separated from her husband for five years now; she has a 7-year-old son, Edwar.  She works at the Viru Viru airport which is located about 45 minutes from the city and an hour and a half from her father’s house; since she does not have a house of her own and lives with her parents.  She tries to get ahead but her salary isn’t very large and she tries to help herself to earn income.

She needs the capital because she wants to set up a meal preparation business to sell meals at night because her work day ends at 4pm and she can improve her and her son’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to set up a food selling business.

loans.name: Bruna

texts.en:
Bruna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Bruna has a food shop that sells waffles, hot cakes & serves coffee. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making waffles & hot cakes.

Bruna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bruna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making waffles & hot cakes.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Janice works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing.

Janice is seeking to borrow 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. Janice explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through 4 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts so that she can repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Leonida is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF, all of which she has repaid. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis, es agricultor, es soltero, vive con sus padres, él tiene 10 años de estar cultivando la tierra, aprendió por medio de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta la fecha no tiene problemas con esta actividad que año a año realiza.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas para tratar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con esta compra podrá dar un buen cuido a la plantación y tendrá menos riesgo que una plaga se la dañe.
Su propósito es ayudar a sus padres con el trabajo diario, poder tener una buena producción para también garantizarle alimentación para un largo plazo, así como también comercializar parte de esta para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer.   He’s single and lives with his parents.  He’s been farming the land for ten years.  He learned from his father and works every day from 6am until 3pm. To date, he’s had no problems with this activity that he carries out year to year.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy manure and herbicides to treat his corn and bean crops.  With this purchase he will be able to provide good care to his plants and have less risk of their being damaged by some infestation.

His goal is to help his parents with his daily work to be able to have a good crop yield and also to guarantee their food supply for a long time as well as to sell part of it to earn profits.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has 3 children. She has received a junior high level of education. She sells food items like tomatoes, okra, eggs, groundnut pastes and others. Having to take care of her children has not been easy, and so a loan will enable her to expand her business to be able to take proper care of her family.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase food items to sell. Her future plan towards her business is to build a better shop.

loans.use: purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза жительница города Исфары. Она не замужем. Ей 22 года. Она живет вместе с родителями. У нее среднее образование. Фируза занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном продает салфетки, полотенце, спальное белье и скатерти. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности. Она хочет закупить сухофрукты.
texts.en: Firuza lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 22 years, not married and lives together with her parents.  She has a secondary education.  Firuza is involved in sales at the market.  She primarily sells napkins, towels, bedding and table cloth.  She is requesting this loan in order to expand her business.  She wants to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta D. productos D. cemento, como: fuentes, columnas, planchas para inodoro, entre muchas cosas mas, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela  pues su producto es muy creativo y los clientes siempre encuentran lo que necesitan y sino ella lo hace, además todo es D. muy buena calidad y a buenos precios, el servicio es excelente pues María es una mujer muy amable y carismática con las personas, para ella el trabajo es una bendición en su vida y la excelencia en el mismo, no es un acto sino un habito que ejerce día con día, quiere mantener y hacer crecer el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, hierro, acero y arena. María Magdalena tiene fe que su arduo trabajo le permitirá darle sostenimiento económico a su familia y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: María Magdalena is forty four years old. She lives with her life's companion and her children in her own house. She sells cement products such as: fountains, columns, and toilet mounts, among other things. She has gained a lot of customers because her products are very creative and the customers always find what they need, or else she makes it. In addition, everything is good quality and at a good price and the service is good. Maria is a very friendly and charismatic woman with people. For her, work is life's blessing and excellence isn't just one action but something she practices every day. She wants to maintain and grow her business and that is why she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan. This will allow her to buy cement, iron, steel and sand. María Magdalena has faith that her hard work will allow her to support her family financially and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron and steel.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Edgar Alejandro

texts.es:
El joven Edgar Alejandro es soltero, tiene 22 años de edad, curso las estudios de bachillerato, se dedica a la confección de pantalones de lona, inició este trabajo gracias al apoyo de sus padres, y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas de lona y poder producir mas, y obtener mejores ganancias en el futuro espera que su negocio sea prospero.
texts.en:
Young Edgar Alejandro is 22 years old, single and has a high school education.  He has a business making canvas trousers, which he started with his parents' help eight years ago.

He is requesting a loan to buy canvas fabric so he can increase production and improve his earnings.  He wants his business to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza nació en la ciudad de Potosí, actualmente radica en la localidad de San Jose, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras hace bastantes años, e casada su esposo Jesús  es albañil cuentan  con un  hijo que es menor de edad, han solicitado un crédito para la compra de  frutas ya que esta llegando la época de la manga, piña,  comprara con el dinero frutas de temporada, es cliente antigua y responsable por lo tanto nuevamente están muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo económico que les ha brindado  para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Esperanza was born in the city of Potosí, and now lives in the town of San Jose.  She has sold vegetables for many years now.  She is married, her husband Jesús is a bricklayer, and they have one dependent child.  They have requested a loan to buy fruit since the season for mango and pineapple is coming up.  They will purchase seasonal fruit with the money.  She is a former client and therefore responsible.  They are again grateful to the institution for the financial support they have provided to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Safenaz

texts.en:
Safenaz is a 37 years old young woman. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Safenaz wants to purchase new home furniture such as bedroom furniture, living room seats, etc. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the furniture, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Safenaz gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and provide better living conditions for her family. 

Safenaz is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Vicitacion Nancy

texts.es:
Vicitacion es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Warakaq, tiene 35 años, es casada, madre de 4 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 04 años.
Vicitacion, tiene una bodega, gracias a los préstamos de FINCA Peru ella implementó su negocio, comprando abarrotes  variados. Le encanta las capacitaciones que se realizan en su Banco Comunal porque gracias a ello aprendió ahorrar, a cuidar a su familia, los buenos valores como ser responsable y puntual.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de abarrotes tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, etc. Su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta convertir su tienda en Mayorista.
texts.en:
Vicitacion is a member of the Muchuy Warakaq Communal Bank, is 35 years old, married, a mother of 4, and has been a member with FINCA Peru for four years now.
Vicitacion has a store and thanks to FINCA Peru's loan she was able to begin her business buying various groceries. She enjoys the training that is done in her communal bank because she has learned to how save money, take care of her family, and good values such as how to be responsible and punctual.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, carbonated drinks, etc. Her goal is to expand her business and turn her store into a wholesale store.

loans.use: buy groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, carbonated drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
osé es un hombre casado, tiene dos hijos mayores  de edad, el tiene 41 años de edad, él se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi, eligio este tipo de trabajo porque le es muy rentable.
José es un hombre trabajador, responsable y luchador que día a día busca salir adelante por su familia.

José vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

José ,  empezó su negocio en el año 2007 , gana semanalmente S/.300 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1600 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, José invertirá el crédito en la compra de su propia moto, el  sueño del señor José es mejorar el nivel de él y de sus hijos y tener su propio auto, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .
texts.en:
Jose is a 41 year-old married man with 2 grown children. He has a business providing taxi transportation services.  He chose this type of work because it is very profitable.

Jose is a hardworking, responsible and tenacious man who strives daily to get ahead for his family.

Jose lives and works in Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the Jose's home and business.

Jose started his business in 2007, and earns 300 Peruvian soles per week.  With the loan of 1,600 Peruvian soles that he will receive thanks to Kiva, Jose will purchase his own motorcycle.  Jose's dream is to improve his family's standard of living and have his own automobile.  His loan officer thinks he is an excellent client.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en: Jeralyn is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in Pantaon, Ozamis City. For the last 10 years, she has earned about PHP 5,000 a month by growing fruits and vegetables. She joined GDMPC earlier this year as a way to gain access to financial services that would help her improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to grow a larger banana crop. This is her first loan from GDMPC and she plans to use the additional income she earns to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand the size of her banana crop.

loans.name: Duo Raquel Group

texts.es:
DUO    RAQUEL
Este dúo esta doña Dina Floridalma, de 36 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos ambos están estudiando, ella nos cuenta que necesita este crédito para incrementar sus ingresos en esta época ya que vende refacciones también y necesita comprar productos comestibles para la elaboración de sus comidas, y comprar todo lo posible, entonces quiere este crédito para comprar su producto por mayor para que le quede más ganancias además por la fecha navideña ella quiere vender platillos  de la época y llevan más condimentos, también está la líder de este grupo quien es doña MariAngela, casada, tiene 2 hijos y ella es dueña de una venta de verduras y tomates, en el mercado de su comunidad donde vive desde hace 8 años, nos cuenta que está solicitando este crédito porque necesita vender productos y condimentos de la época navideña y tambien para comprar verduras como tomates y otros ya que su clientela le está solicitando ese tipo de productos, nos cuenta que la inversión que va  a tener es bastante porque espera que fape pueda brindarle su apoyo nuevamente ya que está muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido de la institución, y espera no defraudar a aquellos que la ayudan.
texts.en:
Duo Raquel 

This duo includes Dina Floridalam, who is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, who are both studying. She told us that she needs this loan to increase her profits during this season because she is selling snacks as well and needs to buy groceries to make her snacks and to buy everything possible. So she wants this loan to be able to buy products at wholesale so that she ends up with greater profits. She also wants to sell seasonal dishes for the Christmas season and these require more seasonings. 

There is also the leader of this group, MariAngela, who is married with two children. She is the owner of a vegetable and tomato sales business in the market in her community where she has lived for 8 years. She told us that she is requesting this loan because she needs to sell products and seasonings for the Christmas season as well as to buy vegetables, like tomatoes and others, because her clientele is asking for these types of products. She tells us that the investment she will have is large because she hopes that FAPE can provide further support. She is very thankful for the support she has already received from the institution and she hopes that she will not disappoint those who help her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
La vivienda del señor José Gilberto se filtra el agua cada vez que llueve y lo que la humedad ha provocado que sus muebles estén ya en malas condiciones y partes de las paredes de su casa se estén deteriorando. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo y así tendrá mejor protección en la casa y su salud. Ya que es divorciado y sus hijos ya están casados tiene su propia familia. 
Don José Gilberto trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga de una compañía de trasportes, este el ingreso que obtiene y con el cual planea pagar este crédito, ya que desea mejorar su patrimonio y que pronto será de uno de sus hijos.
texts.en: The home of Jose Gilberto has a roof that leaks water every time it rains, and the humidity has damaged his furniture and parts of the walls are deteriorating.    Jose is requesting a loan to fix his roof so that it can better protect his home and his health.  Jose is divorced and his children are now married and live with their own families.  He works as a truck driver, and will use the income from his job to repay the loan.   He would like to fix his home which will soon belong to one of his children.

loans.use: to make the roof of his home water proof.

loans.name: C4914 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Euphrem is 28 years old and is single. He sells shoes in his business which is open from 7am until 6pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. He has had three years of experience in this business. Euphrem is the leader of the group which is called "C4914 Abahuje" in the local language.

Euphrem has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With this profit, Euphrem will save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Shirley has been in this business for ten years. Shirley earns additional income from selling used clothing.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 23, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and rubber cultivation for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 15 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Saran is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizer to use in rubber cultivation. This money will help her plants grow well and provide a high yield of rubber. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use in rubber cultivation.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: JUAN RAMON: Es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad con deseos de superación. Originario del empalme de Columbus, que se localiza aproximadamente a 85 kilómetros de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casado, tiene un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Desde su infancia se dedica a labores agropecuarias ayudándole a sus padres. Solicita financiamiento, para ir creando poco a poco su patrimonio y sacar adelante a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara cerdos lechones y vacas para su engorde y comercialización. Sueña con sembrar granos básicos.

loans.use: para comprar cerdos lechones y vacas para su engorde y comercialización

loans.name: Vieira

texts.en:
Vieira José Manuel A., age 30, native of Marracune, province of Maputo, grew up under the care of his grandparents. The family's financial situation created few opportunities for him to study. Since the year 2000, he has taken on the management of the family business completely and has a commercial establishment. Since 2003, through referrals by friends and neighbors, he learned of Hluvuku-Adsema, and approached them to request a loan to expand his business.

Since then, his work has become much more active, and he has requested various other loans. Currently, his business is going at a good pace, and it provides a job to 3 workers (two women and one man). With the income from the business, he meets his family's needs, and school expenses, since he has enrolled them in a private school.

With a loan of 40,900 meticais, he plans to increase the volume of the business in order to prevent problems during the holiday season, since the demand has been greater, but on the other hand, he will bring in 2 (two) more people in order to be able to respond to the customer demand.

His work has a greater impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for himself plus four other people, he brings goods closer to the customers, particularly for the nearly 1,700 students of the neighboring school for whom he provides snacks.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Guachene, Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Vieira José Manuel A. Sector de Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo: 40.930,00 Mtn (1,574.00 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Inicio: 13/11/2006 Fim: 12/11/2007 Vieira José Manuel A. de 30 anos de idade, natural de Marracune, província de Maputo, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos avos, a situação financeira da família lhe criou poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde o ano 2000 vem assumindo na íntegra a gestão do negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial. A partir do ano 2003, por indicação de amigos e vizinhos teve conhecimento da existência Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo se aproximado e solicitado um empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio Desde então, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinâmica tendo solicitado vários outros empréstimo. Actualmente o seu negocio está num bom ritmo e providencia emprego a 3 trabalhadores (duas mulheres e um homem), com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares uma vez que matriculou –se numa escola privada.

Com o empréstimo de 40.900,00 mtn, pretende aumentar o volume do negocio de forma a evitar ruptura durante quadra festiva pois a procura tem sido maior, por outro lado irá admitir mais 2(duas) pessoas de forma a responder positivamente com as exigência dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para além de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais outras quatro pessoas, coloca o produto mais perto do cliente, com particular destaque para cerca dos 1,700 alunos da escola vizinha que lhes providencia lanches.

loans.use: Selling Food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tailoring business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a cattle rancher from Salitre. He wants to invest the money he receives from the loan in pesticides for rice and raising pigs. He commercializes the rice and pigs himself by traveling and selling to the nearby city of Milagro. He has one son who is in school. He wants to buy a truck in the future with the extra money he makes. He also hopes he can continue to provide an education for his 15 year old son.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment
