Elles se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de commerce d’articles divers : pâte d’arachide, condiments, préparation et vente de jus de fruits, le tricotage de la laine etc.
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits, afin de satisfaire en quantité et en qualité la clientèle, qui devient de plus nombreuse et exigeante, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui  elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce prêt, SAMADJE B., compte acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes variétés auprès des forains venant de Sikasso et  de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente, en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Laidou II is a group of five married women living in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and hubands. They have an average age of 28 years and 3 children and live in Heremakono-Nord in the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through community and business ties.  They sell various items: peanut paste, condiments, hand-knit wools etc.  They also prepare and sell fruit juices.  Intending to buy more products to meet the quantity and quality expectations of their customer base, which is increasing and becoming more demanding, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan. SAMADJE BAGAYOO intends to purchase different types of condiments from vendors from Sikasso and Bamako with this loan. She sells her goods at retail, for cash and on credit in the BOUGOUNI market to a clientele composed mainly of women.  She expects to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA with this loan of which a part will be used in the business and the remainder for her children's education expenses.

loans.use: Purchase condiments

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en: Tsogtbaatar L. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 19 and 12, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in an apartment. Both of his children attend a local secondary school and Tsogtbaatar and his wife operate a clothes-making and repair business out of a rented space at the Bayangol department store. Tsogtbaatar started the business in 2007 after working as a driver at the local transportation business between 2004 and 2007. He is a modest and honest man who says, "I want to continue operating our business at a stable level to provide higher education for my children." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for his clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: La Alternativa 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Alina is a divorced mother of 3 children. She is running a sales business, where she sells different products like cosmetics, shoes, accessories, and clothing. This activity allows her to support her family. With this particular loan, she will invest in her business by buying more of those products. Her future plans are to have a wholesale store and to have enough money to give her children all their needs and to pay for their degree studies.

Alina is just one member of the 10 person group, La Alternativa 4 & 5. Together, these Dominican entrepreneurs are able unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. Alina decided to make business with Esperanza because she needed to bring extra income to her house. Alina started her business with her first loan from Esperanza.

This Esperanza associate began with us around 5 years ago, and this is her 11th loan. All previous loans have been paid and invested in her business. Her story is representative of this group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. sells food supplies like 'gari' (quick-cooking cassava grits) at Breman near Elmina. Adjoa has not received any formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Adjoa has been selling food supplies like 'gari' for four years. She assists her husband in supporting the household. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more food supplies for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: buy more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha M. is a 40-year-old husband. He was born in the village of Sockolia, in northern Sierra Leone. Currently, he lives in Kabala town with his wife and two children. Mustapha has been a businessman for five years. He produces and sells balusters. Mustapha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 SLL from Kiva field partner Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy cement, iron rods, and sand in order to produce a larger quantity of balusters for sale.

loans.use: To buy materials to make balusters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bananas, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Mendsuren

texts.en:
Mendsuren is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children, aged between 10 and 15, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer districts of the city. Her children attend public school. Her husband works as a top sergeant at a local squad of soldiers.

Mendsuren supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She began her business in 2002. Her business has grown so that today she has 2,000,000 Mongollian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She has been successfully expanding her business and has been able to improve her living conditions. She bought a car for her husband in 2008 and built her small house in 2009 with her business earnings. With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, she’ll purchase more coats for spring from Beijing, the capital city of China.

She wants to improve her business with this loan, and to be able to expand her small house.

loans.use: To purchase more coats for spring.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Кучарова Зулхумор проживает в районе Яван. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Зулхумор занимается растениеводством, она в основном выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян и топлива для трактора. Она берет кредит для весеннего посева.
texts.en: Zulkhumor K. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 42 years old, married and has 7 children.  Her husband is working in Russia.  Zulkhumor is involved in agriculture.  She primarily grows vegetables.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase seeds and fuel for a tractor.  She is requesting the loan for the spring sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Jipargul's Group

texts.en:
Jipargul K. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a small village in the Isykul region.  Jipargul is 41 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons and a daughter. All the children are in school. 

Jipargul's family is engaged in farming.  They cultivate agricultural products and make money by selling the harvest. In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, Jipargul also sells homemade food and drinks.  Jipargul has applied for this loan because her family needs money to purchase fertilizers and a variety of seeds for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
La señora Flavia A. López vive en un lugar llamado Miguel Hidalgo que es Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada con el señor  Marcial Estrada Vázquez, con quien procreo tres hijos  que  un están a su responsabilidad y son: Omar de veinte años de edad, Cecilia  de quince años y  la más pequeña es  Ermisenda de diez años.

     El préstamo que ella solicito es para invertirlo en la compra de marranos chicos  para luego engordarlo y venderlo aliñado (destazado), en la  misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva  nueve años y ocho meses lo que nos comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos.

     Ella y su esposo iniciaron esta actividad para poder apoyarse con sus ingresos, y aunque Marcial trabaja en el campo sembrando milpas, ella también quiere aportar y juntos sacar adelante a su pequeña familia.

     Su más grande deseo es que con la bendición de Dios siga trabajando para así lograr tener horros para apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando y logren terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flavia A. López lives in a place called Miguel Hidalgo which is a municipality in Copainala in the state of Chiapas in Mexico.  She’s married to Mr. Marcial Estrada Vázquez with whom she’s had three children who are in her care.  They are: Omar, 20, Cecilia, 15 and the youngest, Ermisenda, 10.

The loan she requested is to invest in the purchase of piglets to fatten up and sell butchered in the same locality.  She’s been in this business for nine years and 8 months and she commented to us that she does well and it has produced good income.

She and her husband started this business to earn income and, although Marcial works in the fields planting corn, she also wants to contribute so that together they can raise their small family.

Her greatest wish is that, with God’s blessings, she will continue working in order to have savings so that her children can stay in school and manage to finish a career.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for subsequent resale in her community.

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.es:
Eriberta nació en la ciudad del Taray del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 34 años edad, es casada y tiene cuatro  hijos. Actualmente, Eriberta vive en la ciudad Taray y ella nos cuenta que en el mes de febrero del año 2010 la ciudad de Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. (Taray se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Su actividad económica principal de Eriberta es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y otros más.  En esta oportunidad Eriberta requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas  y otros más.  
     
Eriberta pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio de año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Eriberta was born in the city of Taray, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 34 years old, married, and has four children.  Currently, Eriberta lives in the city of Taray and she tells us that in February 2010 the city of Taray suffered a natural disaster as the river flooded its banks.  Residents lost their businesses and their houses collapsed.  (Taray is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and is noted for its beautiful landscapes and for its tourism, agriculture and livestock raising).

Eriberta's main business activity is raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  On this occasion, Eriberta needs a loan to buy animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

Eriberta is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Señor de la Agonía de Taray” community bank which has been operating for four and a half years and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Erika Adriana

texts.es: Erika es una mujer que tiene cierto tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad. La venta de granos básicos es su principal fuente de ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Desde hace mas de 2 años, que tiene este negocio, la buena administración que tiene han hecho que salga adelante. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, concentrado, aceite y sorgo pues se acerca la temporada de invierno.
texts.en: Erika has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for some time and this is not her first loan since she is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her work. She has sold basic grains for over 2 years and it is the main source of income for her home and her good management has made her business prosper. This is why she needs the loan, to buy raw materials like rice, beans, sugar, corn, bullion powder, oil and sorghum since the winter season is coming.

loans.use: buy raw materials like rice, beans, sugar, corn, bullion powder, oil and sorghum since winter season is coming .

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha Lidia es una mujer muy emprendedora que cuenta con su propio negocio desde hace 3 años denominado “Miscelánea La Estrella” donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos y mas todo para la necesidad del cliente. Martha es madre de 3 pequeños a quienes desea ofrecer lo mejor y mayor atención, por tal motivo opto por trabajar en su propia casa para atenderlos sin ningún problema. Su esposo trabaja como mecánico en un maquiladora de ciudad y de esta manera entre los dos cubren los gastos de hogar. Para que su negocio sea prosperado necesita comprar mercancía para el negocio para tener mayor variedad.
texts.en: Martha Lidia is a very enterprising woman who has had her own business, called “Miscelánea La Estrella,” for three years.  She sells groceries in general like snacks, soft drinks and everything else a customer needs.  Martha is the mother of three little ones that she wants to provide the best for and care for them more attentively.  Because of this she opted for a home-based business so she could watch over them easily.  Her husband works as a mechanic at an assembly plant in the city and this way, between the two of them, they are able to cover household expenses.  So that her business will continue to prosper she needs to buy merchandise to have greater variety.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 38 years old, single and lives with her sister who works with her.

Azhar has had a children's nursery since 2009. She has good experience in the childcare field and a good reputation. She is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for her nursery. She is optimistic about her business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring her positive growth.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for her nursery.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy, 52 years old, is a housewife. She is a single mother with four children. One is working in the factory, and her son is a motor taxi driver. They can make $11 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $20 on transportation, $15 on electricity and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for another son who is also a motor taxi driver. 

In the future she would like to have a tailoring shop at her house if her children can help with the expense, because every expense in the family is dependent on three of her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has three children.
Haydar has owned a mechanical lathe workshop since 1991. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, él es empleado de la policía nacional, tiene 11 años de prestar servicio para dicha institución.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en muebles para el hogar, ya que necesita equipar mejor su vivienda, ofreciéndole a su familia una mayor comodidad, el recurre a los prestamos porque su salario no cubre toda la necesidad que tiene, por lo mismo espera cancelar oportunamente las cuotas.
Espera en Dios que le conceda continuar en el trabajo, para que su familia este más segura económicamente, y que sus hijos sientan el apoyo para poderse desarrollar en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family, which is composed of his spouse and their three children.  He is an employee of the national police and has worked there for 11 years.

He is asking for a loan to invest in furniture for his home, since he needs to better furnish his home and offer his family a greater level of comfort.  He is turning to loans because his salary does not cover everything he needs, and he plans to make his payments on time.  He hopes that God will let him continue at his job, so that his family will be more economically secure, and his children will feel the support needed to be able to develop in society.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his home.

loans.name: Patience Group

texts.en: This is 71 year-old Margaret (center) from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is widowed with five children and also cares for four dependents. Margaret runs a flea market business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are shortage of working capital and clients who do not pay on time. Margaret has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothing and footwear to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay her dependents' school fees. In the future Margaret plans to buy a business car.

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear for sale

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en: Gulpari is 40. She is married and has two sons. Her husband works as a taxi driver, but the main financial income in their family comes from Gulpari's poultry business. She usually sells chicken in the central Bilasuvar bazaar and her monthly income is about 100 USD. She would like to increase her profit so she applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This will help to purchase more chicken and improve the quality of life in her family. Gulpari has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Dolores Marleny

texts.es:
Dolores, vive con sus padres, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos, la casa donde vive es de sus padres, su negocio es la venta de plásticos y flores, su puesto de venta está ubicado en el mercado municipal, los productos que ofrece son platos, tasas plásticas, cosméticos, juguetes y flores artificiales.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de flores, juguetes, cantaros plásticos, platos y vasos, con esta compra aumentara su negocio, ofreciendo a los clientes diversidad de productos, con la esperanza de tener mejores ventas.
Actualmente su objetivo es terminar la construcción de su casa, ver a sus hijos vivir en lo propio y cómodamente.
texts.en:
Dolores lives with her parents. She is a single mother and she has three children. The house where she lives belongs to her parents. She engages in selling plastic and flowers in a stall located in the municipal market. She sells plastic dishes, plastic cups, cosmetics, toys and artificial flowers.
She is requesting a loan to buy flowers, toys, plastic jugs, dishes and glasses. This purchase will stock up her stall and she will be able to offer different products to her customers, and she hopes that her sales will increase.
Her current goal is to finish building her house, in order to see her children live comfortably in a place of their own.

loans.use: To buy plastic flowers, toys, plastic jugs, dishes and glasses.

loans.name: Ladylyn

texts.en:
Ladylyn is 24 years old and lives with her husband and her one child. She lives in San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga sel Norte, Philippines.

Ladylyn works in agriculture growing vegetables like okra and eggplant. She buys and sells her products in in Rizal Public Market. She earns Php 3000 a month and has been engaged in this line of business for a year.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, supplies and fertilizer for her crops. The loan will help her to buy what she needs. She encounters problems such as pests. Her dream is to buy more land to increase production.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eulogia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un carro que hace servicio publico, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de pasto y negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de transporte, negocio de venta de pasto y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales, pasto y para el mantenimiento de su carro.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the "Kanchary" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Eulogia is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her transport business.  She has a car which she uses to provide a public transport service.  She also sells fodder and raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and hens.  Through these small businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  Eulogia would like to expand and improve her transport business, her fodder business and her animal business.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals and fodder, and to have her car serviced.

Eulogia is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals and fodder, and to have her car serviced

loans.name: Diamoral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le07 JUIN 2001. Il  est  constitué de dix. femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Fatou Bintou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge six autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et légumes.. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 7, 2001. It consists of ten women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is trade.

Mrs. Fatou Bintou is the head of the group. She is standing at the far right in the photo, with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and married with two children, and she also has six other children entrusted to her by relatives.

She sells fruits and vegetables. She has a good command of this activity in which she has several years of experience. 

She will use this loan to strengthen her capital and better expand her activities.

The profits will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions (education, etc.).

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mariétou Tabaski

texts.fr: Madame Mariétou habite au Sénégal. Elle a choisi comme activité le commerce et gère une boutique ou elle commercialise des vaisselles dans la localité ou elle vit. Elle a choisi son activité par amour. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis plusieurs années. Elle y a déjà contracté 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de vaisselles  qui seront destinées a renforcer son  stock dans la boutique. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux se prendre en charge et aussi de soutenir les membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariétou lives in Senegal. She has chosen to work as a retailer and she manages a shop selling crockery in her neighborhood. She chose this work as she enjoys it very much. 

She has been a  member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC for several years. Through U-IMCEC she has already received 2 previous loans. She is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to buy crockery in order to increase the stock in her shop. Earning more profit will allow her to better meet her expenses and also to support the members of her family.

loans.use: to buy crockery for re-sale.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
el sr. Genaro tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado y de su matrimonio todavía tiene 4 hijos que dependen de él,  Genaro se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura y caficultura, Junto a su esposa han logrado salir adelante,  son personas muy emprendedoras y con muchos deseo de superación, Don Genaro utilizara el credito  para la compra de un sistema solar, ya que toda su vida han anhelado gozar del servicio de energía eléctrica y no han podido hacer realidad este deseo.
asi podran mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Genaro is fifty-six, married and still has four children that he supports.  All his life he has made his living in agriculture and coffee-growing. He and his wife have managed to be successful. They are very enterprising people with a great desire to overcome. Genaro will use his loan to buy a solar energy system because all his life he has dreamed of enjoying electric power and has never been able to realize his dream. This way he'll be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 35 years old, and lives in Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three children. Edna has a piggery business and earns approximately PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase pigs, feed, and vitamins. Edna has been a member of PMPC for eight months. In the future, Edna hopes to earn more for the preparation of her monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and soap for resale. In the future, Pili aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Pili has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and soap for resale.

loans.name: Fatima Lisseth

texts.es: Fátima Lisseth es una joven emprendedora que ha creado con mucho esfuerzos su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, a sus 21 años de edad ha desempeñado muy bien su actividad económica, ella aprendió este negocio por una amiga y le gusto, ya tiene clientes fijos que la visitan y le compran los productos que les ofrece. Actualmente Fátima está solicitando  crédito con el objetivo de incrementar mercadería como; ropa, zapato, cosméticos, chinelas entre otros productos que sus clientes demandan en este tiempo que las ventas incrementan, aumentando de igual manera sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fátima Lisseth is an enterprising young woman who has through much effort created her business which is the sale of general merchandise. At 21 years of age she has established her business very well. She learned this business from a friend and liked it. She now has regular customers who visit her and buy the products she has for sale. 

Currently Fátima is seeking a loan for the purpose of adding merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and sandals, among other products requested by her customers during this time period when sales go up. Likewise she will add customers as well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and sandals, among other products.

loans.name: 04.10.9 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Thúy operates a manufacturing business sewing clothes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth in order to offer a tailor-made and clothing repair service.

Thúy is 32 years old.  She is married with two children.  Thúy is the group leader of the 04.10.9 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hoa Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Thúy’s first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Thúy has been involved in this business for five years.  The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With the profit from her business, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with 2 children. Ronie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ronie hopes to improve his business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La señora Octavia, es una persona de 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada, no alcanzo a estudiar una educación escolar, cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, produce papa, haba y cebada en sus propios terrenos que una parte cuenta con riesgo por inundación las cuales se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Pucara Chico del municipio de Tíraque distante a unos 72 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Octavia y su familia manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de reposición por la compra de terreno agrícola y de tal forma producir mayor cantidad y a partir de ello obtener mayores ingresos económicos que van a mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Octavia, 55, is married and has no formal education.  She has three dependent children and earns a living farming crops such as potatoes, lima beans and barley on her own land.  Part of the land, which is in the community of Pucara Chico in the municipality of Tíraque, some 72 kms from Cochabamba, is in dange of flooding.  Octavia and her family claim to be hard-working, responsible people who want to increase their farming production.  Therefore, they are requesting a loan to buy more farmland to produce more crops and increase their income.  This will improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, three of whom are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Evelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, etc

loans.name: Katy Kayana

texts.es: KATY KAYANA: Es una señora jovial, de 26 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Desde hace 2 años, vende ropa nueva y calzado en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, de esta manera genera sus propios ingresos, contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua: blusas y pantalones para mujeres y hombres, también para comprar en Masaya calzado y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela en Bilwi. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa de concreto con mejores condiciones para su familia, ya que donde habita actualmente se encuentra en condiciones inadecuadas.

loans.use: para comprar en Managua: blusas y pantalones para mujeres y hombres, también para comprar en Masaya calzado

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: A 56 years old, Mrs. Ruth I. is a specialist in sales of fruits and rice, a business she started thirteen (13) year ago. She is eager to expand her business with $500.

loans.use: To buy fruits and Rice for sale

loans.name: Lokossi

texts.en:
At 64 years of age, Mrs. Lokossi M. is a widow with five (05) children in her care. She has lived in Agbanakin for twenty years with her family. The production and marketing of palm nut oil generates income for her, and is a business she engages in with passion and love. It is a tiresome job in that it requires removing the shells and sorting the nuts before using them. But often she does not produce a large quantity of oil due to a lack of means.

To make her work more profitable so as to feed herself and her family and to have financial autonomy, Mrs. M. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy a nutcracker which will allow her to shell the nuts. The rest of the amount will allow her to stock up on nuts and to buy cans for the packaging of her oil. She will then always have oil to sell and can increase her sales.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 64 ans, Madame M. Lokossi est veuve avec cinq enfants en charge. Elle vit à Agbanakin depuis vingt ans avec sa famille. La production et la commercialisation d’huile de noix palmiste constituent son activité génératrice de revenus qu’elle exerce avec passion et amour. C’est une activité très pénible dans la mesure où il faut enlever la coque, trier les noix avant d’en faire usage. Mais souvent elle n’en produit pas en grande quantité faute de moyens.

Pour rentabiliser cette activité afin de pouvoir se nourrir, nourrir sa famille et avoir une autonomie financière, Madame M. demande un crédit de $650 afin d’acheter une concasseuse qui lui permettra de concasser les noix. Le reste de la somme lui servira de stocker des noix et d’acheter des bidons pour le conditionnement de son huile. Elle pourra alors disposer à tout moment d’huile et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.

loans.use: To buy a nutcracker, canner, and to stock up on palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to make remodeling improvements and to purchase cooking utensils.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Mrs Oum P. is a farmer in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She earns 1 dollar a day. Her husband is a moror-taxi driver and earns 6 dollars a day. His motorbike is now broken. They have 4 children. Two of them are still students.
Mrs Oum P. wants to purchase a motorbike to allow her husband to continue his job. In the future, she would like to purchase land to expand her farm. In the picture, we can see Mrs Oum P., her parents and a credit officer.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to allow her husband to continue to run his business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 30-year-old mother of three, a resident of the Buguruni community in the Dar Es Salaam area. She sells common traditional attire known as kanga and Vitenge. (The yellow and black one she is putting on is called kanga in Swahili). She buys her stock from Kariakoo, Dar Es Salaam’s trading powerhouse and sells in the Buguruni area as a retailer. She also owns a small restaurant in addition to her clothing business.

She has been in business for the past two years, and it has helped her to support her children at school since she is a single mother. She is in need of USD 400 to help boost her business.

loans.use: Boost her business

loans.name: Pedro León

texts.es:
Pedro León left his town 8 years ago. The reason for this was that he was in an accident in which he lost his arm and the time he needed for recuperation was very long, and there were no possibilities for getting ahead in his town. He moved to Reynosa (a border town) and began to sell craft items. However, this business was not enough to sustain him and his family. So, after thinking about what type of business would be best, he brought his family and they began a new business, which was a small grocery store, which has been an important help to the family.

However, they feel it is time to renovate the store in order to help their 3 children get head, since they have many expenses for school supplies and health needs. Therefore, Pedro León is requesting a loan of $575.00, which he will repay over a period of 6 months. With this money he will expand his business. With your help, Pedro will be able to achieve his dream, in spite of his physical limitations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro León salio de su pueblo hace 8 años, los motivos de su salida fueron por que tuvo un accidente en el cual perdió su brazo en un accidente, y el tiempo de recuperación fue muy largo y ya no había posibilidades de salir adelante en su pueblo. Cambió de residencia a Reynosa (una ciudad fronteriza) y comenzó a vender artesanías, sin embargo el negocio no daba para mantenerlo a él y a su familia así que después de pensar bien qué negocio les convendría se trajo a su familia, y comenzaron un nuevo negocio el cual fue la tienda de abarrotes, misma que ha sido un apoyo importante en el porvenir familiar.

Sin embargo consideran que es tiempo de renovar su tienda para poder sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos quienes tienen muchos gastos en su es sus útiles escolares y en sus necesidades de salud. Así que hoy Pedro León, está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos a un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero poder ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Pedro podrá cumplir su sueño a pesar de sus limitaciones físicas.

loans.use: To renovate the store and buy merchandise

loans.name: Abigirl

texts.en: Abigirl B. is 45 years old, married and has 6 children.  She hails from Afromedia in Lagos, Nigeria. She grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans. She has been in this business since 1984 and requests a loan of $625 to buy another grinding machine.

loans.use: To buy another grinding engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Santi

texts.en: Santi, 30, is the mother of 2 children. She has a small kiosk where she sells cell phone accessories and prepaid vouchers from various cellphone providers, earning about $5 a day. Her husband, U., sells vegetables at the market, earning about $20 a day. She is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her cell phone accessory business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K., 30, works as a fish vendor in the market and normally earns around $2.50 a day of profit. Her husband, to support the family, works raising fish and he makes around $2.50 a day, too. This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transfer the fish to the market, and some of the money will be spent on fish food and to buy more small fish to breed in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike, fish food and small fish to breed in the future

loans.name: Thersah

texts.en:
Thersah N. is a 46-year-old unmarried mother of seven children living in Offinsu, Ghana. For the past 20 years, Thersah has earned a living by selling kenkey (a traditional Ghanian food staple, similar to a dumpling, made of milled white corn) and fried fish to her community.

Thersah has applied for a loan of $825 U.S. dollars to expand her operation. She wishes to buy more bags of corn, fish, and tomatoes so she can stay open all year round. Thersah has successfully taken out one loan from Sinapi before; she used part of her extra profits to help send her daughter to a trade school.

Theresa is a member of the group called St. Anthony which uses the peer pressure principle on members to re-pay their part of the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase corn, tomatoes, and fish to sell

loans.name: Betzabet's Group

texts.es:
Lourdes, and Denisse Betzabet have belonged to the Llamkasun ("We work" in Quecha) Communal Bank for 8 years, 8 years, and 1 year respectively.

Lourdes is married, 61 years old and has eight children. She has a small grocery store in her home.

Betzabet is married, is 40 years old and has four children. Betzabet and her family have a stable of dairy cattle in the district Chiara. Betzabet sells milk at night on a busy avenue in the city of Ayacucho and also distributes it to stores and homes. With this loan and her savings, Betzabé will begin selling groceries.

Denisse is married, is 27 years old and has three children. Denisse sells clothes maD.-to-order, which she offers to friends and acquaintances.

Lourdes, Betzabet, and Denisse need this loan of $850 to purchase milk, cooking oil, sugar, rice, noodles, and men's shoes.

Lourdes Denisse, and Betzabet dream of increasing their business, building their homes, seeing their children become professionals and having a laptop computer store. Lourdes, Betzabet y Denisse pertenecen al Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa “Trabajemos” en quechua hace 8, 8, 1 años respectivamente.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer

Lourdes es casada, tiene 61 años y 8 hijos, Lourdes tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Betzabet es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Betzabet junto a su familia tienen un establo D. ganado vacuno que produce leche, en el distrito D. Chiara, Betzabet venD. la leche por las noches D. manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y además reparte a tiendas, a domicilio, Betzabe con el préstamo que obtendrá y sus ahorros iniciará con la venta D. abarrotes.

Mientras que Denisse es casada, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Denisse venD. ropa a pedido, que ofrece a amigos y conocidos.

Lourdes, Betzabet y Denisse necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, aceite, azúcar, arroz, fideo, zapatillas D. caballeros.

Los sueños D. Lourdes, Betzabet y Denisse son incrementar su negocio, construir su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda D. computadoras portátiles.

loans.use: To purchase milk, cooking oil, sugar, rice, noodles, and men's shoes.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.es:
Wilfreda is 46 years old, she did not finish high school, she speaks Aymará and Spanish, she lives with her 6 daughters, 3 of whom study at the university, 3 in high school.

She sells women’s clothing such as skirts, shirts, sweaters, polartec pullovers and other items. In addition she creates embroidered items and raises small animals such as chickens.

With the first loan she received from the Molino Communal bank for S/.300.-00 nuevos soles back in 2004, she decided to invest in a small grocery store. That store didn’t provide good earnings and didn’t go well, so she changed her business to selling clothing which is more or less profitable.

With the current loan for S/.800.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more merchandise to sell.

In light of everything she is happy with her business and her vision of the future is to capitalize on and expand her business to the important markets in cities such as Desaguadero, Huapaca San Miguel, Ilave, Puno y Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Wilfreda tiene 46 años de edad, su nivel de instrucción es secundaria incompleta, habla aymará y castellano vive con sus 6 hijas, de los cuales 3 están en superior y 3 en secundaria.

Ella desarrolla la actividad económica de venta de ropas de vestir de mujeres como son: polleras, centros, chompas, mantas polar y otros. Además realiza actividades de bordados y crianza de animales menores como pollos.

Con el primer crédito que recibió del banco Comunal Molino, fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles en el año 2004, ella decidió invertir en la pequeña tienda de bodeguita, en el cual no tuvo buenas ganancias y no le fue bien, por ello cambió de negocio en venta de ropas el cual es más o menos rentable .

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará mas mercadería para su venta

Por todo ello esta muy feliz con su negocio y su perspectiva a futuro es capitalizarse y ampliar su negocio a las ferias importantes como Desaguadero, Huapaca San Miguel, Ilave, Puno y Juliaca.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is married and has 2 children: Gonzalo, a 20-year-old who studies at the technical college in the city of Madero, and Lourdes, a 5-year-old preschool student. She started the business because she wished to help her husband with the household expenses and because she wanted to make her own money and become independent. In retail, she was able to find a pleasant way of life.

She started back in February of 2004, when a promoter invited her to help her sell shoes by catalogue. Since she was successful, she decided to become independent in April of 2006, thus being able to keep all her profits, not just a percentage.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to purchase more merchandise and fill her customers’ orders. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Gonzalo de 20 años, estudia en el Tecnológico de Cd. Madero y Lourdes de 5 años estudiante de pre-primaria. Inició el negocio por el deseo de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y además tener un ingreso propio ya que le gusta ser independiente, y en las ventas encontro un estilo de vida de agradable.

Comenzó en Febrero de 2004, cuando una promotora la invitó a que le ayudara a vender zapatos por catalogo y como le empezó a ir bien decidío independizarse definitivamente en Abril de 2006 y así obtener el total de las ganancias y no solo un porcentaje.

Ella neecesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (footwear)

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 38 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells provisions and drinks. She learned this business for 6 months from her mother and started her own business in 2006. Joy O. is requesting the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale. She says thanks to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en:
Dasola S., 40, is married with four children. She sells food products; Elubo (grinded dried yam), palm and vegetable oil, and garri. These foods are used in the preparation of major Nigerian foods. She started selling these items in 2000.

Dasola is requesting a loan to buy more garri, palm and vegetable oil and increase her sales and profits. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food (Elubo, palm oil and vegetable oil and garri) for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena tiene 38 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es viuda y madre de dos hijos (un varón de 17 años y una mujer de 13 años de edad). Vive en Jr. San Antonio Nº 293, distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Puno. 

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Con este crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 02 casilleros de gaseosas con S/.60, 02 cajas de galletas con S/.50, 02 paquetes de gaseosa corriente con S/.30 y otros.

A los 20 años de edad tuvo una pareja que lamentablemente falleció cuando gestaba su primer hijo, después de 04 años estuvo con un segundo compromiso quien la abandonó con su hija, entonces ella asumió el rol de padre y madre para sus hijos. A los 22 años de edad empezó a vender carne de alpaca, ovino y llevaba directamente a la ciudad de Tacna. Desde hace 07 años instaló una tienda de abarrotes, la cual hasta la fecha viene trabajando.

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes surtiendo con más productos, así mismo que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elena is 38 years old. She completed her primary schooling, and is a widow with two children (one of whom in 17 and the other of whom is 13). She lives in Jr. San Antonio in the district of Ilave in the provice of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Generation 200" in Mazocruz. With this loan of S. 500, which will be repaid in 4 installments), she will buy 2 cases of sodas, 2 boxes of cookies, among other things. At 20 years old she married, but it did not work out. Four years later she once again married, this time to a man who abandoned her with her daughter. From then on she has assumed the role of both mother and father to her children. At 22 she began to sell meat directly to the city of Tacna. For the past 7 years, she has had a grocery store, at which she is currently working. Her goal is to buy a house in the city and to expand her grocery store by supplying it with more products. This way her children will be able to study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soda, cookies, et cetera

loans.name: Krong

texts.en: Mrs. Krong N., 34, is a farmer who also breeds ducks to sell their eggs. She earns approximately 15,000 Riel ($3.75) per day. She is married to Mr. Tha Pat, 59, who makes a living fishing in Tolesap Lake, the largest in Cambodia and one which contains lots of fish. Normally, Krong buys baby ducks from breeders and fattens them up for two or three months so that they can provide eggs. Her business is going well but she needs money to buy baby ducks and feed for them. She is applying for a loan to make these purchases.

loans.use: to purchase baby ducks and food for them to eat

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song S., 34, is married and lives with her husband (pictured in the photo) and four children in the Siem Reap, Cambodia. Three of the children are students, while the fourth one is still too young to attend school. Song is a housewife, looking after her children and cooking food for the family. Besides doing the housework, she is also engaged in a pig raising business through which she can make a dollar per day, while her husband, working as a fisherman, earns US$4 per day. Song and her husband work very hard to support their children’s studies, giving each child US$0.25 to go to school. 
At present, Song S. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to purchase a wooden boat for her husband to help him catch more fish for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of a wooden boat

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 19 year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a motorcycle repairman since 2001, and he is also an employee. He requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase motorcycles. 
This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan.
 Abass is special in his work because he buys and sells new and used motorcycles, and he also repairs them. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash for purchasing spare parts and motorcycles. Therefore, he decided to do this business because it is his hobby. He has experience and also has his family's support. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Abass needs the loan to purchase motorcycles.

loans.name: Frozia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Frozia B. from Dar es Salaam She is married with five children. Frozia has been running a cloth-selling business since 1998. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Frozia currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase additional clothes. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her merchandise. Getrude thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Eudelia Mercedes

texts.es:
Eudelia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Eudelia es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Eudelia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende choclo sancochado con queso, actividad que realiza por las mañanas y tardes con la ayuda de sus hijas. Además tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
Eudelia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas.
Los sueños de Eudelia son ampliar su taller y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eudelia is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is a 43-year-old married mother of three. She has a post at the 12th of April Market where she sells boiled corn cobs with queso, which she does in the morning and afternoon with the help of her daughters. Furthermore, she also has a small sewing shop making clothing items. Eudelia is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which she plans to use to purchase various fabrics. Her dreams are to expand her sewing shop and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various fabrics

loans.name: Sandy Esther

texts.en: Sandy Esther A. is 40 years old and married with four children.  In addition to raising her children and maintaining her household, Sandy sells videos and musical disks to a variety of customers.  In order to supply a greater quantity and diversity of products, Sandy is requesting a loan of $350, which will be used to purchase more videos and musical disks.

loans.use: To purchase more videos and musical disks.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul K. is the son of Faqir Husin.  He lives in district 16, Kabul, Afghanistan and he is single.

Abdul is a farmer and very interested in agriculture. He wakes up every day, early in the morning and goes to his land and starts his work.

Abdul wants an individual loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy more and different kinds of seeds for growing.  Abdul would like to be a really successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: Purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort C. is a 55-year-old trader. She was married but is now a divorced woman with three children. One is in school and the rest are working. She resides at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. She has been struggling to provide for her children's education and that is her greatest desire. She could tell us the circumstance that led to her separation from her divorced husband. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard work brings a livelihood to the family. Comfort supports herself through the sale of used clothing and bed sheets. Selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has been in this business for the past 30 years. She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on kid’s wear, bed sheets and used towel sales. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and rent a store to trade as she sells through hawking. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Rosa es conviviente tiene 56 años, seis hijos de 37, 35, 32,30 y el ultimo de 11 años que está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Rosa trabajaba en su taller de estampados en gamarra, y descuidaba a su hijo menor, tuvo que dejar el trabajo para pasar más tiempo con su hijo, y dejar a su hijo mayor a cargo del negocio.      Es cuando decide poner en su casa una bodega y ponerse a vender,   compro una exhibidora, una vitrina para su bodega.  
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para la compra de  mercadería para su bodega para el día de la madre, va compra arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche al por mayor.
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió cómo funciona  el Bancomunal, ella es titular de la chequera aprendió a desenvolverse, era muy tímida.
El sueño de Rosa es agrandar más su negocio, con más mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Mujeres Independientes (Independent Women) Community Bank. Rosa lives with her partner, is 56 years old, and has six children who are 37, 35, 32, 30 and the youngest is 11 who is studying in public school. Rosa was working in her stamping workshop in Gamarra and was neglecting her youngest son. She had to leave her job to spend more time with her child and left her eldest son in charge of the business. This is when she decided to start a shop in her home and begin to sell. She purchased a glass case for her shop. Rosa needs a loan of 3,400 soles in order to purchase merchandise for her shop for mother's day. She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk at wholesale. Since joining FINCA, she has learned how a community bank works. She is the treasurer. She learned how to cope as she was very timid. Rosa's dream is to grow her business more with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 3,400 soles in order to purchase merchandise for her shop for mother's day. She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 53 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Walid has owned a grocery store since 1993. Walid requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise. Walid is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Walid will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Boijonboi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Махмудов  Бойжонбой – молодой  человек  1983  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  одного  ребёнка,  образование  среднее.  Недавно  он  обратился  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом  для  расширения  своего  фотосалона,  который  находится  в  центре  Джаббор-Расуловского  района.  Для  успешного  ведения  своего  дела  он  решил  приобрести  принтер  для  распечатки  цветных  фотографий. Кроме  фотоуслуг  Бойжонбой  оказывает  услуги  ксерокопирования.  Он  рад,  что  наша  организация  выделила  ему  кредит  и  намерен  продолжить  сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Born in 1983, Boijonboi M. is a young man, who is married and has one child. He has a secondary education. Recently, he reached out to our organization for a loan in order to expand his photo studio, which is located in the center of the Jabbor-Rasulov district. To continue his business success, he decided to purchase a color photo printer. Besides photography, Boijonboi offers copying services. He is glad that our organization offered him a loan and plans to continue the partnership.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Printer purchase

loans.name: Priscila Maritza

texts.es:
Priscila es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre.
Priscila es de cerro de Pazco, es madre soltera tiene 43 años, tres hijos de 18, 11 y 7 años.
Priscila tiene su negocio de alquiler de cochera, ella tiene un terreno grande que poco a poco lo esta arreglando, por que cada vez su clientela aumenta..  
Todavía tiene la idea de dar desayunos por las mañanas, no lo pudo hacer por motivos familiares.
Necesita el préstamo de 1000 soles, para poner piso a su cochera..
El sueño de Priscila es construir su casa y que su hija estudie psicología y poner otro negocio.
texts.en:
Priscila is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre.

Priscila is from Cerro de Pazco. She is 43 years old, a single mother, and has three children who are 18, 11, and 7 years old.

Priscila has a car rental business. She has a large piece of land that she is fixing little by little because her number of customers continues to increase.

She still has the idea of serving breakfast in the mornings, but has not been able to do it because of family reasons.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to put a floor in her garage.

Priscila’s dream is to continue building her house, to start another business, and for her daughter to study psychology.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a floor in her garage

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам1958 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так же Уктам работает на водоносной станции Сумчака. Жена помогает ему ухаживать со скотом.После откормки скот продается на скотном рынке. Уктам кредитуется в нашей организации более 3 лет. Он успешно закончил предыдущих займов и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Он планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем самым увеличить прибыль своей семьи ему очень нравятся условия нашего кредитования и он рад, что есть такие организации поддерживающие общество.

loans.use: на покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Huruma E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Huruma K. from Mbozi. Married with a one-year-old child, Huruma has owned and operated a small duka or neighborhood shop selling common household goods and grocery items since 2004

Working at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and assisted by her husband, Huruma currently earns about $120 a month. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more goods for reselling. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her products. Huruma thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more common household goods for reselling.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Máxima es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Máxima vende comida en un puesto del mercado Playa Grau, actividad que viene realizando hace dos meses anteriormente vendía quesos.
Máxima necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la mejora de su puesto.
Los sueños de Máxima son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Máxima is a member of the communal bank, "Arco Iris." She is married, is 42, and has 2 children. She sells food at a stand in the Playa Grau market. She has done this for 2 months. Previously, she sold cheeses. Máxima needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will invest in making improvements to her stand. Her dreams are to see her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her stand

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un mécanicien qui s’est spécialisé dans la peinture auto. Il est marié et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Il est devenu le meilleur spécialiste dans la peinture d’automobile, car il a débuté cette activité depuis 1994. C’est donc un vétéran qui a ouvert son atelier dans le quartier d’Ablogamé à Lomé. Il a beaucoup de clients fidèles qui aiment et approuvent tous ses services bien faits ; il dispose aussi beaucoup d’apprentis mécaniciens car bon nombre de parents veulent voir leurs enfants devenir comme ce monsieur. Actuellement il a besoin d’acheter un nouvel appareil de pulvérisation de la peinture ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Le prêt servira également à agrandir et améliorer son atelier de mécanique générale. Il est fier de ses prestations et n’a aucun souci pour honorer ses engagements.
texts.en:
Komi is a mechanic who specializes in autobody work. He is married and he is the father of 3 children, still in his care. He has become the best autobody specialist because he has been in this occupation since 1994. Therefore as an experienced veteran in the field he opened his shop, located in the district of Ablogame in the city of Lome. He has many loyal customers that appreciate the work well-done. He also has a number of apprenticeships, given that many parents want their children to become like him. He currently requires a new painting tool, which is why he is requesting a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner). The loan will also be used to expand and improve his general auto mechanic workshop. He is very proud of his services and he has no concern over honoring his commitments.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a tool to paint cars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des matériels de coiffure

loans.name: Akot

texts.en:
Akot L. is currently in the business of selling plastic plates and cups at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock frying pans to sell. Akot is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bookshop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock frying pans to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: This is Leonora S., a 35 year old store owner. She lives with her husband and five children in Camarin, Caloocan City. Leonora owns and manages a variety (general) store. Beside it is her husband’s barber shop which she also manages. They’ve been in business for five years. The barber shop earns P10,000 a month while her store makes P14,000 monthly, enough to sustain their family’s basic daily needs. Leonora is applying for a new loan of P16,000 with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative as additional capital to purchase goods to sell at her store. It has been Leonora’s long sought-after dream to have a grocery store of her own. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Armando Joao

texts.pt:
Armando João B. nasceu em distrito de Chimoio, província de Manica, tem 38 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos com 08, 05 e 03 anos de idade, o primeiro vai a escola. Fez 3º ano do Instituto Industrial, parou porque teve que começar a trabalhar para sustentar a família. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos filhos.

Saiu de Chimoio para Boane em 1999 quando foi transferido pelos serviços, pouco tempo depois construiu a sua própria residência onde vive com a família ate hoje. É funcionário da Electricidade de Moçambique e trabalha como electricista montador há 08 anos fazem 08 horas diárias de segunda a sexta-feira. Aprendeu o trabalho em Chimoio em 1998. O seu rendimento mensal e de 7.465,00mt com o qual consegue poupar algum no final de cada mes.

Nunca teve crédito em outras instituições de financeiras e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar areia, cimento, chapas, barrotes, ferro, pedra e arame, para concluir a sua obra. Conheceu a Hluvuku porque e vizinho da sucursal de Boane.

Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para mobilar a casa e abrir um negócio.
texts.en:
Armando João B. was born in the Chimoio district in Manica province. He is 38 years old, married and the father of 3 children, who are 8, 5, and 3 years old. His oldest child attends school. Armando went to school up until his 3rd year of the Industrial Institute, but stopped his studies because he had to work in order to support his family. He lives in his own home and is not financially responsible for anyone except his immediate family. He left Chimoio for Boane in 1999 when he was transferred with the [military] service. A short time after that he built his own home where he still lives with his family. He is an employee of Mozambique Electricity company where he works as an electrician. He has worked there for 8 years, for 8 hours a day from Monday through Friday. He learned how to do this work in Chimoio in 1998. His monthly salary is 7.465,00mt and he is able to save a little each month. He has never had a loan with any other financial institution and this is his first loan with Hluvuku, for 15.000,00mt. He will use the money to buy sand, cement, steel, rocks and other building materials to finish his project. He heard about Hluvuku because he lives next to the Boane branch. He is committed to paying his loan off on-time in order to qualify for other loans to furnish his home and to open a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a 52 years old, widowed with five children aged between 15 and 32 years.  Three of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two room house where she is staying with twelve people. Resty takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying charcoal from Kisaasi to her home at Kisaasi Kikulu zone. She doesn’t pay rent for business premises because she sells from her home. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of thirty customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for ten years servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. Resty joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for use during the festive season. She aspires to see her business grower bigger and starts selling on wholesale only and also going directly to producers.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married and proud mother of six children. She says they are God’s gift. Hellen is the proprietor of a tailoring and dressmaking shop located at Malanga shopping center in Nambale. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She specializes in both ladies' and children's clothings since they are selling fast. She has applied for a loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Improving her clothing business

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatimata  C. est une brave dame de 55 ans qui  habite a Ouakam et  fait partie des membres fondateurs de l’U-IMCEC. Elle a adhéré  depuis l’installation du micro crédit dans le village de   Ouakam. Elle a déjà rembourse 9 prêts antérieurs. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus, comme  la voile, les  thioubs, les wax et les produits locaux saisonniers. Madame  C. faisait de la teinture, mais a cause de son âge  et les risques lies a cet activité  elle a cesse cet activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son stock de marchandise. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants particulièrement  des filles. Par conséquent  son objectif est d’aider ses enfants et de participer au bon fonctionnement de la maison. Et ceci elle parvient a le faire grâce a l’accroissement de ses bénéfices.
. Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique  apprécié
texts.en:
Madame Fatimata C. is a nice 55 year-old lady who lives in Ouakam and is one of the founding members of U-IMCEC. She joined when micro finance was first introduced in Ouakam village, and has already repaid 9 previous loans. She is involved in the sale of fabric, such as veils, thioub cloth, wax "pagnes" (brightly coloured cloths) and local seasonal products. Madame C. used to dye the cloth herself, but owing to her age and the risks inherent in this practice, she no longer does this. She is seeking a 350 000 frs loan in order to replenish her stock. She is a married mother of 6 children, all girls, and consequently her aim is to support her children and play an active role in running her home. She is able to do this through increasing the profits from her business. As part of its ongoing view to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC uses lenders' support in order to help communities to run lucrative revenue-generating businesses; this contributes to socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es: El señor Genaro Deciderio R.
