V., tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el Barrio El Rodeo es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, ellos  tienen 5 hijos  de los cuales dos de los mayores están casados, los otros viven de manera independiente pero les ayudan en los trabajos de la casa y la finca, ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 17 años, el problema que esto les ha traído, han sido la falta de financiamiento de parte de los organismos, para el apoyo a este sector, los planes a futuro serian el poder sembrar café, para esto necesitarían invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, que le proporcione a la cosecha mejores condiciones que le beneficien en la venta del mismo. Esto les traerá mayores utilidades  que podrían reinvertirlo en otros proyectos de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Genaro Deciderio R. V. is 58 years old and lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood. He is married, and his wife works as a vendor. They have five children, the two eldest of whom are married, the rest live independently but they help their parents with housework and work on the farm. They have worked as farmers for 17 years. A difficulty they have faced is a lack of credit offered by the different organizations that support this sector. Their future plans are to plant coffee trees. To do this they need to purchase fertilzers which will result in a better harvest and will help them sell their product. The higher sales will allow them to reinvest the movey in other family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supllies (fertilizer) to improve/maintain harvest

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga T. Thị Lại (id: 010117040008) is a 28-year-old woman living in Xóm Chợ of Đông Anh. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Nga runs a small business serving food to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for around three years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from this activity. Starting from 2008, Nga participated in SEDA to gain access to financial services to help better her business and family life. Nga has successfully repaid 7 previous loans of from SEDA. At the present time, she is requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND( or 270 USD), which again will be used to improve her business. She hopes to use the extra income generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in her group: 
Gia Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117040006) is 60 years old. She would like to borrow 7.194.000 VND (or 385 USD) to support her business of serving food. 
Minh Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117040009) is 32 years old. She also wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND(or 385 USD)  to offer electronic equipment repair services. 
Bách Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117040007)  is 54 years old. She would like to take out a loan of 7.194.000 VND(or 385 USD)  to invest in dressmaking. 
Nga Thị Đoàn (id: 010117040005). She is requesting a loan of 7.194.000 VND (or 385 USD) to offer electronic equipment repair services.

loans.use: will be used to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motor maintenance for the taxi truck

loans.name: Jairo David

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca la pimienta, el señor Jairo David S. A., se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, dentro la cual desarrolla diversos rubro como la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también establece cultivos de subsistencia como maíz, ajonjolí, y sorgo, los que le proveen a demás de su seguridad alimentaria, algunos ingresos para mejorar su situación económica, el señor Jairo David Se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a estas actividades las que ejecuta todos los días de la semana de 6 a 2 de la tarde, ya que le permiten la mantención de su familia la que esta con formada solo por su esposa, quien también le colabora en los que haceres diarios, se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de un panel solar el cual le permitió mejorar su vida social, este financiamiento será empleado para la compra de una vaca y una vaquilla las que aumentaran su hato ganadero y mejorar el sistema de producción
texts.en:
Jairo David S. A. lives in Somotillo, La Pimienta. He raises livestock such as: cattle, pigs and fowl; he also farms subsistence crops like corn, sesame and sorghum which provide, besides his own nutritional security, additional income to improve his economic situation. Jairo David has spent most of his life in these activities, which he does every day of the week from 6am to 2pm. They have made it possible for him to support his wife, who helps him with his daily tasks. He received a previous loan to buy a solar panel that improved his social life. The current loan will be used to buy a cow and a young heifer to increase the size of his cattle herd and improve his production system.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and a young heifer.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim T. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children.

Kim is engaged in a business selling bananas, earning an income of 1.50 USD per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband operates his horse and cart to provide transportation services for the villagers, earning an income of 2 USD per day.

Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. T. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to buy bananas to stock for sale when the price is good. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy bananas to stock for sale

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreysros C. and her husband, Mr. Samneang Prak, live in a small village along National Road Number Two, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children attends school while the other two are still too young.

Sreysros has been a garment factory worker since 2001 while her husband is a motor taxi driver (tuk tuk: a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer). She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina R., already a widow at sixty, is making sure that her family has enough to meet their daily needs. She has been managing her own mini arcade for quite some time now.

Avelina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues, and she has used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 9,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital so she can expand her business by purchasing another Playstation unit.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase an additional Playstation unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor R., 34, is making sure that her family is provided with enough for their daily needs. Married to Edmundo R., a factory worker, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own rug-making business for quite some time now.

Eleanor has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her rug-making business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for an 8,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying supplies needed to continue production of her rugs, like fabric, thread and so on.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow. She hopes to have more patrons and loyal customers

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying supplies needed to continue production of her rugs

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and is single. She has been operating a salon for four years and employs one person who she pays on commission.

Mercy joined Faulu Kenya in a group called Jobiwisa to access loans. She has also learned through Faulu Kenya how to keep business records.

Mercy has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy hair braids and hair treatments. She dreams of opening many salons in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair treatments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: More plastic slippers for resale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie C. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Rosemarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosemarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May A. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. May is married and has 4 children. To make a living, May owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling a variety of different products in the local community. May has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by May from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Abelardo de 32 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan una modesta vivienda en una apacible zona de la sierra central de Perú. Se dedica a la agricultura, porque dice que es lo mejor que sabe hacer, y lo aprendió observando a sus familiares y vecinos de su comunidad. En la  actualidad trabaja junto a su esposo en los cultivos de papa, arveja y maíz, aunque la labor agrícola es algo sacrificada porque debe madrugar todos los días para cuidar de sus cultivos y así asegurar una buena producción, dice que durante la cosecha obtiene su recompensa, pues mientras mejor cuide sus cultivos estos brindarán mejores productos. Como sus productos naturales son de calidad tiene compradores fijos en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, y de las ventas obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten brindarle a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además desea comprar algunas cabezas de reses para criarlos y tenerlos ante cualquier dificultad que se le presente. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además dice que esta satisfecha con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque todos los integrantes son muy responsables con el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yolanda, who is 30 years old, lives in her own house with her husband Abelardo, who is 32 years old, and their 2 young sons. Together they live in a modest house in a quiet zone of the central sierra of Peru. She works in agriculture because she says it is what she knows how to do best. She learned how to do it by observing her relatives and neighbors in the community. Currently she works together with her husband growing potatoes, peas and corn. Although the farming work is self-sacrificing because you have to get up early every day to care for the crops in order to ensure a good production, she says that during the harvest she gets her reward. Since the better you care for your crops the better the products they will produce. Because her natural products are good quality, she has regular customers in the largest market in the city and from the sales she gets regular profits, which allows her to give her family an appropriate quality of life. For the future she plans to plant larger plots of land. She also wants to buy some heads of cattle to raise and have for whatever difficulty that may arise. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who made the loan possible as it will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Also, she says that she is satisfied with the performance of her communal group because all the members are very responsible with making their payments. Yolanda plans to invest the requested loan in buying bags of various fertilizers that she needs to improve the productivity of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi, in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school.  She has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Jenifer has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more bags of charcoal.  With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jenifer hopes to generate greater profits and to be able to buy more food for her family.  In the future, Jenifer hopes to own a house and start another business, like poultry rearing.  Jenifer is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to make money and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Barbara de 53 años, tiene un taller de costura y confección en su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

La mama le enseño a coser desde que ella era pequeña, cuando creció y se caso continuo con esta actividad para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Hace camisas, conjunto de ropa, pantalones etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos y otras herramientas para su taller de costura y confección. En el futuro quiere tener su taller de costura grande y con gran clientela.
texts.en:
Barbara is 53 years old, and she has a seamstress shop in her house. She lives in an urban area called Guasmo. It is notable that most of the inhabitants in the area are informal merchants. Her mother taught her to sew when she was little. When she grew and got married she continued with this activity in order to be able to help with the family expenses. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. everyday. She makes shirts, outfits, and pants, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other tools for her seamstress shop. In the future she wants to have a large seamstress shop and many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Julia Saturnina J. Zeledón se dedica a la venta de refrescos ambulantes en el sector de el Bisne es soltera tiene hijos pero ninguno depende ella, todos son independientes.
Ella solicita crédito para comprar productos para su venta ha sido muy responsable con sus pagos, lleva ya 32 créditos con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Saturnina J. Zeledón is an itinerant soft drink merchant in El Bisne.  She is single.  She has children but none depend on her; they are all independent.

She asks for funds to buy stock items for her sales.  She has been very responsible with her payments.  She has had 32 loans with Ceprodel.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her sales.

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru: Аюбов Ёрмахмад проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 52 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Сам Ёрмахмад имеет средне - специальное образование, парикмахер. По профессии проработал 30 лет. Сейчас он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. В этой области уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Yormahmad A. lives in Khuroson.  He is 52 years old, married, and has four children. His wife works sewing traditional dresses.  Yormahmad has a vocational education as a hairdresser. He has worked in his trade for thirty years.  Now he works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle at home.  He primarily raises cattle for resale.  He has been doing this for fifteen years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Ivania Margine

texts.es: La Sra. Ivania Margine C. G. ella es trabajadora activa del colegio público “Félix Pedro García” San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  veinte años de trabajar como docente, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo  está solicitando para la compra de flores artificiales para arreglo florales para los difuntos porque ella aparte de ser maestra se dedica al negocio de  hacer arreglos florales, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Ivania Margine C. G. is an active employee of the Félix Pedro García Public School in San Rafael del Sur where she has worked as an elementary school teacher for twenty-one years. She has a son who is of school age.

Ivania has had nine loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy construction materials in order to expand and improve her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy artificial flowers to make floral arrangements for the deceased. In addition to her teaching job, she has a business arranging flowers. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase artificial flowers

loans.name: Tursaihan

texts.en:
Tursaihan T. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia.  His two daughters both attend a local school.  His wife operates a grocery store while Tursaihan drives a taxi using his own car in their town.  

They started their grocery store business in 2007 with a small shop and since then they have expanded their shop into a bigger grocery store in 2010.  For the future, they plan to enlarge their store into a supermarket and provide a good educations for all their four daughters. Tursaihan is a talktive and open minded man and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase their working capital for their grocery shop.

loans.use: to increase their working capital for their grocery shop.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née en 1969, D. Philomène est mariée à Janvier et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. La famille réside depuis neuf ans environs à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différents besoins de la famille. Philomène a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Philomène mène comme activité la vente de tissus et de bidons d'huile végétale à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Philomène achète ses produits dans la même ville. Philomène exerce cette activité depuis treize ans et a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits  auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Philomène désire renforcer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, mais est limitée par ses moyens ; raison pour laquelle Philomène sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Philomène D. was born in 1969, is married to Janvier, and is mother to three children, who are all at school. As well as their own children, the couple have another child in their care. The family have lived for around nine years in Ekpé in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. The couple provide for the various family needs between them. Philomène attended school very little. In order to provide for her children's needs, she has a business selling fabric and containers of vegetable oil in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Philomène buys her products in the same town. She has been carrying out this business for thirteen years and has already had five loans from ALIDé, all of which she has repaid in full. She would like to boost her business and increase her stock but has limited means to do so; for this reason she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and containers of vegetable oil

loans.name: Saijalol

texts.en:
H. Saijalol is a very happy and sociable 56-year-old man. He says he is a happily married man with a hard-working woman who has supported him in achieving all of his dreams. They have ten children and they would have liked to have more. Saijalol’s family is one that loves working in agriculture. The whole family works together to harvest different vegetables. It has been six years since Saijalol began working the land he loves so much. His wife sells the products in the local market. Saijalol also earns some extra income by breeding cattle.

Saijalol is requesting a loan to acquire agricultural supplies that are necessary to maintain the crops. With part of the loan he will also buy young cattle.  His dream is that his children inherit the love to work the land that he and his wife acquired with great effort, and that some day their children will inherit.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and young cattle.

loans.name: Daniel Wacira

texts.en:
Daniel, 34 years old, is married to Racheal Wambui, who sells shoes at a center called Kimende in Limuru. Together they have two children, aged 11 and 4 years. He runs a retail shop in Kimende, where he sells commodities like soft drinks and snacks. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who was already a member of KADET. He has been running this business for 13 years and as a result, he has established good relationships with his clients. Besides the retail shop, Daniel also sells timber, so with this loan he wants to buy more trees in order to get more timber for sale. 

This will be his second loan he is getting from KADET. If the loan improves the business, he will construct a timber yard so that he can have proper storage. 

He desires to give his family a good life.

loans.use: To boost the timber business

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El señor Flavio M. ya ha tenido dos créditos con Kiva, y esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en estos prestamos los cuales a mejorar mucho su vivienda. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un crédito para terminara la losa de concreto al frente de su casa ya que actual mente es de madera y quiere que su familia este mas cómoda y segura. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo que tiene como chofer de  camión de carga.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hija, ya que el Don Flavio M. se encontraba en su trabaja y su esposa la señora Maria Esther Castañeda no se encontraba en es momento en la casa.
texts.en:
Flavio M. has already had two loans through Kiva and he is very grateful for Kiva's cooperation in these loans which have helped him to make many improvements to his home.

He is requesting a new loan to finish building the concrete slab in front of his home since it is currently made from wood and he would like his family to be more comfortable and safe.

Flavio plans to pay back his loan with a part of the money he makes from his work as a truck driver.

The person who appears in this photo is his daughter since Flavio was out working and his wife, Maria Esther Castañeda was not home at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: To finish building the concrete slab in front of his home

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells food supplies like 'gari' (made out of cassava) and maize for sale at Breman near Elmina. Ama has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling food supplies like 'gari' and maize for 5 years. She assists her husband with the payment of the family's expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: buy more food supplies for sale

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon sells headdresses and other types of clothing at the market. He is a young married man with two children. Naimjon has been in this business for 5 years. During this time he has learned that having a large assortment of goods on display all the time is the key to success in this kind of business. Naimjon's prices are not high, making the goods more attractive to his customers. He would like to borrow $1500 USD to increase his inventory. He hopes to develop this business further and to increase his sales. 

                                                                   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards purchasing new goods for selling.

loans.name: Kabirizi Kwetungura Group A, Kihihi

texts.en: R. Robert is the leader of Kabirizi Kwetungura Group A in Kihihi. He is 51 years old and married with 10 children, all above 3 years. Robert is a farmer from Kabirizi-Byumba and deals mostly in tea growing; he also has a banana plantation from which he sells tea leaves and matooke, respectively. He sells the tea leaves to the tea factory and the matooke to the market in Butogota. He is able to make 300,000/= as a monthly income, and with this he is able to expand and diversify his business ventures. Robert is also involved in the sale of beans and goats, all from capital earned from his farming business as a result of determination and good focus. He needs a loan to be able to improve and modernize his farm.

loans.use: Improving and modernizing his farm by applying manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos Luis López P. , tiene la edad de 42 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la  cual labora como domestica , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar  ellos tienen tres hijos la mayor  es  casada y  los dos menores estudian , don Carlos tiene el sueño de algún día poder comprar un camioneta de segunda  para ya no pagar acarreo ; ya que cada vez que traslada su producto al mercado tiene que pagar acarreo para venderlo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de recurso para poder establecer una manzana de piña y  así mismo obtener más ingreso , don Carlos cuenta con una producción de piña de hace dos años  la cual necesita inducirla para poder sacar un buen tamaño , sabor y color , El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en: Mr. Carlos Luis L. P. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a domestic employee to help cover their cost of living.  They have three children; the oldest is married and the younger two are in school.  Carlos has the dream of one day buying a used truck so that he doesn't have to pay transport fees anymore, since every time he moves his product to the market he has to pay for transportation to be able to sell it.  His major difficulty is the lack of resources to be able to establish a larger plot of pineapple and therefore bring in more money.  Carlos has been growing pineapple for 2 years.  Pineapple needs help to get a good size, flavor and color.  The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and inputs

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
42-year-old Andresa runs a fishing business. She sells assorted fresh fish to the market. Her husband, who is a fisherman, goes to the sea to catch fish. Andresa has been engaged in fishing for 15 years.

Andresa is asking for a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets. This will help her husband catch more fish.

Andresa has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old. Andresa works hard to sustain their education and to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Karina Soledad

texts.es:
Karina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene dos hijos.  Karina tiene estudios de educación superior.
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su préstamo inicial que fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1,800.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, huevo, galletas y golosinas en general.  Ella trabaja sola en su negocio ya que su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad.  
Su sueño es mejorar su tienda, convertirla en una gran bodega.
Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y también el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Victor Echave” communal bank, located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 25 years old and has a common-law husband and two children. Karina has studied at the university level. 

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for two years. Her first loan, for 500 Peruvian new soles, was invested in her business, a general store. 

With this new loan for 1,800 Peruvian new soles, she will buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, eggs, cookies and snacks in general. She works alone in her business, since her husband works outside the city. 
  
Her dream is to improve her store and turn it into a large grocery store. 

What she likes about her communal bank is the ease of the loan and also the loan from the internal account.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, eggs, cookies and snacks in general.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
El señor Crisologo Primentel Aparicio tiene 36 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler donde también funciona el taller metalúrgico que tiene. Vivienda que está ubicada en el barrio 3 de mayo de la ciudad de Tarija. Crisologo es padre de 2 hijos, a quienes apoya en sus estudios, por circunstancias de la vida se separó de su esposa ahora él tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Crisologo se dedica desde hace más de 5 años como metalúrgico fabricando portones, puertas, ventanas, gradas, tinglados, etc. Teniendo buena clientela que prefieren ocupar sus servicios por ser una persona puntual y responsable. Crisologo quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto sus hijos, pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo como ser planchas, hierro, electrodos, etc. Es por eso que ahora  que el crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra dichos materiales que son de gran necesidad para realizar los trabajos que tiene y de esa forma poder cumplir con el contrato de trabajo que tiene. De ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos que mucha falta le hacen.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Crisologo nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de trabajo que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su taller.
texts.en:
Mr. Crisologo Primentel Aparicio is 36 years old and lives in a house that he rents where he also has a metal workshop. Housing is located in the neighborhood 3 de mayo in the city of Tarija. Crisologo is a father to 2 children, who he supports with their studies.  For circumstances of life he separated from his wife and now he has to work to be able to raise his children.  

Crisologo has been working for more than 5 years manufacturing metal gates, doors, windows, stairs, scaffolding, etc. He has good customers who prefer to use his services because he is punctual and responsible. Crisologo wants to have a better income to raise his children, but he tells us that he needs to buy working materials such as metal plates, iron, electrodes, etc. That's why, the loan that will be used to buy these materials is greatly needed so that he can perform the work and thus is able to meet the employment contract he has. From this he will be able to increase the income which he lacks.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Crisologo tells us that he wants to improve working conditions that he has and because of that the next loan that he requests will be used to improve the conditions in his shop.

loans.use: To manufacture metal gates

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un padre de familia de 65 años  de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia que no cuenta con los servicios básicos, su vivienda está ubicada en el caserío de Hualtaco a unos 20 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual está a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola,  ganadería y artesanía.

Marco se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra (plantas frutales) mango, limón y maracuya, una vez que lo cosecha lo vende en los diferentes mercados de su distrito y de la ciudad de Piura.  Productos que se consume mucho al diario de todos los pobladores, con los ingresos que obtendrá en la venta de sus productos  podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para la siembra de maíz y la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de maíz ya que es nuevo producto que está sembrando y lo que desea es que su negocio siga creciendo como hasta ahora para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y sacar adelante en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marco, 65, lives with his wife and children in his own house which does not have basic utilities.  It is located in the Hualtaco rural area, about 20 minutes from the district of Tambogrande, 40 minutes from the department of Piura.  The population in this district is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For 15 years Marco has used his own land to grow fruit such as mango, lemon and maracuya.  He sells his produce at the different markets in the district and city of Piura. These fruits are consumed daily by the locals, and he uses the income from his sales to improve his family's lifestyle.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to plant corn and buy fertilizer for his crop land so he will have a good harvest.  He is planting a new product and wants his business to grow so he can continue providing for his family and helping his children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his corn crop.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Angela's husband is a farmer.

Angela has had a sari-sari store for 19 years. She sells items like sugar, noodles and canned goods. She also makes and sells banana cue. Angela plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and packed noodles. She will also buy fertilizers for the farm that her husband tills.

In the future, Angela hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm and items to sell in her store

loans.name: Florebelle

texts.en:
Florebelle, age 24, owns and operates a shop that sells animal feed and medicines. She has had this business for three years. She and her husband have two children.

Florebelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy sacks of animal feed and medicines to offer for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed and medicines

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin, 64 years old, is a farmer and sells hand grinding product. Her husband is a blacksmith. Their income is $15 per day. Every month, she spends $40 on food, $10 on transportation and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy hand grinding product to sell. She does not want to have another career beside what she has now. This couple is getting older now, so they do not care to extend their business or repair the house anymore. They just want to have enough income to support their family's costs of living.

loans.use: to buy hand grinding product to sell.

loans.name: Mama Women's Group

texts.en:
Sarah, 37, started her fish-sales business three years ago. The courteous mother of one says she started this business to earn her keep after she graduated from school. 

Fish sells well on the markets in Lugazi, and provided one has enough in reserve, one is likely to do good business.

Sarah's business has been boosted by the fact that Lugazi is in close proximity to the shores of Lake Victoria, which supplies most of the fish people consume in Uganda. She therefore does not have to move far to purchase the fish she sells. In most cases, she purchases the fish she sells from fishermen who bring their catch to Lugazi town.

Her biggest challenge has been the fact that she has to sell her fish while moving. This, she says, has stifled the growth of her business as some of her clients are not easily accessible. She has to spend money every day to reach some of them and some of these clients reside in far off places. This, needless to say, has played havoc with the consolidation of her finances.

She says this business's gross profits total up to UGX 50,000 weekly.

Sarah says this Kiva loan is to help her construct a permanent stall from which she can sell her fish.

loans.use: To construct a permanent fishing-selling stall.

loans.name: Ana Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Ana Alejandra y su esposo el señor Jesus Ramón son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos. 
Solicitan un préstamo para poder comprar de los uniformes (ropa y zapatos) y útiles escolares que son libros, cuadernos, lapice, carpetas y mochilas. No cuentan con el dinero necesario para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y no pierdan este siclo escolar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe el señor Jesus Ramón de su trabajo en una fábrica como técnico, ya que la señora Ana Alejandra de encargas de cuidar y atender a la familia.
texts.en: Sra. Ana Alejandra and her husband, Sr. Jesus Ramon, have two children.  They are applying for a loan so that they can buy school uniforms (clothing and shoes) and other school supplies--books, notebooks, pencils, binders and backpacks, for example.  They don't want their children to miss the coming school-year, but they don't have enough money now to send them.  They plan to repay the loan from Sr. Jesus Ramon's earnings from his job at a factory.  Sra. Ana Alejandra works at home, tending the family.

loans.use: to pay for school uniforms and other school-related expenses.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es:
Angélica es integrante D. L.  Alcancía Comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” L. cual es un grupo que está conformado por 7 socios que trabajan responsablemente. 
Angélica tiene 60 años es casada con 6 hijos las cuales son mayores D. edad. Angélica cuenta con un negocio D. renovadora D. calzados ubicado en un mercado cerca D. su comunidad, este negocio nació ya que su esposo trabaja en una fábrica D. calzados y con sus conocimientos  ayudo Angélica a emprender  su propio negocio, es así como Angélica a podido aportar con los gastos del hogar. El deseo D. Angélica es D. instalar una tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio donD. pueda ofrecer productos D. primera necesidad. Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar sueL., clavos, tapillas D. calzados, tintes, y carnaza para su puesto D. calzados. Angélica junto a L. Alcancía Comunal “Luchando por un Sueño” L. cual elL. L. integra están contentos y comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad. 
L. señora Marithza no pudo estar presente por motivo D. salud D. su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the communal bank "Luchando por un Sueño" which is comprised of seven members who work responsibly.

Angélica, 60, is married and has six children who are all adults.  She has her own shoe repair business in the market close to her community.  Her husband works in a shoe factory and it was his expertise that helped Angélica set up her own business allowing her to help cover household expenses.  Angélica's goal is to set up a grocery shop in her house so she can sell basic needs products.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoe soles, tacks, heels, dyes and leather for her repair shop.  Angélica and her communal bank are happy and committed to the Prosperity Program.

Mrs. Marithza is not in the photo because her daughter was ill.

loans.use: To buy  dyes, tacks, soles and heels.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has 22 years of experience selling photocopiers. He also performs the needed maintenance on damaged ones. In parallel, and in addition to his photocopy shop, he has owned a small mini market since 1998. His wife works in a local supermarket to help provide the family with extra financial support. George’s unstable situation is not such a positive indication for him to improve his family’s standards of living. So today, he is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his purchases of new photocopiers in order to increase his business sales and therefore his income. His main purpose is to be able to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more new photocopiers

loans.name: Felix Bayardo

texts.es: Félix Bayardo tiene 44 años. Su actividad es el destace de cerdo, con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado obtener parte de crecimiento para su negocio, ya que es un hombre que le gusta dedicarse a su trabajo, el se levanta muy temprano para empezar su actividad y dedicarle tiempo a su hijo. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y destazarlos para realizar sus nacatamales. El mayor sueño de Félix es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felix Bayardo is 44 years old. He butchers hogs. With the help of funding, he has been able to expand his business, for he is a man who enjoys his work. He gets up very early to begin working and to spend time with his son. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy hogs to butcher in order to make nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales, which are wrapped in plantain leaves]. Felix’ greatest wish is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hogs.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, 33, is married and has two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He applied for his first loan with KADET which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds and also land preparation). With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of being a well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding limited resources.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Amalia Margarita

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Amalia Margarita  se dedica   a laborar como analista comercial  en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace cuatro años. Es soltera y con cinco personas a su cargo que le proporciona una condición de vida mejor a su familia. 

La  señora Amalia Margarita ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como cinz, perlin,  mano de obra y la otro parte del crédito lo va invertir en gasto escolares como promoción de su hijo, el objetivo también es para cambiar techo de su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, Señora Amalia Margarita works as a business analyst at a state institution. She has been doing this for 4 years. She is single and has 5 family dependents for whom she provides a better life.

Señora Amalia Margarita has resorted to asking Ceprodel for a loan to improve the state of her house by buying building materials such as zinc, perlin, and paying for labour. She will also use part of the loan to pay for school expenses for her son. Her goal is also to change the roof to her house and so improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Maria Concepción tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo, y cinco hijos. Ella se dedica a diversas actividades productivas. Maria Concepción vende pescado 2 veces por semana, otros días vende pan o verduras, o trabaja en sus cultivos de maíz y frijol.

Maria Concepción ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para su cultivo. Con la ayuda del préstamo ella podrá comprar todo lo necesario para el cultivo, y seguir con las ventas de los otros productos. Sin el préstamo Maria Concepción no podría seguir vendiendo los otros productos, ya que tendria que invertir su dinero en sus cultivos. El préstamo tambien le permitirá el comprar todos los insumos al mismo tiempo, recibiendo mejor precio, y ahorrando dinero en transporte. 

En un futuro Maria Concepción quisiera poder cultivar sin tener que estar endeudada, y poder darle a sus hijos menores un estudio más allá del bachillerato. Maria Concepción desea lo mejor para sus hijos por lo que trabaja fuertemente todos los días.
texts.en:
Maria Concepción is 48 years old and lives with her husband and five children.  She works in a number of different business activities.  Twice a week she sells fish and on other days she sells bread or vegetables, or works on her corn and bean crops. 

Maria Concepción has requested a loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure, pesticides and herbicides for her crops.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy everything she needs for her crops and also continue selling her other products.  Without the loan, Maria Concepción wouldn't be able to continue selling her other products as she would have to invest her money in her crops.  This loan will also allow her to buy all her supplies at the same time which means she will receive a better price and will save money on transport.

In the future, Maria Concepción would like to be able to grow her crops without having to be in debt.  She would also like to be able to provide her children with an education beyond the high school level.  She wants the best for her children and she works hard every day in order to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides and herbicides for her corn and bean crops

loans.name: Efusa

texts.en:
Efusa is 49 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children. For the past five years, Efusa has been working hard to manage his retail shop, and is now raising around 700 birds to sell. 

To help expand his business, Efusa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and foods for resale and will help Efusa to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Efusa hopes that in the future he will be able to build another chicken farm. 

Efusa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Efusa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and foods for resale

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
Sabas, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposa y 5 hijos, los cuales son dependientes, él se dedica a atender una granja de cerdos, esta actividad requiere de mucho cuidado y tiempo, para estar pendiente del crecimiento de los animales y por cualquier enfermedad, él aprendió desde muy pequeño, cuando ayudaba a sus padres.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, lo invertirá en la compra de dos cerdos y también concentrado, la compra le ayudara para adquirir estos nuevos miembros para la granja y así ir aumentando el negocio.
Sabas pretende con la ayuda de los préstamo, multiplicar el número de cerdos, para disponer y vender a los clientes.
texts.en:
Sabas works raising pigs.  He lives with his wife and five children, who are dependent.  He works taking care of a pig farm.  This job takes a lot of care and time to be aware of the growth of the animals and any illness.  He learned the job at a young age when he was helping his parents.

Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in buying two pigs and also feed.  The purchase will help him get these new additions for the farm and so continue improving the business.

With the help of the loan, Sabas hopes to increase the number of pigs to provide and sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and also feed.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress shop in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her dress shop. Lilibeth has been in this business for five years, and she also earns income by raising pigs. Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additonal materials for her dress shop.

loans.name: N. Eméline

texts.fr: Eméline est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Eméline est mariée à un tourneur du nom de Germain. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Eméline exerce depuis douze ans le métier de tisserand. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Eméline contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Eméline sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Eméline a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Emeline is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a lathe operator named Germain. The couple has three children. All attend school and are their dependents. The children live together with their parents and the couple shares responsibility for all household expenses.

For the past 12 years Emeline has worked as an weaver. The income generated by this activity enables her to contribute to various family expenses.

To meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, Emeline is requesting for the second time a credit loan from ALIDé, having fully repaid the previously granted loan.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María Inés tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. En su negocio ofrece una gran variedad de productos que sus clientes le solicitan. Inicio esta actividad económica con ingresos propios, con el fin de generar ingresos para su familia,  realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante, en donde ofrece la mercadería. Uno de sus sueños es seguir trabajando y lograr mantener su nivel crediticio con Fundación, ya que no es la primera experiencia que  tiene con la institución. Es por ello que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima: como colonias, cremas, calzado, toallas, reloj, ropa en general, prendas de plata y oro laminado entre otros productos demandados.
texts.en: María Inés is 55 years old and sells general merchandise.  Her business offers a great variety of products that her customers are looking for.  She started this economic venture with her own capital in order to generate income for her family.  She sells on foot in places where she offers her merchandise.  One of her dreams is to continue working so that she can maintain her credit level with the foundation, as this is not her fist experience with it.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies, like colognes, creams, shoes, towels, watches, clothing, and gold and silver jewelry among other things that her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: 05.01.27 Điện Biên Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food such as processed seafood, sugar, salt... to resell.

Bình is 56 years old and she is married with 3 children..
She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 27 Điện Biên solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

In 2009, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bình has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food such as processed seafood, sugar, salt... to resell.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is single and he is 36 years old, residing at Migcawanay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ronel is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish, crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been five years in this business. Each month, he earns 5,600 PHP.

Ronel is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Ronel has is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ronel wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Marjohn

texts.en:
Marjohn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Marjohn is providing motorela or motorcycle service. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Marjohn has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Marjohn hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Rut Marina

texts.es:
Rut se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener los ingresos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio para contribuir económicamente. Fue así como aprendió la actividad de la peluquería y montó su salón de belleza en su casa, ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen servicio. Desde hace unos 4 años viene trabajando con su negocio y sus ventas han venido creciendo cada vez más, lo que le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos. Con el ánimo de llevar mejor sus cuentas, Rut busca que un préstamo le permita comprar un computador para poder llevar las cuentas de su negocio de mejor manera y así poder tener un mejor control de los ingresos y los egresos.

Su sueño es tener un gran salón de belleza que sea reconocido y donde pueda generar empleo, además de poder tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así también poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar un computador para poder llevar las cuentas de su negocio de mejor manera y así poder tener un mejor control de los ingresos y los egresos.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Benjamin, who is in his early sixties, is married with ten children, two of whom go to school. He has seven grandchildren who go to school. Benjamin has been running two businesses for the past two years, selling fruits and vegetables and selling sacks of charcoal. He works from 6:00 am to 8:30 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Benjamin's fifteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and fruits and vegetables, and to pay for household expenses and school fees. He has repaid all of his loans successfully. Benjamin wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables.

Benjamin will share this loan with his loan group "Twitange" that has a total of sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and increase his stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mahoude Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUDE est composé de cinq personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahudé Marie Roberte est celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Mahudé Marie Roberte est âgée de 22 ans et est une célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant. Mahudé Marie Roberte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mahudé Marie Roberte vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Depuis près de six ans, Mahudé Marie Roberte vend des mèches et divers autres articles de façon ambulante. Mahudé Marie Roberte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Mahudé Marie Roberte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDE, un crédit.
texts.en:
The Mahoude Group is made up of five people who all live in the same area in Benin.  This is the first time that the group is asking for financial help through ALIDé, with the goal of taking their businesses to the next level. The representative of the group, named Mahudé Marie Roberte, is the woman in the photo with her finger raised. Mahudé Marie Roberte is 22 years old and is single with no children.  She has never attended school, and she lives alone providing for her own needs. 

For almost six years now, Mahudé Marie Roberte has been selling hair tresses and various other articles as an itinerant saleswoman.  She buys her stock at a market in Benin.  Seeking to better satisfy her customers and raise her income, Mahudé Marie Roberte is asking for a loan along with the other members of the Mahoude Group.

loans.use: to purchase hair tresses and other articles.

loans.name: Zuurakan

texts.ru: Зууракан 57 лет, вдова, имеет 2 детей. Зууракан в качестве дохода, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1991 году с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Зууракан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает люцерну. Ее ежемесячный доход от бизнес деятельности составляет 5,000 сом (KGS), также Зууракан работает санитаркой, получая заработную плату в размере 8,585 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зууракан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния ее семьи.
texts.en: Zuurakan is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children.  Since 1991, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to the point where she has six cows and 10 sheep on her farm.  She also grows alfalfa on one hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent life.  For this reason, and in order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy two bulls.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business and to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy two bulls in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Unidas Con Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Grimilda is one of the members of Unidas con Esperanza (Unite with Esperanza) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago. These 10 businesswomen are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community. 

Grimilda makes her home in a simple structure with one of her three children and she lives together with her long term partner. They live together in this neighborhood of scarce resources. She is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She sells miscellaneous products like comestics, body care and others products from her home and by walking in her neighborhood and nearby. She will use the profits to provide her family's needs; she also saves to reinvest when she needs to buy for any of her businesses. She is dreaming to have a safer and bigger home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina has in her house a business of groceries. It has been her only source of income for 7 years. The business has grown and need more space. She is asking for a loan of $1.200, 00 dollars to make bigger her store, because they are sharing half of his house for the business; she and her family will obtain more privacy and can give better attention to her clients. \"My husband works in a factory but it is not enough, I support him with the in the expenses of the house. I would like to repay in 12 months.

Español

La Sra. Cristina tiene en su casa un negocio de abarrotes; es su única fuente de ingresos desde hace 7 años. Su negocio ha crecido y necesita ampliar su casa para dedicar un espacio más grande y específico a su negocio Ella solicita $1,200.00 dlls pues es muy incomodo para ellos el vivir en su domicilio ya que están ocupando la mitad de su casa para el negocio; logrará más privacidad en su familia y mejor atención a sus clientes. “Mi esposo trabaja en una fábrica pero no es suficiente, yo apoyo en los gastos de la casa”

loans.use: Tener un cuarto especificamente para su negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics products to increase the variety of products she sells.

loans.name: Felipe Hilario

texts.en:
Felipe is married and has two children. He is an entrepreneur and very responsible: he sells herbs and religious candles in the town of Monterrey, Nuevo León, his home town. A year and a half ago he started his business as a means of self-improvement and to obtain the income his family need. Little by little he has expanded his business and he now has the help of an employee.

Now, Felipe needs a loan of $475 dollars which he will use to buy merchandise in order to keep his business well-stocked and to buy paint to improve the store’s appearance, with the aim to continue expanding as he has done up until now. He has committed to paying this money back within 4-8 months. He needs your trust and thanks you sincerely for your help, don’t think twice about it!

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felipe es casado y tiene 2 hijos, es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, se dedica a la venta de hierbas y veladoras en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, de donde es originario. Hace año y medio inició su negocio como una manera de superación personal y para obtener los recursos que su familia necesita, poco a poco ha estado creciendo su negocio y ahora cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado.

En estos momentos Felipe necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y en la compra de pintura para mejorar el local, con el objetivo de continuar creciendo como hasta ahora lo ha hecho, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Él necesita de tu confianza y agradece sinceramente tu apoyo, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Purchasing stock and building renovation

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena runs a small business selling leather purses and wallets at the busy Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She has been in business for five years. In a typical month, she makes about $400 profit. Elena is married. She and her husband, Victor, have a nine year old son. One of Elena’s goals for her business is to generate sufficient income so that they can purchase an apartment. Elena has requested a loan for $450 to help purchase new inventory for her kiosk. She hopes to see a boost in sales and profits over this busy time of the year. We are happy for the opportunity to support Elena’s business endeavors and help her reach her goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She has been in LAPO as a union leader for the past 2 years.  She hails from a semi-urban in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria. She sells wholesale drinks and provisions.  She has been in her business since 2000 and needs a loan of $800 to buy drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Gloria De La Luz

texts.es:
Gloria Luz is a mother who thinks about her family's future. She has taken use of her cooking abilities to make dishes and sell them from her home. This has enabled her to pay rent and other expenses, since her husband is a mason and works on a temporary contract basis. Months have passed on without any work for him. Meanwhile, Gloria has slowly established her food business.

However, she still needs to grow to move forward with her family. Thus, she seeks a loan of $650, which she will pay back in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy ingredients for her food and furniture. With your help, Gloria's children will be able to go to school without any financial burden.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria Luz, es una mujer que piensa en el futuro de su familia y en el de ella, puesto que aprovechando las habilidades que tiene para preparar alimentos, comenzó a vender comidas en su casa, y así poder solventar los gastos que se le presentasen en su hogar, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil y ese negocio es de temporadas, es por ello que el salario que recibe no es fijo y pueden pasar meses sin trabajo que hacer. Poco a poco se ha ido estableciendo Gloria con su localito de comidas.

Sin embargo, necesita seguir creciendo para poder salir adelante, y por lo tanto hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $650 para pagar en un plazo de 6 meses para poder adquirir materiales y mobiliario para elaborar sus comidas. Con tu ayuda los hijos de Gloria podrán salir de la escuela sin problemas económicos y así serán hombres de bien.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin (his father is pictured) is a single man who lives in Salyan region, in the Yenikand village.

The 26-year-old has been in the farming business for three years. Now, he needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Miss. C. Samnang, 40, is single. She lives with her old mother and her older sister in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Samnag and her sister learned to weave several years ago from a neighbor. After working for a year, their skill level was good enough to start weaving independently. Now they've been weaving on their own for three years and each one has a loom.

Samnang is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA, for the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay for the preparation of her loom.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Upper Kawugab(2061) A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Yunia S.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy more layer chicks. Yunia is 40 years old and is married with 4 children. Her children range in age from 9 to 18 and they are all in school. Each week, Yunia makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children and re-invest in her food business.

Yunia is joined in her small group by Suzan N., Florence N., Margret N., and Milly K.. Suzan N. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Florence N. is currently in the business of running a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to add to her stock. Margret N. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan of UGX 200,000 to purchase more food to sell. Milly K. is currently in the business of running a hotel. She is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to expand her hotel business.

loans.use: To invest in the businesses

loans.name: Kireka B3 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Desi M.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry feed. Desi is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from age 6 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Desi makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to buy a water tank. Desi has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Desi is joined in her small group by Deborah N., Nusiat N., Hadijah N., and Christine N.. Deborah N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to expand to wholesale. Nusiat N. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to buy a fridge for cooling fruits. Hadijah N. operates a retail shop business and wants to increase stock. Christine N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to open up a retail shop.

loans.use: To add to a poultry farming business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is the mother of five children (three others have passed away).  She has been preparing kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made of corn meal and typically served with fried fish) for over 25 years.  Afia will use the proceeds from the loan to purchase maize, cartons of fish, and palm oil for her sauce.  She wants to aggressively save her profits to help her eldest child with secondary school.

Afia is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, cartons of fish, and palm oil.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam T. is 44 years old. She is a truck driver who organizes shipping lanes between Kampong Cham province and the capital city of Phnom Penh. While her job is very important, she only earns 1 US$ per day doing this. Her husband also works the shipping lanes between the province and the capital but as a taxi driver. He earns significantly more to support the family. Of their three children only one is out of school. He works as a mechanic making 2 US$ per day. Eam T. would like to invest in a new taxi for her husband to use. His current car uses obscene amounts of gas and is economically inefficient for someone in the driving business. Cutting down on spending in this area would maximize his profits so that he may support his family easier.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Mr. Miguel Santa Cruz is 42 years old, he is married to Mrs. Teodolina Ovando, who is 38 years old and they have 4 children. They live in the city of San Estanislao, in the neighborhood of Monte Alto, they have their own house. They have a jewelry and watch store in the center of the city, with 8 years of operation, a well formed clientele, and a good income thanks to the good prices and quality of their products, and they offer guarantees on their merchandise. Excellent commercial and personal references, they are very responsible and hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.
