El señor Miguel Santa cruz tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado con la Señora Teodolina Ovando, de 38 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos. Viven en la ciudad de San Estanislao, en el Barrio Monte Alto, tienen casa propia. Tienen una Joyería y Relojeria en el centro de la ciudad, con 8 años de funcionamientos, con clientela formada, y buenos ingresos, gracias a los buenos precios y también a la calidad de sus productos, y trabajos con garantìa. Excelentes referencias comerciales y personales, son muy responsable y trabajadores.

loans.use: to purchase watches, rings, chains, etc.

loans.name: Livestock And Small Businesses Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoa Thi D. is 49 years old. She has a reputation for being a trustworthy person in her village and is admired by everyone. Her famiL. owns a small store which brings in a regular income. The famiL.’s main occupation is farming. She has two small children, one of which is still in school; her older child is working and has an average income of 50,000 VND per month. She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in expanding the famiL. store.
  • Her group includes:
  • Mrs. Muoi Thi T. is 59 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in a small business.
  • Mrs. The Thi H. is 25 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to raise pigs.
  • Mrs. Duyen Thi T. is 49 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in a small business.
  • Mrs. Thuy Bich L. is 46 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND invest in raising livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Đậu Thị Hoa (MS: 080002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô là người có uy tín trong làng và được mọi người yêu mến. Gia đình cô có cửa hàng nhỏ, tạo thu nhập thường xuyên. Nghề chính của gia đình cô là làm nông nghiệp. Cô có hai con, một con đang còn đang đi học, con lớn đi làm có thu nhập bình quân 50.000 VND/ tháng. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư mở rộng của hàng.

  • Trong nhóm cô gồm có:
  • Trịnh Thị Mười (MS: 080003), năm nay 59 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Chị Hoàng Thị The (MS: 080004), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND để nuôi lợn.
  • Cô Tạ Thị Duyên (MS: 080013), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Cô Lý Bích Thủy (MS: 080014), năm nay 46 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Nhóm cô đã đăng nhưng bị issue, ID cũ của nhóm là 53976).

loans.use: Small business and raising livestock

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea and Pedro are a married couple who have worked together for years making bricks. Their extensive experience has made them very talented in their craft, and they are proud of the product that they are able to produce. Through their trade they have been able to provide for their home and for the education of their 5 children, all of whom help with the work in their free time. This family would like to expand their market, and they are convinced that by contracting a master bricklayer and by purchasing necessary materials, they will be able to improve the quality of the production of their bricks. In order to do this, they are requesting this loan. Your help will be an important support to their factory.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Dorotea y Pedro son esposos, juntos llevan años en la fabricación de ladrillos, la experiencia los ha convertido en personas muy hábiles en este oficio, ellos se sienten satisfechos y orgullosos por los resultados que vienen obteniendo, ya que cubren satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar y la educación de sus 5 hijos, quienes en sus momentos libres los apoyan en el trabajo. El deseo de esta familia es expandir su mercado, están seguros que contratando a un maestro al albañil y adquiriendo materia prima necesaria, mejorarán la cantidad de producción de sus ladrillos, para ese fin va su solicitud de préstamo. Su ayuda será un aporte significativo en su fábrica.

loans.use: To hire a master bricklayer, and to purchase material for their brick factory.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen S., 56, fishes with her husband Mr. Ngem Bon, 47, together earning around $5.00 per day. They have one daughter, who is married. To increase their family's income during fishing season, Mrs. Yen seeks a $600 loan to purchase more fishing tools including mats and bamboo, and traps. He hopes that she will be able to catch more fish, and better support her family. Yen's daughter is pictured because Yen and her husband were unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools including mat, bamboo, and traps

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia es natural del Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Tiene 27 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada y madre de 04 hijos cuyas edades son de 10, 8, 3 y 1 año de edad.

Decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado Acari, Yunguyo para incrementar su capital. Con un crédito inicial de S/.500 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 01 saco de ají, negocio que se dedica desde hace 07 años conjuntamente con su esposo. Actualmente forma parte de la “Asociación de ají y orégano” en el Departamento de Tacna (Sama). Semanalmente trae ají para vender los días viernes en precipitación. Este año empezó con la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, compra en la feria de Acora y lo comercializa en la feria de Yunguyo.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 01 cabeza de ganado. Doña Herminia manifiesta que desde que tuvo su pareja a los 16 años de edad empezó a trabajar con negocio, en un inicio se dedicaba a la confección de casacas para otra persona, posteriormente confeccionaba para vender ella misma.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y darles buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Herminia is a native of the Acari town, district and province of Yunguyo. She is 27 years old, she studied until third year of secondary school. She is married and a mother of 4 children whose ages are 10, 8, 3 and 1 years old. She decided to join the "Fe y Alegria" Communal Bank of the Acari town, Yunguyo to increase her working capital. With an initial loan of $175 she was able to buy one sack of green pepper. She has had this business with her husband for 7 years. At present she is a part of the " Association of green pepper and oregano " in the Department of Tacna. Every week she brings the green peppers to sell on Fridays. This year she started buying and selling dairy cattle. She buy it in the fair of Acora and commercializes it in the fair of Yunguyo. With this loan of $575 which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, she will buy cattle. Mrs Herminia tells us that since she got married at the age 16 she started working with this business, before she was dressmaking jackets so some else could sell them, later she was making them to sell them herself. Her biggest dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna and to provide a good education to her children so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam C. is 44 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their four children. She has been making baskets since 1998 and sells them out of her home, earning about $2 per day. Her husband, Touch Rim, is 42 and has been working as a motor-bike taxi driver since 2000, earning about $3 per day. Their children are aged 22, 18, 17, and 11. Three of them work as gardeners, and the youngest goes to school.

Nam C. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motor-bike for her children to commute to work. This will help them get to their work quicker enabling them to earn more money.

Nam C. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT-MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mr. Met S. is a 31-year-old fisherman, who relies on fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. He started in 2000, earning approximately $3 a day. His wife, Mrs. Sass Meut, 24, is a fish seller who sells fish from her husband’s work. They live in area of Loloksar Commune, Pursat Province.

Met needs to enlarge his business and he would like to request $150 to purchase a fishing boat and to buy more nets and traps.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat, nets and traps

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar tiene 27 años de edad, habitante de barrio Héroes y Mártires,  en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa trabaja como domestica es una ingreso mas para el hogar, tiene dos hijos precioso de 1 y 10 años de edad. Sus planes en ámbito familiar es ofrecerle una mayor seguridad y protección. Don Oscar trabaja en una empresa privada desempeñando el cargo de auxiliar de bodega desde hace un  año trabaja para esa empresa. Sus objetivos es una mejor vivienda esta dentro de las prioridades principales, para realizarlo requiere de un préstamo. Gracia a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar los materiales como: cementos, hierros, ladrillos y bloques realizando la construcción de su casa y ofreciendo una mayor protección y  un patrimonio a sus hijos para el futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Héroes y Mártires (Heroes and Martyrs), in the capital of Managua. His wife works as a domestic, which is additional income for the household. He has 2 precious children, who are 1 and 10 years old. He plans to offer his family more security and protection. Oscar has worked in a private company, where he is in charge of helping with the wine store, for one year. One of his main goals is to have a better home. In order to achieve this, he needs a loan. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, he is able to buy materials like cement, iron, bricks, and blocks so that he can construct his house and offer more protection and an asset to his children for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en: M. Prudence sells clothes and decorative accessories in Mbarara. Due to increased customer demand, she is requesting a loan to replenish her stock of fabrics to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. Her dream is to open up an upscale boutique within the district. She is married with two children who both attend secondary school.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Lovelle

texts.en:
Lovelle M. is a pig grower. She started raising hogs in 2004 and she is still in this business because she thinks it is the most profitable business for her. She has 8 piglets and 4 pigs. Aside from that, she is also raising a sow that gives her piglets to sell. The profit that she gets from raising pigs has supported the needs of her children well.

Lovelle is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. Part of her loan will be used to start a new business, selling sardines with door-to-door delivery. She wants to add another sow to have more piglets. She believes that CEVI programs will help her achieve all her dreams.

Lovelle has been a CEVI client for more than 2 years already. Now she enjoys the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI provides.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is happily married to Arthur D., who is a farmer; they’re living in a good relationship with their only son Gerald D., 9 years old, a grade four student in the rural village of Sto. Tomas Alicia, Isabela. Last June 21, Virginia fearfully shared her experience being hit with a gun shot and wounded in her back. She passed through a major operation then and had difficulties going back to her business operation which had become her habit already. However, her daughter in her womb didn’t survive because of the incident. And, unfortunately, until now, the crime remains unsolved.

For almost a year, Virginia was happy that she was able to move on and get back to her business. She is maintaining a village store and barbecue business in their village. Her two business types are working simultaneously and being maintained through the assistance of her supportive husband. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 for additional capital in the business and to save enough income to buy a motorcycle for their business transportation, going to market.

In the latter part of the interview, Virginia shared that “everything happens for a reason and only by faith in God could she explain why," a lesson learned from her dreadful experience.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Саидов Камолиддин житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Занимается выпечкой лепешек. Имеет пекарню . Готовые лепешки реализует на рынке. Для работы ему необходимо купить автомобиль. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит и добавить сумму для покупки автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kamoliddin S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 28 years old, married and has two children. He owns a bakery and makes flat bread. He sells his products at a market. Kamoliddin needs to purchase a car for work use. This is why he plans to obtain this loan and add to his existing funds for the automobile purchase. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car purchase

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. started her fish sales 16 years ago in Moore, in the central region of Ghana. Efua prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. She has many customers.

She buys fish from fishermen at the seashore. Efua smoked some of the fish and sells the rest fresh. She has a large customer base that travels from other part of the region to buy her fish. She is now 42 years old, married and mother with three children. Currently two of her children are schooling.

Efua wants to use the loan to buy stock of assorted fishes and other food stuffs. It is her dream to provide a better education for her children and believes that when she is fully resourced her dream will be fulfilled. Efua belongs to a village bank called ‘Akukudrofo’ which means ‘Brave People’.

loans.use: Buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benso sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kadiolo (Noumousso) dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de beurre de karité, les jus de fruits et d’habits.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les  prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 2 sacs de 100kg de noix de karité (pour en faire le beurre de karité) et 3 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, au marché de la ville de Kadiolo le jour de foire et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante les autres jours à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Benso are all married and average 23 years of age and 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso) in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They do a diversity of work, including selling shea nut butter, fruit juices, and clothing.

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding ones were settled.

With this new loan, they intend to buy two 100-kg sacks of shea nuts (to make into shea nut butter) and three dozen pieces of children's clothing. Supplies are gotten at the Kadiolo City marketplace and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold to customers composed of men and women in cash transactions at the Kadiolo City marketplace on market day and in the districts going door-to-door on the other days.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Ruth María

texts.es:
La señora Ruth María S. G. tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 3 hijos.
Ruth se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas (en su bodega y por medio de un triciclo). Cuando inicio su negocio solo vendía gaseosas, luego empezó a surtir su tienda permitiendo así ahorrar para poner otro negocio que es la venta de desayuno, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para surtir su bodega (galletas. Golosinas, gaseosas, útiles escolares).
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, podrá invertir en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Ruth tiene como sueño poner una tienda comercial amplia y grnade donde pueda ofertar más productos.
texts.en:
Ruth María S. G. is 46 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed high school and has 3 children. Ruth sells candy and soda pop (in her store and on a tricycle). When she began her business she only sold soda pop, then she began to stock her store enabling her to save to open another business which is selling breakfast, a business she runs from her home. With the first loan for 300 soles that she received from her Communal Bank “Romanas Luchadoras II,” she invested in buying items to stock her store (cookies, candy, soda pop, school supplies). With this loan for 1000 soles she will buy candy and soda pop. Ruth has a dream of opening a large store where she can offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and soda pop

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife. Mohamad has owned a grocery store since 1999. Mohamad requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan. 
Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because of his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: amy T. est une femme mariee qui a orente son activite vees la petite restauration et qui capitalise plus de cinq ans d'experience dans ce domaine.elle habite dalifort et sa clientele est essentiellement composee de mecaniciens qui exercent leurs activites dans les alentours.elle emprunte une somme de cent mille(100 000)dans le but d'accroitre sa marge beneficiaire en achetant au prix de gros les produits qu'elle utilise pour preparer ses mets ce qui lui permettra aussi de diversifier ses plats pour une meilleure satisfaction des besoins de la clientele.ainsi cette situation pourra lui permettre de mieux faire face a ses charges de location et aussi mieux assister son mari dans l'entretien de la famille et les depenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Amy T. is a married woman who serves cooked food, banking on more than 5 years' experience in this domain. She lives in Dalifort, and her clientele is essentially composed of mechanics who do their work in that area. She is borrowing the sum of 100,000 with the intention of increasing her profit margin by buying the products that she uses to prepare her dishes wholesale. This will also permit her to diversify her dishes so as to satisfy her clientele better. Thus, this situation will allow her to be better able to pay her rent and to help her husband support the family and pay their daily expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma 1  est constitué de  10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter des intrants, des petits matériels, des semences et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage  pour entretenir 17.5  hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne qui sera à étoffer les activités commerciales.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma 1 is composed of 10 married women who average 41 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 17.5 hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign, to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. sells baby things like diapers, clothes, nappies, etc. She is 44 years old and married with five children.

Elizabeth hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh beef

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is from the village of Upper Centro,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Editha is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bisiola

texts.en: Bisiola is 35 years old and married with a child. She sells medicine and provision. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine and provision to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en:
Leatitia U. is 28 years old, single, and she takes care of three persons aged between 24 and 17. She lives in Kigali, capital of Rwanda, where she owns a small shop of products.

Leatitia has experience of two years in this business. She opens her shop everyday from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Before running this business Leatitia could not provide all the needs of her family but now, through the loan requested from Vision Finance Company, she believes she will earn more profit. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Mr. Churn Doeur Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people and they all live in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. Mr. Churn D. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil. Thus, he decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field to make more crops. His wife, Mrs. T. Kim, is a pig breeder. Mr. Churn D. is 42 years old and the father of six children. One of them is a farmer, three are enrolled in the local school and the others are too young to work or study. Mrs. Pot Y., Mrs. Srea S., Mrs. Yom Y, and Mrs. Heu K. did not come to take loans but their husband did, so there are five men who are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sepriano's Group

texts.en:
S. Sepriano has a retail shop business in Namugongo that he has been running for some time now. He is able to make 80,000/= a week as profit from his sales. He is 43 years old and married with three children and he takes care of one sibling.

Sepriano is a friendly, hardworking and determined man and the leader of his lending group. He ensures that he has the right stock for his customers hence making more sales in a day. He hopes to expand his business further and ensure that he gets necessary items for his family. Sepriano’s loans have helped him pay school fees for his children as well as enabled him to save for future developments. He needs a loan to help restock his shop with more goods for resale.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia R. is from the village of Talisay. She is 58 years old, is married, and has four children: three of them are adults and the youngest is school-aged. Delia owns and operates a business providing electronic services such as appliance repair and video karaoke assembly to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electronic materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and also to support the education of her youngest child. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase electronic materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Vive junto a su madre en el Pueblo Jóven San Martín, de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de veinte años se dedica a la venta de diarios y revistas. Ella nos cuenta que empezó a vender junto a su madre en una esquina cercana al mercado de la ciudad y que desde hace cinco años lograron instalarse en un kiosko ubicado en la avenida más transitada de la ciudad. Hermelinda trabaja en su puesto todos los días de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso de su familia por lo que día a día da lo mejor de sí para salir adelante.

Hermelinda desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de más revistas , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para construir su casa propia y poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 39 years old and a single mother of three children. She lives with her mother in the town of Jóven San Martín, in the city of Lambayeque, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For twenty years Hermelinda has worked selling newspapers and magazines. She says that she started this business with her mother on a street corner close to the city's market, and that five years ago they managed to set up a kiosk on the busiest street of the city. Hermelinda works the stand every day from six in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. This business is her main source of income for her family, and so she works hard at it every day to get her family ahead. Hermelinda would like to expand her business by adding more magazines to her inventory, but she does not have enough capital to achieve this goal. For this reason she is for the first time asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 300 new soles. Hermelinda is a women who has learned to keep working despite any difficulties. Her greatest wishes are to keep working to build her own house and to be able to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of magazines to increase inventory.

loans.name: Ezra Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Felicia is forty-seven years old. She is divorced and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. 

Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. While the fishing industry is the major occupation of the people, Felicia deals in secondhand clothes. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Ezra. The members of the group are mainly traders. The group is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. They share a desire to provide their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy owns a hairdressing business, offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her customers. She specializes in selling hair extensions. She has been in this business since 2008. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

She is 28 years old and is married with a small child. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 in order to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Activas” están representados por la señora Carmen y conformado por 14 miembros muy puntuales, trabajadoras y activas por lo que hacen honor a su nombre. Todas las socias del banco comunal tienen negocio, como la venta de comida, ropa, cosméticos, pan, ferretería, zapatos y la costura de prendas de vestir. Las socias indican que en el mercado tienen mucha competencia pero pese a eso ellas siguen trabajando y tienen clientes fieles. 

Carmen que es la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de cosméticos tiene una experiencia de 1 año en este rubro, Rosmery vende comida y tiene experiencia de 1 año, Concepción se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 10 años atrás, Maria cristina también vende comida con una experiencia de 3 años, Ana maria atiende su zapatería desde hace 13 años, Claudia comercializa ropa usada desde hace 1 año, Bacilia vende comida y tiene una experiencia de 16 años, Pura vende ropa interior desde hace 7 años, Maria Esther también se dedica a la venta de comida con una experiencia de 2 años atrás, Nancy angelica vende dulces desde hace 6 años, Corina comercializa pan durante 9 años, Daniela se dedica a costurar desde hace 2 años, Alicia también comercializa pan desde hace 2 años y por último Justa atiende su punto viva desde hace 3 años atrás. 

El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas como maquinas de coser eléctricas o bordadoras, todo esto ayudara para generar un mejor beneficio económico que se traducirá en una mejor educación para sus hijos y un hogar estable para sus familias. En su gran mayoría las socias ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad de crédito solidario con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que saben manejar los fondos otorgados para beneficio e incremento de sus negocios que son el pilar fundamental para el sustento de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group “Las Activas” ("The Active Women") is represented by Ms. Carmen and made up of 14 very punctual, hard-working and active members who live up to their group's name. All of the members of this communal bank have a business, such as selling food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, hardware, or shoes, or working as a tailor. The members indicate that there is a lot of competition on the local market, but they continue working in spite of this fact, and they have loyal customers. Carmen is the group's president and has been selling cosmetics for the past year. Rosmery has been selling prepared meals for the past year, Concepción has been selling bread for 10 years, Maria Cristina also sells food and has 3 years of experience, Ana Maria has had her shoe store for the past 13 years, Claudia has been selling used clothing for the past year, Bacilia has been selling food for the past 16 years, Pura has been selling underwear for the past 7 years, Maria Esther has been selling food for the past 2 years, Nancy Angelica has been selling sweets for the past 6 years, Corina has been selling bread for the past 9 years, Daniela has been working as a seamstress for 2 years, Alicia has also been selling bread for 2 years, and finally, Justa has been working at a Viva cell phone sales location for the past 3 years. The loan is aimed at purchasing merchandise, materials, supplies and tools such as electric sewing machines or embroidery machines. All of this will help them generate greater economic benefits, translating into a better education for their children and a stable home for their families. The great majority of them have previous experience with solidarity loans from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation, so they know how to manage the funds they receive in order to benefit and expand their businesses, which are the fundamental pillars that sustain their households.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chrorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrorn P. is 59 years old and she lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province.

Mrs. Chrorn P. and her husband, Mr. Mee Kry, are farmers who own 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice. In order to support the farm crop, they want to buy a water pump and dig a well, but they do not have enough money to do so. So, Mrs. Chrorn P. decided to ask for a loan to support this purpose.

This couple has three children, two of whom are farmers who support their parents’ farming and the other one is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and dig a well

loans.name: Bros

texts.en:
Mr. Bros S. is 35 years old and lives in Srae Vong village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Saren Sann, are farmers who own a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, they are also salt and fruit sellers who earn a little income to support their family. This couple has two children who are attending the local school. 

In this dry farming season, they do not need money to grow crops. Thus, Mr. Bros S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, he will buy pesticide and gasoline to support his farming. 

His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq K. is 40 years old trader who sells electrical goods as TVs, CD and DVD players and so on. Mushviq is married and has three children. His dream is to provide best education to his beloved kids. Now he applied for 1600 AZN in case to expand his business and purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: purchase more electrical goods

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en:
T. Posiano is an enterprising farmer in Rukungiri. He is a married man with seven children and his future plans are centered on developing his banana plantation.

Challenges like a lack of capital to expand his banana gardens, banana wilt disease, and finding the money to pay his odd jobbing casual laborers, are what Posiano has had to come to grips with ever since he began his business of growing and selling bananas nine years ago. His determination, though, has kept him going and, for that reason, he is now looking at the wider horizon.

In essence, Posiano’s future plans are to expand his business and educate all his children to university level. By his own account, a loan to the tune of 0.5 million UGX will lend support to his growth plans and ambitions. He hopes to buy more manure, mulch his plantations and buy stalk poles for better yields.

loans.use: To buy more manure, mulch and poles for his banana plantation

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna B., from Balamban MAhayag Zamboanga del Sur, is a 49-year-old married mother of four children. She is a PDP_LP member who, along with her husband, grows ginger, harvesting the crop every nine months. Their income is approximately 3000 PHP a month. Having fully repaid her previous loan of 5000 from PMPC that was used for the expansion of her garden plot, a new loan of 6000 PHP, her fourth from PMPC, will be used as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her garden

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si L., 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about USD 1.50 per day. Her husband sells silk products, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more silk to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy silk to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, peanuts and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Kokou Akpé

texts.en: This young man has a hardware business. He is 34 years old, married to an entrepreneur and they have two children. He has been selling hardware products since 2008. He has requested a loan from WAGES of 500,000 West African CFA francs to purchase 150 cartons of various different hardware products to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Hardware store inventory

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married lady whose husband is an engineer and together they have two children aged 10 and 2 years. She and her husband share the responsibilities of their home of six people. She dreams of having a modern home with a car and well-educated children.

Betty operates a drug shop in Masindi, Uganda, and has been in the business for two years now. After working in other people’s drug shops she decided to open up her own with the little capital she had.

Betty maintains that capital is ever an issue with her business sector since she has a dream of having a big drug shop one day. She is to use the loan funds to buy drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell in her drug shop

loans.name: Ulloa 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Tomasina is the coordinator of her group Ulloa 1, 2 (Ulloa). Her story is representative of her group and, in general, of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone and a cement factory. In many parts of this area, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her three children.

Tomasina is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy rice, flour, other foods, and a freezer. Her business is a colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients and products to make your daily meals. Normally colmados are in local neighborhoods so that customers have a short distance to walk from their homes. She will use the profits to pay for her children's expenses at the university, to buy a vehicle, and also to finish building her house so that she has a safer home for her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for grocery store

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: Nasreen lives in Borewala, Pakistan with her family. She is 41 years old and does sewing work to support her family. Her husband sells fruit and vegetables in the market. She has only one daughter who couldn’t get an education unfortunately due to poor financial conditions. But now Nasreen is saving some money from her sewing business and is hopeful that soon she will be able to admit her daughter in a good school. She is applying for a loan from Asasah for the first time to help her husband buy fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables to expand his business and increase his income, Nasreen is very hopeful that this decision will prove helpful for her husband and bring positive results in his business.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. is from the village of Dalacon. She is 50 years old. Leonora is widowed and has 8 children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leonora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lirios De Rosas Pampa Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “LIRIOS DE ROSAS PAMPA” es nueva, esta iniciando su primer crédito, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, tiene como presidenta a la señora Paulina.

Las(os) integrantes de la asociación comunal son ocho, siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercio, como ser: venta de edredones, venta de joyas, venta de comida, venta de jugo de quinua, confección de todo tipo de prendas, ayudante de pensión y taller.

Doña Paulina al igual que el resto de sus compañeras, es una socia que tiene el deseo de mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida, con el crédito que va ha recibir. Su negocio es la venta de “jugo de quinua”, producto muy gustado por la población andina debido a que se consume como un desayuno caliente; además de la quinua hervida, la compota tiene manzana hervida y maicena.  Doña Paulina indica que aprendió este negocio hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Lirios de Rosas Pampa” is a new group that is starting its first loan cycle. It is part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center and Sra. Paulina currently serves as its president.

This Communal Association has eight members, seven women and one man. They have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors such as quilt sales, jewelry sales, quinoa juice sales, designing and sewing garments, and helping manage a dining hall and workshop.

Doña Paulina is treated the same as her fellow group members. She hopes to improve her business and quality of life with the loan she will receive. Her business involves selling “quinoa juice”, a popular food that is enjoyed by people living in the Andes because it is consumed as a hot breakfast. This dish consists of boiled quinoa, apples, and cornstarch. Doña Paulina says she learned about this type of business six years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa, sugar, and cornstarch in bulk

loans.name: Amelia Palmira

texts.pt:
Amélia Palmira F. conseguiu comprar todos produtos que foram previsto no empréstimo com a Hluvuku e foi para o destino acordado com a instituição.
	
Foi possível pagar o empréstimo em tempo previsto sem dificuldades e de acordo com o calendário estabelecido. O seu negócio atualmente teve melhorias consideráveis e não verificou nenhuma mudança em sua vida, a não ser o melhoramento do seu negócio.

 Com o presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos de salão de cabeleireiro para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma mercearia, explorando novas áreas de comércio.
texts.en:
Amélia Palmira F. managed to buy all the products that were listed on her loan with Hluvuku, and they were used for the purpose agreed to with the institution. It was possible to pay off the loan on time, without difficulties, and according to the repayment schedule. Her business currently has considerable improvement, and she did not report any life changes other than the improvement of her business. With this current loan of 20,000 meticais, she intends to purchase hairstyling products to increase her inventory. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to build a grocery store, exploring new areas of commerce.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for hair salon

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace mas de 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos, por lo que van de botica en botica para proveer algún producto medicinal, Siendo enfermera de profesión, realiza este negocio cuando termina su labor en una posta medica, lo cual hace que éste trabajo sea mucho más fácil, por lo que garantiza los productos que ofrece y recomienda. Esta muy contenta con las actividades que realiza, además que le permite tener los ingresos necesarios para sostener su hogar y para el futuro se proyecta tener una gran distribuidora de productos farmacéuticos en su localidad. Es su 14avo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en productos farmacéuticos y de esa manera incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old and lives at her parents’ house with her husband and child. For the past seven years, she has been selling pharmaceutical products by visiting individual drugstores and providing them with what they need. Maribel is a nurse by profession and started this business when she quit her job in the medical field. She finds that this job is much easier and spends her day promoting the products she offers and making recommendations. Maribel is pleased with what she has accomplished because her business enables her to have the income she needs to support her family. In the future, she hopes to open a large distribution center for pharmaceutical products in her neighborhood.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Maribel is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. She thanks those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will be helpful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more pharmaceutical products, which will help increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Nativida Julia

texts.es: La Señora Natividad López se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas elaboradas por ella misma con alta calidad por lo que los clientes le llegan a visitar para la compra de estas deliciosas tortillas. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar dichas tortillas y de esta forma satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y así continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación que tanto dependen de ella.
texts.en: Mrs. Natividad Julia López A. makes tortillas in her home in the neighborhood of Camilo Ortega. Her children are not under her care, but they help her to roll the tortillas. Mrs. Natividad has already had 29 credits, which she has repaid on time and in full.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tortillas

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phase and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make phase to sell.  Mary is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 4 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more groundnuts to make phase to sell

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Compra de mercadería para el negocio ropa en general, tela.
texts.en: Purchase of merchandise for her business.  Clothes and fabric.

loans.use: Sale of clothes and toys

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Madame Fama T. est une femme mariée de 43 ans.  Elle habite à Bambilor. Madame T. a choisi l’activité de commerce a cause de son aspect lucratif pour la satisfaction de ses besoins. Ainsi elle évolue depuis 2005 dans l’achat et la vente de produits de beauté, de tissus et divers autres. En même temps elle  pratique l’élevage de poussins. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis juin 2010. Elle emprunte 300000frs qui sera destiné à l’achat de 500 poussins. Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter ses sujets, d’améliorer la rentabilité de son activité et par conséquent de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. Fama T. is a married and 43 years old. She lives in Bambilor. Mrs. T. has decided to be a merchant motivated by the financial aspect and the need to cover her expenses. And thus since 2005 she has been active in selling cosmetic products, fabrics, and various other items. In addition, she also raises chickens. She joined the Bambilor fund in June 2010. She is borrowing 300,000 Francs, which will be used to purchase 500 chicks. This loan will allow her to increase her livestock, to improve the profitability of her business, and, as a result, to increase her savings.

loans.use: Purchasing chicks

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Jean Pierre Habyarimana est commerçant, et il a une boutique à Gisenyi.  Il a 23 ans, et il est célibataire.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter 200 paires de chaussures et 30 pantalons pout son commerce dans le marché de Gisenyi.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de l’augmentation des quantités vendues dans sa boutique.  Il voudrait devenir un grand commerçant dans le secteur Gisenyi, dans la province de l’ouest. Pour sa famille et lui-même, il voudrait construire sa propre maison d’habitation, et, suite aux bénéfices réalisés, il payera les frais d’études pour son petit frère.  Quand il n’est pas dans le marché, il est aussi éleveur des chèvres.
texts.en: Jean Pierre Habyarimana is a merchant; he has a store in Gisenyi. He is 23 years old and single. With his loan, he would like to  buy 200 pairs of shoes and 30 trousers for his store at the GIsenyi market. His strategy for increasing his revenue is to increase the quantities of goods sold in his store. He would like to have a big store in the Gisenyi sector, in the Western province. For his relatives and himself, he would like to build a house to live in; also, thanks to his revenues, he will play the tuition of his younger brother. When he is not at the market, he also works raising goats.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes and trousers for his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children.  One child attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable stall for six years, selling at the local market to her neighbors and those who pass by.  Grace's major challenge is the transportation of goods. In the future, she hopes to expand and sell wholesale vegetables to other businesses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and tomatoes to sell in her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 62-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He started to work in the car mechanics field 50 years ago.  He represents the only income provider for the family and wants to amplify the family’s income. He repairs different types of cars. 

Due to his long experience in this field, he was able to gain a good number of clients passing by his shop and asking for his services.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase various tools instead of the old ones to complete his work and be able to increase his efficiency and therefore his sales.

loans.use: to purchase various tools

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 41 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que desde pequeña le gusto el comercio y la venta de mercadería de persona a persona.   

Poco a poco a surtido su mercadería pero sigue vendiendo puerta a puerta y a sus vecinos y amigos que le compran a menudo y le ayudan a generar más ingresos. Ella vende ropa de hombres y mujeres también perfumes para variar un poco en sus ventas. Una de las cosas que le favorece es que aunque la tiene 41 años ella está estudiando en la universidad y los compañeros le comprar varia mercadería. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo mercadería como pantalones, camisas, zapatos y asi tener variedad en su mercadería.
texts.en:
41 year old María is a hard working woman who has liked being in business and selling door to door since she was a little girl.

Little by little she has varied her merchandise, but continues to sell door to door.  Her friends and neighbors, who enthusiastically buy from her, also help her earn a greater income.  She sells men’s and women’s clothing and perfumes in order to vary her merchandise a bit.  One thing that sets her apart is that, even though she is 41 years old, she is studying at university and her classmates also buy some items from her.

She wants to continue in her business, and wants to use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, and shoes.  This was she will be able to offer a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Santos Jacobo

texts.es: El señor Santos Jacobo posee un negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte y pulpería.  El tiene 45 años, la pulpería  está ubicada en su casa de habitación, pero el mismo brinda el servicio de transporte en su triciclo ya que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano y prepararse para atender a todos sus clientes. Mantener estos negocios no ha sido fácil, pero las ganas de salir adelante y proporciónale a su hijo lo necesario son los factores que lo motivan a continuar. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima para la pulpería y repuesto para su triciclo,  A pesar de no tener mucho dinero vive muy feliz con su familia y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Como toda persona luchadora tiene los sueños de continuar trabajando para su familia.
texts.en: Santos Jacobo has a convenience store business and he also provides transportation services. He is 45 years old and his convenience store is located in his home. He provides transportation services on his tricycle and every day he needs to start very early to be able to attend to his clients. The management of these businesses has not be easy but his sheer will to get ahead and to provide his son with what he needs have been the motivating factors that keep him going. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise for his convenience store and to repair his tricycle. Despite not having very much money he leads a very happy life with his family and they enjoy all the basic commodities. Like any other hardworking person his dreams are to keep working for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and buying and selling livestock. She lives in Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4000. Sanita is borrowing PHP 19500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Sanita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.
 
About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Khoem T. is a 44-year-old married woman blessed with three single children, all of whom are in school. Khoem T. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house; she makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave the baskets. Khoem T. also orders baskets from other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Khoem T. is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings in order to buy a piece of land for farming. This loan will provide her family with an additional asset.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Mery Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas para luego venderlos a los restaurantes y clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia trabaja para una empresa de televisión local el cual ya lleva 5 años trabajando para esta empresa ella trabaja de lunes a sábado por las mañanas, la socia es una persona bien alegre y emprendedora con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de alimentos para sus animales como maíz, pasto entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”.  The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco.  

Mery is 38 years old, married and has 4 children.  She alternates her daily activities between her small husbandry business, raising animals like guinea pigs an hens to later sell them to restaurants and other customers; at the same time, she works for a local television business.   She has worked there for 5 years in the mornings Monday through Saturday.  Mery is a very happy and entrepreneurial person, with a great desire to move her family forward. 

She is asking for a loan to buy food for her animals, like corn, grass and other things.

She is very happy because of the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals like corn, grass and other things

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 61 years old and lives in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She lives in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her son's backyard. She used to live in the countryside and came to live in the province center in 2006.

She sells cooked meals in order to support herself. She has her regular customers, as she cooks delicious meal. She is a hardworking person and she says, "We cannot live without foodl. I like cooking delicious meals and I like people enjoying the meals cooked by me." She is requesting a loan of 250,000 MNT to purchase food ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Basem

texts.ar: باسم عمره 30 سنة يعمل في صالون للحلاقة رجالي له في عمله 9 سنوات اعزب يحب عمله يسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخوله وتحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي باسم يساعد اهله في تحسين وضعهم المادي فهو يسعى دائما الى توثيق الروابط الأسرية يتميز بالعمل الجيد والمبتكر كان للقرض السابق الأثر الجيد على عمله وتحسين وضع محله يتميز محله بنقطة مميزة فهو قريب من جميع الضيع المجاورة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل من شامبو وزيوت للشعر وماكنة ماساج حتى يواكب تطور العمل وينتقل بعمله من مرحلة التقليد الى الابتكار في العمل
texts.en: Basem, 30, has been working at a barber shop for 9 years. He has a passion for his work. Basem wishes to increase his income and to raise his standard of living. Basem helps his family and always seeks to strengthen his relationship with them. His previous loan had a positive impact on his work. His shop has a great location in his neighbourhood. Basem wants a loan to buy stock for his shop, like shampoo, hair oil, and massage equipment, so as to keep abreast with the latest styles in his job and turn from imitation to innovation.

loans.use: To buy stock for his barber shop

loans.name: Ana Elena

texts.es:
Ana Elena C. de 52 años vive en el barrio la Paz de la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos de gallina, los cuales distribuye su hijo y un ayudante en una bicicleta que diariamente visita las tiendas para ofrecerles y al dia siguiente llevarle los pedidos solicitados; Ana tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 30 años que ha educado en condición de separada y sueña  verlos convertidos en personas exitosas en el futuro.  En la actualidad está aplicando a  su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque su negocio ha crecido gradualmente y necesita capital de trabajo para comprar huevos  en mayor volumen y responder a  las solicitudes que le han hecho nuevos clientes, a quienes quiere  retener  con una respuesta oportuna. 
Ana Elena inició su negocio aprovechando la experiencia de su hijo en el mercado, cuando este se encontraba  empleado como ayudante de un camión que distribuía de tienda  en tienda; así fue que  cuando el hijo de Ana decidió dar rienda suelta a su espíritu empresarial, involucró a su madre en el negocio y hoy ella vende desde su propia vivienda.  Su meta más adelante es adecuar un dormitorio con vista  hacia la calle, como una bodega de almacenamiento y desde ahí contratar vendedores que hagan la distribución;  aunque  aún no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente, este es su gran desafío, así que mientras fortalece su sueño,  continua trabajando con un margen no inferior a un 17% y sus inventarios rotan cada dos días y se esfuerza por aumentar su clientela aplicando su vocación de servicio.
texts.en:
Ana Elena C. is 52 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Paz in the city of Barranquilla. She buys and sells chicken eggs. Her son and an assistant distribute the eggs on bicycle every day to the stores where they took orders the day before. Ana has three children who are between the ages of 20 and 30. They continued their education after she separated from her spouse and now she dreams of seeing them become successful individuals in the future.

At the moment, Ana is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her business has grown gradually and she needs operating capital to buy eggs in large quantities so that she can fulfill the orders she has received from new customers. She wants to retain them by providing a timely response.

Ana Elena started this business in order to take advantage of her son’s experience at the market. He was employed as an assistant on a truck that delivered goods from store to store. Her son acted upon the urge to become an entrepreneur, so he decided to involve his mother in the business and now Ana sells from her home. Her future goal is to remodel a bedroom facing the street and convert it into a storage space. At that point, she plans to hire vendors to handle the distribution. However, her greatest challenge is still a lack of sufficient capital. In order to fulfill her dream, Ana continues to work and achieve no less than a 17% profit margin and a two-day product turnover. She intends to increase her customer base by implementing a commitment to service.

loans.use: to purchase eggs in large quantities.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es un agricultor muy conocida de Pilas en Pérez Zeledon y tiene 40 años de edad.
El tiene una finca de 15 hectáreas, y se ha dado cuenta el jengibre y el ñampi se está vendiendo a  muy buen precio en el mercado costarricense. Es por eso que el quiere un préstamo de  ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de abonos y para la siembre de este tipo de tubérculos.
El espera que su producción sea un  éxito y así mejorar sus ingresos.  
El es socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who is well-known in the Pilas neighborhood of Pérez Zeledon.  He is 40 years old.  

Jose has a farm that includes 15 hectares of land on which he grows ginger and “ñampi” (a tuber similar to taro root).  These products sell for a very good price at the Costa Rican market.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 CRC so that he can buy compost for cultivating these types of tubers.  He hopes that his production is successful and that his income will improve.

Jose is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., which is one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase compost for cultivating tubers.

loans.name: Luis Uriel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, casado, padre de cuatro hermosos hijos, su negocio es propio, cadete de taxi, siendo el taxi de su propiedad. El cual lleva seis años laborando para el bienestar común de la familia.
El taxi lo compro una parte de ahorros y otra con la liquidación de su trabajo como conductor de la ruta urbana de la capital, pues por ser un trabajo cansado, decide renunciar y optar por su propio negocio.
Su esposa labora como docente, lo que comparten los gastos de alimentación, educación, gastos de pagos básicos. Logrando tener el equilibrio.
Luis como objetivo es la reparación de su taxi el cual no  ha dado mantenimiento debido a que ha tenido pocas ganancias y tiene que cubrir otros gastos. Por tal razón recurre al financiamiento de Afodenic para poder hacer los cambios necesarios como: parabrisas delanteros, dos llantas nuevas, cambio de aceite, afinar motor. Y seguir brindando una carrera en mejores condiciones para el usuario.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old, married, and has four beautiful children.  He owns his own business as a taxi driver and owns his own vehicle.  He has been working for six years for the well-being of his family.

Luis bought his taxi with some savings that he had and also the severance pay that he received from his job as a driver on an urban route in the capital.  As this was a tiring job, he decided to resign and start his own business.

Luis' wife works as a teacher and together they jointly cover their family's food, education and basic expenses.

Luis' goal is to repair his taxi.  He hasn't had maintenance work carried out on it because he didn't earn enough and had to cover other expenses.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Afodenic so that he can make some necessary repairs and replacements such as: his front windshield, two new tires, oil change, engine tuning.  In this way, he will be able to continue providing a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his taxi, buy tires, change the oil, etc. in order to provide a good service

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng and her husband had a photo taken together in her tailoring shop. They always help each other to serve both old and new customers.  This couple runs their business very well and a lot of customers admire the good service they are providing. In addition, Heng sells many goods at her house to her neighbors for more profit. Heng has four children, three are single and the other one is married. All of them help her in the same business. Heng will use her loan to build a new kitchen and repair her old toilet.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen and repair her old toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies for her husband's retail business selling home products.

loans.name: Brayan

texts.en:
Brayan is 25 years old and lives in Plaridel. He is married and has 2 children. 

Brayan works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan for 10,000. Brayan has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 52-year-old married man, father of three children, who has been working in transportation since 2002. Ghassan wants to buy a new car that will help improve his business by attracting tourists who ask for a private taxi to go on a tour all over the country in a comfortable car. He said that "it is time to change my car, because this one is getting old and tired like humans it's almost its time to rest."

Ghassan intends to sell his current car and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to add this money to what he gets from his car's price. This will allow him to purchase a new car.

This business is his only source of living, and he works hard to improve it to stay attractive to new customers and adapt to different changes. Ghassan hopes to stay healthy and active, in order to reply to all requested tours, and to keep on providing his family with the best living.

loans.use: to buy a new car to improve his business

loans.name: Rodrigo Abel

texts.es: Rodrigo Abel   es un joven que vive en el departamento de Cochabamba provincia Cercado es soltero y vive aun con sus papas, el no pudo terminar de estudiar por la situación económica de su familia a muy corta edad tuvo que empezar a trabajar para poder mantener y ayudar a su familia, él vive en una pequeña urbanización al este de la ciudad la cual está empezando a desarrollarse aún no cuentan con caminos definidos y durante el día solo ingresan dos movilidades de transporte publico la cual provoca que él no pueda llegar a su trabajo a tiempo. El trabaja en una tienda de carpintería de aluminio que se encuentra a 1 hora de su casa en el centro de la ciudad, el solicita un crédito para poder comprarse una motocicleta y asi poder llegar a tiempo a su trabajo y por las tardes irse temprano a casa para poder ayudar en las labores del hogar a su mamá.
texts.en: Rodrigo Abel is a young man who lives in the department of Cochabamba, province of Cercado. He is single and still lives with his parents. He wasn't able to finish his studies due to his family's financial situation. He had to start working at a very young age in able to support and help his family. He lives in a small neighborhood of this city which is still beginning to develop and still doesn't have defined streets. During the day there are only two public buses and that means that he can't get to his job on time. He works in a carpentry workshop that works with aluminum. It is an hour from his house in the city center. He is asking for the loan to be able to buy a motorcycle and thus be able to get to his job on time and get hoe early in the afternoon to help his mother with the housework.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to be able to get to work.

loans.name: Vidal Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Vidal; el socio tiene 40 años de edad y es socio es soltero, el socio se dedica principalmente a la construcción a él lo llaman de diferentes ciudades y trata de abastecerse y está en todo, el socio también tiene un internet llamado “Talita Cumi”; el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir en la implementación de sus internet que lo tiene desde hace 4 años y poder mejores algunos equipos y accesorios de este. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de sus negocio de internet, el socio comprara cámaras web, monitores plasma y teclados nuevos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para su negocio de internet.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sr. Vidal is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 40 years old and single. Vidal works primarily in construction and is called to work in different cities, so he tries to be prepared for everything. He also manages an Internet café called “Talita Cumi”. On this occasion, he wants to invest in his Internet business so that it will stay in operation. He started this business four years ago and wants to improve it with some equipment and accessories. Vidal is requesting a loan to invest in the operation of his Internet business, so he will use the funds to buy web cameras, plasma monitors, and new keyboards.

He is grateful for the support being provided and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.
