loans.use: to buy web cameras, plasma monitors, and new keyboards.

loans.name: Selpha

texts.en: Selpha is 38 years old, married and has four children between 15 and 7 years old whom they hope to educate to the university level. She operates a restaurant business where she makes and sells local food to the people at Enjinja in Kakamega. She has been in this business for three years now and has managed to give employment to two people. She says that the business is good and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to make sure her business is doing well. She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy foodstuffs to make different types of dishes to sell to her customers. She sees herself growing her business, opening restaurants in other areas within Kakamega town and building a residential house for her family. She describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to buy meat, beans, flour, etc.

loans.name: Fernanda Rosibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Paraíso se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fernanda, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de agua.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio, ella en sociedad con su papá tienen un negocio de venta de sabanas, toldos, toallas y ropa en general. Ellos se desplazan hasta otras ciudades muchas veces a ciudades del Oriente ecuatoriano donde sus productos se venden muy bien, por el momento ella  no viaja ya que su hijo está muy pequeño, pero cuando esté un poco más grande su bebé piensa dejarlo donde su mamá y realizar sus viajes junto a su papá y realizar de nuevo sus ventas.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: toldos, sabanas, toallas y  ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 ciclos, es la tesorera del banco  y le gusta estos créditos que son de mucha ayuda en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive donde sus suegros.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'El Paraíso' (Paradise) community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place noted for being a very commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of the local people.

Here we meet Fernanda who is 23 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage who are 4 and 1.  Her eldest is in kindergarten.  Her husband works for a water company.

Our friend is a retailer.  In partnership with her dad, she has a business selling sheets, canopies, towels and clothes.  They travel to other cities; often to cities in the east of Ecuador where their products sell very well.  Right now she doesn't travel as her son is still very young but when he is a little older she plans to leave him with her mom and resume her trips with her dad so that she can start making sales again.

Fernanda will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as canopies, sheets, towels and all kinds of clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for five loan cycles.  She likes these loans which are a great help to her in her business.

Fernanda's dream is to own her own home as she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy canopies, sheets, towels and clothes

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a farmer who is not only devoted to his work but also to being a good father to his three children. He works hard raising cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. His older son helps him run the business. Kamal's earnings from the business are 150 USD. Without a doubt, it is not an easy task but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. Currently, Kamal wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle, which in the long run will provide better financial income. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ernestina; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, lápiz labiales entre otros productos de belleza, la socia trabaja en forma independiente desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lápiz labial, perfumes y cremas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ernestina belongs to the communal bank "Kanchary."  This bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Ernestina is 57 years old, single, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling beauty products such as: perfumes, creams, lipstick, and other beauty products.  She works independently from 7am until 9pm, and through this business she provides for her child.  She wants to expand and improve her business selling beauty products.  She requests a loan to buy lipstick, perfumes and creams at wholesale.

Ernestina is pleased to have this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, perfumes and creams at wholesale

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 45 years old. She lives in the village of Sairkhe in the Imereti Region of West Georgia. She is married and lives with her children: two sons (24 and 21 years old) and a daughter, 22 years old. Elza's sons are construction workers. They work on construction in their and nearby villages. Elza's daughter is a pharmacist. She works in a village pharmacy. 

Elza leads the agricultural business of the family. They own a milk cow and sell dairy products in Zestaponi (a nearby town). Also the family has a small poultry farm. They sell eggs at the same market. Along with the above, Elza sells grapes, harvested from 200 family-owned vines. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris (approximately $240). 

Elza requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. She will increase her sales of dairy products and thus raise the income of the family. The family members will be able to purchase needed household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Agabus

texts.en: Agabus is a fifty-year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling firewood for four years; he now has a contract of supplying mainly to a secondary school. His hardship is late payment and his vision is to expand his business and educate his children. Agabus needs the loan to buy land for trees to cut for firewood.

loans.use: to buy land for trees to cut for firewood.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a rickshaw transport business and a clothes sales business where he gives transport services to the local people and sells clothing to them. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located at Nakuru town. He describes his biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds and inflation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand the two businesses within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a residential house.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to boost the clothing sales business

loans.name: 03.08.66 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tân operates a food stall selling cake. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the prepared food to sell.

Tân is 52 years-old and she is married with three children.  Tân is the group leader of the 03.08.66 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of seven members.   Tân lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tân joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her  business. Tân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tân has been involved in this business for three years.

The main harship that Tân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tân hopes to build a new house, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make prepared food to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Jean has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 10000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang is 42 years old.  She is widowed and lives with four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She raises ducks to produce eggs to sell. Neang requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase duck feed to feed the ducks in order to produce eggs faster to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to support her children while they study to earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase duck feed to speed up egg production.

loans.name: Sarou

texts.en: Sarou, 28, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sarou sells groceries and her husband is a construction worker. Sarou is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work at his construction site. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income and decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to buy dessert to sell beside selling groceries. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Ayesha Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha Bibi, aged 55 years, is an uneducated woman. She has given birth to three children: two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is a laborer while her youngest son studied until the 6th standard level. Her daughter is uneducated and helps Ayesha in managing the household work and taking care of the family members. 

Ayesha’s husband is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes on order. His work is home based. He gets orders from different shoe factories and shoe shops and meets them on time to generate income for the family.
 
Ayesha has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will purchase leather, nails and a shoe polisher in larger quantities for finishing the orders and to earn maximum profits.  Ayesha is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Ayesha Bibi.

loans.use: to buy leather, nails and a shoe polisher for shoemaking business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 29 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a grocery stall where she earns an income of Kes. 18,000 a month. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., for 21,000 Kes., to buy vegetables and fruits, including bananas, oranges and cabbage, to sell to her customers. Grace will use the additional income she earns to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Romelo

texts.en:
Romelo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children.
 
Romelo has a shop that sells fish like trout and sardines. He has had this business for 10 years. 

He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy fish to resell.

Romelo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010. In the future, Romelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 45 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, salts, rice, onions, cooking oil, curry, chickens, large tin bowls, and an oven. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salts, rice, onions, cooking oil, curry, chicken, large tin bowls, and an oven.

loans.name: Ambeyi

texts.en:
Ambeyi lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Ambeyi has been farming for twenty years, and has eight children. He is currently growing sugar cane and maize on his land, as well as keeping his own beehives. He likes beekeeping because it is not a time consuming activity, and it enables him to focus on his other farming. 

This is Ambeyi’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Chichek

texts.en: Chichek is 51 years old, married and has four adult children. For more than 20 years she has been raising livestock. Thanks to her hard and persistent work, she currently has two milk cows, two calves, two steers. Everyday, Chichek sells delicious and organic milk. She has applied to the VF Azercredit for a loan of 1000 AZM to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. Chichek plans to expand her business in order to save some money for the building of a house for her eldest son.

loans.use: To buy livestock for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana A. is 36 years old. She is married and has two children - older boy and a girl. Her husband is unemployed and they both breed 5 cows in a farm near Vratza.

For the first years of their marriage Tatiana and her husband live with her parents in the town but because of the fact that they both do not have any special education it is hard for them to find a decent job.

So 3 years ago they decided to start cattle breeding and found their farm. All the milk that they produce is being sold to one of the biggest dairy in the region.

Now they breed 5 cows and want to buy 3 more. That will cost $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy three more cows.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has five children who are in school. She also takes care of her brothers child, who is also in school. She started her business with $150. She has managed the business for the last five years, making it grow from retail to wholesale.

Given the loan, she wants to expand her business to enable her to serve many markets which are within easy reach.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stockfor her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the loan in purchasing motorcycle parts and to expand his mechanic's shop.

loans.name: Ángel Iván

texts.es:
Ángel is married and has two children ages 4 and 6. For two years Ángel has worked in a factory located in Escobedo, Nuevo León. But the salary he earned was not enough to meet the needs of his family. Facing this situation, a year ago he decided to start his own business selling tacos. Little by little he has become known among his neighbors for the high quality of his products, which has grown his business.

He is now requesting a loan for US$550 to purchase supplies for his tacos, which he will use to increase production and continue to grow his business. He commits to repay this loan within 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business. Contribute to improve the quality of life of Ángel and his family, they thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Ángel es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 4 y 6 años de edad. Desde hace dos años Ángel es obrero en una fábrica de la localidad de Escobedo en el estado de Nuevo León, pero el salario que recibe era insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta situación decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de tacos hace un año. Poco a poco se ha dado a conocer entre los vecinos y ha hecho crecer su negocio gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos.

Ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los tacos, con esto planea incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, contribuye a mejorar la vida de Ángel y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Ariza

texts.ru:
Ariza M. was born in 1964 in the town of Aksu, where she lives now. She is married and has 3 children. In the past, Ariza’s family raised cattle. In 2004, Ariza M. took a $200 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro to purchase sheep. Since 2006, Ariza switched to selling clothing for women. Now, she wants to expand her business by adding clothing for children to her assortment of goods. Ariza asks for a $1000 loan to fund the expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ариза Мехтиева, родилась 1964 году в городе Аксу. Данный момент проживает в этом же городе. Семейная, имеет троих детей. Семья ранще занималась скотоводством. 2004 году она взяла кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 200$ и купила овцы .С 2006 года Ариза стала заниматься торговли женскими одеждами.Теперь она хочеть расширят бизнес и торговат детскими одеждами.Она еще раз хочеть взять кредит 1000$.

loans.use: To increase inventory for business expansion

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. is a 43-year-old man, who is a practicing doctor. He is married and has three adult children. He lives in Kayole, an informal settlement within Nairobi, where he also runs his medical clinic. Apart from his family, he takes care of two children orphaned by HIV/AIDS.

Dr. M. began a clinic back in his rural home in 1996 using some of his own savings amounting to about Ksh. 70,000 (USD 1000), that he had put aside when he was still employed by the Kenyan government. By 1998, the clinic's business had grown tremendously, so that he had moved locations thrice, in order to accommodate the immense need for medical services.

Unfortunately in 1998, he encountered several difficulties when the landlord where his business was located increased the rent to four times higher; the rent shot from about US$ 570 to US$ 1715. He therefore found that due to this steep increase in overhead, he could no longer manage to pay the workers he had employed, let alone continue with the operations of the clinic. Apart from this, his clinic also suffered tremendously due to non-payment of medical bills, i.e., many patients he had admitted failed to remit payments. To further compound the problem, many of these patients were either relatives or neighbours from his home area, making it more difficult for him to reclaim payments, since culturally, it would seem very insensitive of him. By the year 2001, he had incurred a working loss of Ksh. 1.5 million, (US$ 21,430). This amount has not been paid to date.

In addition to these problems, he encountered another issue when he traveled to attend a seminar and was away for three months. Upon his return, he found that his staff had stolen and sold off most of the medical equipment he had acquired, and the clinic had actually been run down. This was a very difficult experience for him, therefore he decided to close what was remaining of the clinic, and he carried away the little furniture that was left. It is with this furniture that he decided to start off a small clinic within Kayole, an informal settlement within Nairobi.

The Exodus clinic is located in the Kayole area of Nairobi, in the middle of a low-income group of residents. The clinic is formally registered with the Ministry of Health in Kenya. Most of the patients that Dr. M. attends to are mothers and children, together with HIV/AIDS patients. His aim of setting up the clinic was to reach the less privileged in Kenyan society, by providing medical service that is affordable for them.

Dr. M. now intends to set apart a child welfare clinic within his premises, from where he will be in a better position to provide services related to the growth and well-being of children ages five years and below, from the Kayole area. From here he intends to provide vaccinations and health education for the parents, and he will also include family planning services. As an extension, he intends to provide home-based care, that is, door-to-door vaccination services, and generally attempt to raise the awareness of the community concerning the importance of vaccination for children.

Dr. M. is therefore requesting a loan amounting to US$ 950 with which he will be able to partition off a part of the treatment room, in order to create space for the child welfare clinic. The loan will also enable him to purchase furniture for his clinic, acquire an assortment of medical drugs, a scale for babies, surgical forceps and scissors. He will also purchase a small television set that will keep the children busy as they wait to receive treatment. He intends to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase office and clinic furniture, medical drugs, baby weighing scale, assorted surgical forceps and scissors, and a small TV set

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Sit back and relax! 27 year-old Amina sells a range of mattresses, sofa seats and comfy cushions. She established the business in 2002, which she has guided from strength to strength and now generates a profit of about $360 per month. She has generously shared the fruits of her labour not only with her own children, Iddy and Fakhi but with two of her sister’s children, Warda and Amina, whom she now cares for. Never one to rest on her laurels (or her cushions!) she is now requesting a loan of $1,125 to expand her business by purchasing additional stock.

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Amina would like to purchase additional mattresses and cushions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Warni

texts.en: Warni, 34, is the mother of 2 children and has a food stall where she sells noodles, meatballs, fried snacks, coffee, etc.  She makes $10 a day. Her husband, S., sells vegetables door-to-door around the villages and earns $7 a day. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of $100 to add her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 36 years old. He lives and works in Bekaa, Lebanon. Mohamad owns and operates a grocery store. This is the third time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, Mohamad would like to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sustain and develop his business

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 28 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She has been preparing and selling corn dough (prepared from maize and used in preparing kenkey, banku and porridge) and maize to her community folks for the past three and a half years. Fati’s working capital is very small and therefore she wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of maize for the lean season. She plans to start saving for her children’s school fees.

Fati is a member of the trust group called Gold. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Meng R. is 49 years old and is living in Kampong Cham province.  She has been farming the land there since she was a child 1979 directly after the brutal Khmer Rouge regime ended in Cambodia.  Her husband, Va Chea, is also a farmer.  The two of them barely earn 2 US$ per day together. They have five children, four of who still live with their parents. One helps with the farm and another is a construction worker.  Together the family earns about 136 US$ per month for the seven of them. Meng R. would like to start a small grocery business fR. her home to sell basic groceries to others in the village.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos B. is 25 years old, married to 20 year old Maria Benítez. He is a computer teacher. Carlos says that after studying at a local institute, he decided to share his knowledge with other people, and that is how he began his own institute with only 2 computers. Today he has 9 computers and a very good quantity of students.

The loan will be used to expand his locale, as his business is growing. In addition has is planning to sell computer accessories in the future.

He wishes that his county be free from corruption and with more opportunities for work for all Paraguayans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Carlos B. tiene 25 años y esta casado con Maria Benítez de 20 años. El es instructor en el área de informática, Carlos cuenta que luego de estudiar en un instituto local, se decidió a compartir sus conocimientos con otras personas, fue así que inicio su propio instituto con apenas 2 computadoras. Actualmente ya cuenta con 9 computadoras y con muy buena cantidad de alumnos.

El préstamo será destinado a la ampliación del local, ya que el negocio va progresando. Además tiene proyectado dedicarse a la venta de accesorios de informática en el futuro.

El desea que su país este libre de corrupción y con más oportunidades de trabajo para todos los paraguayos.

loans.use: Enlarge his locale.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn C. lives in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where he in the business of house construction, while his wife, Mrs. Han Hean, is a subsistence farmer. Mr. Thorn C.’s family currently lives in poor conditions because he and his wife can generate only a small income. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Mr. Thorn C. is 45 and the father of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the three others are attending the local school. Previously, he obtained a loan from AMK to add with his savings to buy a cart for transporting fertilizers to the field.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beer in order to keep operating her small business.

loans.name: Abike

texts.en: Abike O. lives in Ijanikin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 65 years old and married with four children. Abike has been selling kerosene since 1988. Abike is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more kerosene to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza nació el 10 de Octubre de 1953, no estudió sólo asistió al Programa de Alfabetización, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos (un varón de 23 años, casado y una mujer de 16  años, soltera), vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia de El Collao, Puno.

Hace 08 años fue socia fundadora en el Banco Comunal Conduriri y desde el año pasado se cambió al Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Con el crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles compró golosinas, negocio al cual se dedica desde hace 06 años hasta la fecha. Reparte al por mayor y al por menor en las tiendas y vende al por menor en la plaza de Ilave. Lorenza manifiesta que durante 18 años vendía carne de alpaca, la cual llevaba directo a la ciudad de Tacna, también vendía verduras en Conduriri, conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 04 cajas de galletas con S/. 160, 05 cajas de chocolates con S/.100, 10 bolsas de caramelos con S/.100 y otros, los cuales serán distribuidos en la ciudad de Ilave, en Mazocruz.

Su sueño es poner una tienda de abarrotes en Mazocruz y que su hija estudie.
texts.en:
Lorenza was born on October 10, 1953. She did not study past learning the alphabet, shares a home, and is a mother of two children (a 23 year old married man, and a 16 year old single woman). She lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n, Mazocruz district, El Collao province, Puno. Eight years ago, she was a founding customer of the Banco Comunal Conduriri. Last year, she changed her bank to Banco Comunal “Generation 2000” in Mazocruz. With a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles, she bought candies, a business which she has been doing for 6 years to date. She sells wholesale and retail to small stores and sells retail in the key plaza. Lorenza says that she sold alpaca meat for 18 years, which she brought directly to the city Tacna. Also, she sold vegetables in Conduriri, together with her husband. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, which she will pay back in 4 payments, she will buy four boxes of cookies for S/ .160, 5 boxes of chocolates for S/.100, 10 bags of caramels for S/.100 and more, with which she will sell to the key city, in Mazocruz. Her dream is to put a grocery store in Mazocruz and that her daughter will study.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, chocolates, caramels, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of G. N. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 31 years. Nasreen baji’s husband lives in Saudi-Arabia. She is the mother of one son, who wants to start a business. Presently, he works in an electrical supplies shop. He wants to buy a “pick up” vehicle for loading purposes. Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy a “pick up” vehicle so that her son can start this business and earn good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few members. Farida baji wants a loan to buy tools to make electric switches to sell. Abida baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nargis baji and Rozina baji each want a loan to buy iron to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a "pick up" vehicle

loans.name: Nizama

texts.en:
Nizama was born in 1971 and she lives in Mećave, a village in Bosnia. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as an electrician, and Nizama grows vegetables and raises sheep and 2 cows. Nizama requests a loan of 600KM from Women for Women, International, to purchase feed for her cows and sheep to survive the winter.

This loan is guaranteed by Zahida Osmanović.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her cows and sheep

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is a forty-five-year-old divorced woman and a mother of four children. She says that all her children have completed school. 

A. produces two different kinds of local vegetable oil, palm oil and palm kernel oil. Palm oil is produced from the food of the palm fruit. Palm kernel oil is from the seed of the of the palm fruit. A. buys the palm fruit from the surrounding towns. 

She has been in this business for over six years and, through this business, she has been able to sponsor all of her children through high school. She wants to expand her business and her profit margin so she can sponsor some of her children to the tertiary level. 

A. is in the “Kristo Tease” (Christ Lives) Trust Bank group in her community. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and co-guarantee to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand oil production business

loans.name: Chaileang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chaileang, 41, is widowed with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are currently in school. Their family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Chaileang has been a silk weaver for twenty one years. She learned her trade from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
In order to help her husband, Visitacion engaged in a vegetable vending business. She has been in this business since 2006 and she still wants to improve it to gain more income.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $100 in order to have additional capital. She will buy different varieties of vegetables, meat, and fish to offer to her customers. Aside from retailing vegetables, Visitacion also ventures into selling secondhand ready-to-wear clothes to generate more income so that she may be able to meet all her family's needs.

She is doing her best because she really wants to support the education of her children, who will soon enter college. She prays hard that her loan request will be granted for the sake of her children who are studying well to achieve their ambitions in life.

Visitacion is 39 years old and married to Florendo, who is 45 years old and involved in farming activities. They are blessed with three children: Mark Jeffrey, who is 16 years old and a high school senior; Florendo Jr., who is 12 years old and in the last grade of elementary school; and Claris Jane, who is 9 years old and in grade three.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, meat and fish to sell

loans.name: Shahida M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji is 29 years old, married, and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Shahida baji quit school after passing the 8th standard because her parents couldn’t pay her education expenses. Shahida baji is married to M. A.. He has a motorbike rental business. He has been in this profession for the past five years. Shahida baji is the mother of one son who is four years old. Shahida baji successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another bike for her husband’s motorbike rental business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken-selling business. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy flour to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Мирзоалиев Махмадшариф проживает  в районе Бохтар . Возраст 37 лет , женат и детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование. По профессии плотник. Занимается производством пластиковых окон. Для того, чтобы увеличить объем продукции , хочет получить кредит и использовать его для закупки материала. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif M. lives in Bohtar. He is 37 years old, married, and childless. He has a high school education. He is, by trade, a carpenter. He works making plastic windows. To increase his production volume, he wants to take out a loan and use it to buy materials. He can repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials (plastic)

loans.name: Biter Oscar

texts.es: el Sr. Biter se dedica a dos tipos de negocios uno que es el principal de el que es la venta de papas y cebollas en el mercado de la capital, su otro negocio es una pulperia pero la maneja su esposa y esta queda su casa de habitacion, con la venta de papas y cebollas le va muy y el quiere comprar varios sacos para poder tener para dos meses ya que este producto esta variando el precio de compra y se esta poniendo caro , y lo que el quiere es comprarlo a precio justo para tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Biter Oscar V. C. has two businesses. The main one consists of the sale of potatoes and onions, which he does in a market in the capital city. His other business is a convenience store; his wife runs this from their home. He wants to buy many sacks of potatoes and onions, as the prices are currently going up and he wants to make sure he buys them before they rise even further, so that he can make a profit.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes and onions

loans.name: Momisafar

texts.ru: Каракулова Момисафар проживает в одном из дальних кишлаков города Яван. Возраст 52 года , замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Всю жизнь занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет 10 гектаров земли. Пять гектаров засеяно пшеницей. Остальные пять гектаров планирует засеять тыквой . Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы закупить семена тыквы и удобрения. Она сажает тыкву очень хорошего сорта. Поэтому реализация происходит очень быстро и она получает хороший доход.
texts.en:
Q. Momisafar lives in one of the outlying villages of the city of Yavan. She is 52 years old, is married and has six children. She has worked in agriculture her entire life. She has 10 hectares of land. Five hectares are planted with wheat. She plans to plant pumpkins on the other five hectares. This is why she has turned to us for credit, in order to purchase pumpkin seeds and fertilizer. She plants a very good type of pumpkin. As a result her sales go very fast and she earns a good income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pumpkin seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emith

texts.es:
La señora Emith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras” vive en Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1088, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años, 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar donD. cuenta con todo lo que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con alegría y entusiasmo a sus clientes. 

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,700.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Emith, anhela convertir su bodega en un minimarket y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo logra.
texts.en:
Emith is a member of the Mujeres Luchadoras community bank. She lives at Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1088, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 55, married, and has 2 independent children. Her enterprising character and the love for her family motivated her to start her own business of selling groceries. Little by little the business was growing, and she was gaining experience in this type of work. She is very well known and liked among her customers. She currently has regular customers who shop at her store every day. The store has everything a housewife needs. Emith personally tends to her customers with happiness and enthusiasm. With a loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk, boxes of preserved fish of various brands, eggs, and personal hygiene products to continue giving her customers the best attention. Emith yearns to convert her small store into a mini market. She will make this a reality; when she proposes something she does it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery products (rice, noodles, milk, canned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina es una mujer de 30 años, que toda su vida trabajó para salir adelante, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro. Tiene un puesto de venta de celulares en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus celulares se venden rápidamente, ya que tiene los modelos más solicitados en stock, además que es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre está de buen humor. A Karina lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarlos sobre el celular que más les convendría, ella desea tener su propia tienda de celulares, ya que la que usa actualmente es alquilada. Lleva 5 años realizando este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es cubrir la demanda que tiene de celulares, ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para incrementar su stock. Es el primer préstamo que adquiere Karina con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere causarle problemas al resto de socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy apreciada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Los quinientos cincuenta nuevos soles, los invertirá en comprar más celulares, con los cuales pueda mejorar la variedad de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Karina is a 30-year-old woman who has worked her whole life to get ahead. She lives in her parents' home, and wants most to forge a good future for herself. She has a shop where she sells cellular phones on one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. Her phones sell quickly, as she has the most popular models in stock, and also because she is a very happy saleswoman, always in a good mood. What Karina likes most about her job is conversing with her customers and advising them about which phone best suits them. She would like to have her own cell phone store, as her current location is rented. She has been in this business for five years, and the most difficult part for her is meeting the demand, as she does not currently have the necessary capital to increase her stock. This is Karina's first loan with MFP. She expects that she will be punctual with her payments, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the rest of the members in her communal bank, where the responsibility she demonstrates is much appreciated. She will invest the 550 soles in the purchase of more phones, which will improve the variety of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Big Change Group

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K., Hajaratu K. and Kadiatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs based in the small town of Waterloo, about twenty miles from Freetown city. They named their group Big Change. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from Kiva through SMT, a Partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, these ladies will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve their living standard.

Mariatu K. (left) is the leader of the group. Mariatu was born in Freetown city. She is age twenty-nine, married to a driver and the two have two children. One of their children is in primary school and the other in nursery. Mariatu sells ready-to-wear clothes both for men and for women. She has been in this business for five years now.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Martha del Socorro E. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 6 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su pulpería ya que la atención  de Martha es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y maíz. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro E. is 51 years old and married. She has four children. She works selling basic grains. She has run this business for more than six years. Her shop is located in her home. Her business is run with little capital, but with much desire to get ahead. She must pay her household expenses as well as provide food and education for her children. Little by little she has increased her inventory using the small income her business generates. Her customers return to her shop because Martha is very helpful and always attends to her customers with a smile. The funds she is requesting will be used as capital to purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn. Her greatest dream is for her children to complete their studies and get ahead. With this work she is able to help them succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles I. is 33 years old and he is married with two children. He sells medicines to make a living. Charles hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is a member of the Ikweta East,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 15,9,5 years.

Eveline started her own clothing business selling vitenge and khanga (fabric)4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 40,000 Tsh.

This is Eveline first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more khanga na vitenge(fabric).

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Eveline hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and khanga

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Batsukh D. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His wife is a co-owner of his business.

Batsukh started his business early in 1994. In 2001, he started to sell pants in the Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in the city. He sells all types of men’s and women’s cotton pants. When he started his business, he was selling pants he had sewn himself. As it took a long time and a lot of hard work to sew each pair of pants, he started to sell ready made ones. Today, his working capital exceeds 2,200,000 tugrugs (~1,520 USD) and his sales are approximately 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1,380 USD) per month with a profit of 300,000-400,000 tugrugs (~210-270 USD).

Batsukh is an experienced and hardworking businessman. His wife helps him sell the pants at the market and they go to purchase pants in shifts. Batsukh said: ”We will keep running our business until our two children get into professions.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrugs loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of pants to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married 30-year-old woman with four children. She sells planks at a wood market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past five years, and hopes that her loan of N140,000 will allow her to purchase more planks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de ocupación comerciante de ropa por temporada vende en ferias populares del área rural del Altiplano Paceño, su esposo de ocupación comerciante de ropa vende en ferias populares de la Ciudad de Oruro, tiene 2 hijos y viven en casa propia de adobe ubicado en la zona de villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital de inversión, compra de mercadería.
 
Es el segundo crédito, su crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Isabel.

loans.use: COMERCIO

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and married without a child. She is a hairstylist and she also sells colorful shoes, bags and hair extensions.

Edith hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions, shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Rotalia

texts.en:
Rotalia N. is single and has no dependants. She has received schooling through senior high.

Rotalia sells gari (roasted cassava), maize, rice beans and groundnuts (peanuts) in Abotoase, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay for taking care of her financial needs, accommodation and the payment of utility bills.

With the high demand for the grains, she will use the loan to purchase a variety of the grains in large quantities for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grains in large quantities

loans.name: Lê Thị's Group

texts.en:
B. Lê Thị (10107070058) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  B. is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they both are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Xuân Trạch 03 (3).


B. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, B. works in someone else's business manufacturing & selling generally manufactured products to local businesses and community members.  B. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.578.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị P. (10107070059) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business irunning a general store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Lê Thị (10107070058) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xuân Trạch 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm được chế tạo thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2006, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.578.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị P. (10107070059) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Betzabeth Felicidad

texts.es: LA SEÑORA BETZABETH SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS, PARA ELLO ADQUIRIO UN AUTOMOVIL, CON EL CREDITO OTORGADO POR EMPRENDER, LA SEÑORA ANTES SE DEDICABA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA CUAL LO DEJO POR DEDICARSE AL TRANSPORTE, ACCEDIO AL CREDITO POR SER UNA BUENA CLIENTE, EL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR REPUESTOS PARA SU AUTOMOVIL. ELLA VIVE EN SU CASA CON SU ESPOSO Y  SUS 4 HIJOS EN LA ZONA DE CAPACACHI.
texts.en:
Señora Betzabeth transports passengers for a living. To do this, she acquired a car with the credit offered to her by Emprender. She used to sell food, but she stopped doing this to work in transportation. She was able to access this credit because she is a good client. She will use it to buy parts for her car. She lives in her home with her husband and four children in the Capacachi area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her car

loans.name: Nicholas Weru

texts.en:
Nicholas is married to Beatrice and they have three children: Caro, Margaret and Robert who are 28, 28 and 25 years old respectively.

Nicholas was introduced to KADET through existing clients and has no previous credit history. He is in the livestock business and manufactures livestock products. He has been in the livestock business for three years.

Nicholas manufactures livestock feeds and medicines in a government institution and supplies them to farmers across the country. Nicholas business is located within a government institution. He will use the amount from the loan to invest in his manufacturing business and with the extra profits he will invest in machinery as he hopes to own a factory.

Nicholas hopes to improve his lifestyle and that of his family as he believes he is focused and hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy raw materials for production of different products for livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, vive en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en su casita propia, junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil  y sus hijos menores  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. 

Tiene un pequeño kiosco en el cual, se dedica a la venta de comida. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de insumos, papa, carne, postre, verduras, etc.,  al por mayor, y así rebajar sus costos y mejorar sus ventas.

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband in her own home. He works as a bricklayer, and their minor children go to school. She has a small kiosk where she sells food. This loan will be used to buy supplies wholesale such as potatoes, meat, desserts, vegetables, etc., in order to lower her costs and improve her sales. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and their evaluation qualified her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-selling business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kactus II” desde hace 6 meses, vive en el distrito y provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta tercero de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros.

Vilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 100.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar algunos animales.

Ella requiere otro crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar: gatos, perros y alimento para estos.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma has been a member of the Community Bank ´Flor de Kactus II" for 6 months. She lives in the district and province of Huancane, Puno State. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. She studied until third grade and is dedicated to the purchase and selling of pets.

Vilma tells us that the first loan requested to Manuela Ramos group, was for 100 nuevos soles and allowed her to increase her working capital and buy some pets.

She needs a loan of $125 that will be invested in the purchase of cats, dogs and the food to feed them. Her dream is to grow her business and improve her income.

What she likes the most about the community bank is the meetings with the members

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo N. G. is forty-four years old, married and has two children. His business is located at Jua Kali in Kisumu. Jua Kali is the market in Kisumu which mostly has auto-spares businesses.

Festo owns a garage and sells auto spares and lubricants. He has been running this business for the last twelve years and his major challenge has been lack of enough space to do his business. There have been fire outbreaks also affecting his business big time and there are many people doing the same business as his and so customers are spoilt for choice.

Festo is using his loan to buy more auto spares and lubricants to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more auto spares and lubricants

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther H. is married and has five dependants. She has received a junior high education. Esther sells doughnuts and soya bean kebabs. She moves from place to place around Elmina selling to her customers, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is an engineer. Esther uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills and school fees. Esther will use the loan to purchase more bags of flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to make doughnuts and soya bean kebabs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y cuatro D. sus seis hijos en el distrito D. Monsefú, ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a vender pan y embutidos en los exteriores del mercado del distrito D. Pimentel, este distrito queda ubicado a media hora D. la zona en donD. vive. Ella nos comenta que inició el negocio en una iniciativa propia D. ayudar al sostenimiento D. su familia. Su esposo es panadero y ella le acompañaba a ofrecer sus productos por el distrito D. Monsefú y los distritos aledaños, fue entonces cuando decidio complementar el negocio D. su marido con el D. la venta D. embutidos.

Antonia va desD. muy temprano al distrito D. Pimentel junto a su esposo: mientras el venD. el pan y los productos que ha horneado el dia anterior, ella venD. los embutidos (queso, sachicha y mantequilla) a sus clientes. El negocio es rentable y D. mucha utilidad a los clientes ya que encuentran en un solo lugar los productos que necesitan para la preparación D. sus desayunos.

Antonia desea ampliar su negocio con la venta D. mas queso, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante honrada y amable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos hasta que estos terminen sus estudios superiores. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Antonia is 51 years old, married and lives with her husband and four of her six children in the Monsefu district, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past twelve years she has sold bread and sausages in the outsiD. market in the Pimental District. This district is located a half hour from the zone where she lives. She started this business of her own free will in order to help with the maintenance of her family. Her husband is a baker. She accompanied her husband in order to sell his products in the Monsefú district and the other neighboring districts. This was when she decided to add to her husband's business by selling sausages. Antonia leaves very early to go to the Pimentel district with her husband. While he sells bread and other products that he bakes the day before, she sells sausages as well as cheese, spicy sausage and butter, to her customers. The business is profitable and is very convenient for her customers as they can buy all the ingredients to prepare breakfast in one place. Antonia wishes to grow her business buy selling more cheese. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles which she will use to meet this objective. Antonia is very honorable and friendly. Her main desire is to continue supporting her children until they finish their higher education. Previously she worked with our institution. She has shown punctuality and responsibility from the very moment that she began paying back her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sausages in order to increase her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 44 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband sells beef to also support their home. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells sarongs and beef. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband to meet the basic needs of the family. She needs a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Pim

texts.en:
Mrs. Pim R. is a 42-year-old farmer who has been farming since 1999, earning about $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Choun, is 47 years old and a farmer. Pim R. has five teenage children. Two of them are employed in the garment industry and the others are going to school.

Because of increasing transportation costs, Pim R. decided to request a loan of $600 to add to her savings to purchase a motorcycle. This will be used by the family to reduce transportation costs. The loan will improve her business and sustain her family's living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nanjid

texts.en:
Nanjid is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Uranchimeg, is 20 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province as well. 

Nanjid operates a cafe with her husband. They prepare a variety of meals, including Mongolian traditional foods. They have been operating their cafe since 2004, and have two employees. Nanjid has been planning to expand her cafe in the future. She is a very hardworking and optimist person. She says, “My daughter will graduate soon. After she graduates I will open a restaurant with my family. Besides my business, I receive a pension from the government and my son is working and contributing to the family finances. Generally, our family's life is good.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~ 1072 USD) loan to purchase vegetables, flour and meat for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. She has been running a clothing and lingerie shop out of her home since 2007. She has completed her studies through the middle school level. 

She is requesting a $700 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to further expand her business and increase her selection of merchandise. This will be her first loan from Ameen. Although women entrepreneurs are still in the minority in Lebanon, their presence is continuously growing. Ameen s.a.l. offers special incentives to loan officers who recruit female clients.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Expand her business and increase her inventory

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila S., 46, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Gregorio S., she is blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while renting out some apartment rooms.

Mila has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 34,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying items needed to replenish stocks in her variety store. She will be buying groceries, toiletries and beverages.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying  groceries, toiletries and beverages for resale

loans.name: Martin Lesoine

texts.en:
Martin Lesoine E. is 33 Years old. He is a married to Susan Wangari and is the father of two children.

Martin is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

Martin learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member. This will be Martin’s first loan, of which he is planning to spend fifteen thousand KES to plow, ten thousand KES on harrowing, twenty thousand KES on seeds and five thousand KES on planting his five acres of wheat.

Martin hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial. His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence.

Martin is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To plow, harrow and plant his five acre farm

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es:
Doña Gioconda tiene la edad de 44 años, vive en el barrio Concepción de Maria, casada, madre de cinco hijos.
Su negocio es la venta de ropa, y venta de tortillas, negocio que inicio hace varios años con el objetivo de generar ingresos para su familia. Lo que vino a mejorar en la alimentación y pagos básicos. Que es lo mas caro y necesario.
Con este financiamiento lograra invertir en compra de ropa, compra de varios quintales de maíz, cal, carbón entre otros para aumentar su producción de venta de tortillas. Y lograr captar cada día clientes.
texts.en:
Gioconda is 44 years old and lives in Concepción de María barrio. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Her business is to sell clothes and tortillas. She started the business some years ago with the object of generating income for her family. The business has improved the family's nutrition and helped with basic expenses, the most costly and necessary of all. With this loan, she will invest in clothes to sell and various hundred-weights of corn, lime and charcoal, among other things, to augment the production and sale of tortillas. This should help her to capture more customers each day.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING HUNDRED-WEIGHTS OF CORN, CHARCOAL, LIME, PLUS CLOTHES TO CONTINUE IMPROVING SALES INCOME

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Tosontsengel city of Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Batsaihan, is an ambulance driver while her both children are students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have been living together in their current home for 12 years. 

Currently, Baljinnyam has been operating a meat trading business at a local market. She has been operating her business since 2006 with the help of her husband, and has steadily expanded her business. She started her business with a working capital of 200,000 MNT. After years of successful operations Baljinnyam has increased her working capital to 1,800,000 MNT.  She is an open-minded person and has many plans for the future. She says, “I would like to expand my business and to produce meat products, which are closer to my profession as a chef.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase large amount of livestock in order to slaughter and sell at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem S. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents which she and her husband use today to grow different crops, including potatoes and rice. Planting her crops is an annual event with which she has had great success. Kem S. is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to begin planting a new crop of potatoes and rice

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to begin planting her next crop.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles C. R.   es una señora  de 58  años de edad quien vive con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semi montañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio. 
Desde hace varios  años Doña María   se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de sus hijos  le facilita seguir con su pequeño negocio, el cual siempre le ha generado Ingresos.
 Actualmente Doña María está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida..
Doña María   es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles C. R. is a 58-year-old woman who lives with her 2 children in a community named Canalete, located in Upala, in Alajuela province. It is a semi-mountainous region, and its economic activities are focused on agriculture, chiefly on livestock raising. It is a community with great opportunities for development and the establishment of microenterprises, both in agro-industry and trade. For the past several years, María has worked raising chickens to fatten for meat and hens for egg production. She sells her products to her neighbors in the community, who are very satisfied customers. She says that the help and support of her children have made it easier for her to continue with her small business, which has provided her with a steady flow of income. Currently, María is requesting a microloan of ¢604,000 (six hundred four thousand colones) to buy more chickens and laying hens, concentrated feed, and products to treat diseases, in addition to expanding and improving her place of business. With this, she hopes to see her business grow and improve her quality of life. María is a member of the Canalete Communal Credit Company [Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete], one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan, and with it, she hopes to keep growing on a personal and economic basis, in addition to participating actively in the credit organization within her community.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction material, chickens and feed

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 32 years old, is married to a technician, and has two children. She sells bags and shoes to earn a living and is also employed.

Stella is a member of the Shirley self-help group in Faulu Kenya. With the support of the group members, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES which she will use to add to her stock of bags and shoes.

Stella hopes to import bags and shoes and to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of bags and shoes

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. ropa típica ayacuchana, que manda confeccionar, actividad que realiza todos los días, Eduarda tiene un taller en su casa en donD. confecciona la ropa que también venD. en su puesto.
Eduarda es viuda, tuvo 4 hijos y ahora tiene un nieto a su responsabilidad.
Eduarda es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero y solicita un crédito D. 1500 soles para la compra D. chompas, pantalones y ropa D. bebe.
La meta D. Eduarda es tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Eduarda has a stand at the F. Vivanco Market where she sells traditional clothing from Ayacucho that is maD. to order. She engages in her business every day. Eduarda also has a workshop in her house where she makes clothing to sell at her stand. She is a widow and has four children. Eduarda also has a grandson who is her responsibility.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Lucero” and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 PEN to buy sweaters, trousers, and baby clothes. Eduarda’s goal is to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters, trousers, and baby clothes

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.en:
Maria Eloisa L., from the village of Guba Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 34 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maria Eloisa owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products such as sugar, noodles, canned goods, vinegar, cooking oil, soap, etc. in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maria Eloisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products for her store, she is now requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be Maria Eloisa's sixth loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental.
