Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old married man who lives with his wife and five children in Tyre. Ali does a lot of things in order to provide the best standard of living he can afford to his big family. Since 1989, he has worked in construction and is an expert in cement work. Since 1998, he has sold chickens, either live or ready to be cooked. Since 2006 he has owned a bus to transport students to and from school. In addition, he has a new private business buying and selling used cars.
This is the second time that Ali has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. His last loan greatly affected his family's financial situation. This time he is requesting a loan in order to support his car trading business, since this business is new.
Ali is an ambitious man and a hard worker. His customers are seeking him out as his reputation is spreading among nearby villages. He hopes to stay in such an ambitious situation, and hopes to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: To support his car trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sand, stone and blocks and to cover medical expenses

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 21 years old and married. She has been in business for four years, operating a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes. She also operates a butcher shop. Her business is in a good location beside the road, thus ensuring a good market. Her main customers are low- and middle-income earners and she employs one person. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 70,000 to add to her stock of meat, and of clothes and shoes. She is hardworking and passionate about her business. 

Doreen hopes to be a clothes and shoe supplier in future with a five-year plan of opening more outlets in Nairobi. Since joining Faulu, her business has grown through the loans she has been receiving. She started with a boutique but has used the loans to start a butcher shop as well.

loans.use: To add  to her stock of meat, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 28 years old and single. Eugene is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly men’s clothes. He has been in this business for about five years and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Saturday and Sunday. He currently employs two people in this business.

Eugene has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business by adding a variety of styles of men’s and women’s clothes. If successful, Eugene hopes to build a house and would like to get married soon.

loans.use: To add men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Hannah has been operating a retail general shop in Naivasha town for the last five years. She is 44 years old married to Patrick Kamama. They are blessed with one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan, and she plans to use the loan for increasing her stock of dairy milk in the shop.

In the future, Hannah hopes to open a supermarket in the town of Naivasha.

loans.use: For increasing her stock of dairy milk in the shop.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Carmen, es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, es viuda, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, vive con sus hijos quienes la apoyan mucho, ella se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene desD. hace 8 años, lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana; por el momento ella no tiene dinero para invertir en mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra D. verduras y frutas, con esta inversión espera aumentar su atención y buen servicio  a los clientes ya que en esta temporada muchas personas buscan frutas para acompañar la cena D. navidad.
Su objetivo es seguir en el negocio mientras tenga  salud, ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos D. la casa y continuar dando buen ejemplo D. su dedicación al comercio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 53-year-old widow who lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She lives with her children, who offer her their full support, and has been selling fruit and vegetables for eight years.  She works seven days a week.

For the time being Carmen has no capital to invest in products to sell so she is requesting a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables.  She wants to improve service to her customers since now many of them are interested in buying fruit for the Christmas season.  Her goal is to stay in business for as long as her health permits, help her children with household expenses and continue serving as a good example of true dedication to business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Sasine Ole

texts.en:
Sasine Ole Y., 25 years old, is married to Jackline Y. and he is a father of three children. Sasine has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years. 
  

Sasine learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. Maize has proved to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, Sasine plans to enlarge his farming. His hope and dream is to export maize overseas. Sasine is a conscientious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sidy

texts.fr: Monsieur Sidy N. est un jeune peintre de 32 ans qui habite dans un quartier situé a proximité de la localité de Camberene. En même temps aussi il exerce la vente de poulets. Monsieur N. s’active dans l’activité de peintre depuis plus de 10 ans déjà. Il est membre de la caisse de Camberene depuis juillet 2003. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné à élargir  son activité d’élevage de poulets. Ce financement lui permettra de développer son activité et aussi d’accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en: Mr. Sidy N. is a young house painter, 32 years old, living in a neighborhood close to Camberene. His other line of business is selling chickens. He has been working as a painter for over 10 years. He has been a member of the Camberene credit association since July 2003. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 West African Francs to be used for   his chicken-raising business. This loan will allow him to grow his business and increase his revenues.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and school uniforms to students who attend school. Susan faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of materials for tailoring. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian P. owns United Credit Solutions, a business offering credit consultation for those looking to rehabilitate their credit.  He works with people who suffer from poor credit through financial mismanagement or who have been victimized by identity theft.  What Christian finds most satisfying is that he helps his clients achieve a higher quality of life.  With his tutelage, many of his clients are able to own their own car or home, things they had previously been unable to do.

Christian worked for a credit consulting firm for three years, before deciding to start United Credit Solutions a year ago.  With many people still feeling the effects of the recession, United Credit Solutions has grown steadily as it helps more and more people escape financial crisis.  Christian and his associates cover an extended territory in what is known in South Texas as “the Valley”.  

This loan, through ACCION Texas-Louisiana, allows Christian to hire two additional employees, who will help Union Credit Solutions manage its increasing client volume.

Christian has quickly developed a reputation in South Texas as someone who can help people escape the vicious cycle caused by having poor credit.  More than anything, Christian considers himself an educator.  Christian, once a victim of poor credit himself, tells his clients how he raised his credit score from 400 and now owns two cars and a house.  He says that he provides a real-life example of what his clients can achieve.

Christian is married with three children.  Check out his website at http://unitedcreditsolutions.net/services.html

loans.use: to hire two employees

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is a married woman who has three children, the oldest of whom is ten years old. She lives in the municipality of Trinidad in the province of Bohol on the Central Visayas islands.

Gemma owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like milk, noodles and canned goods.

Gemma has requested a loan to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items to sell. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods and other items to sell

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is 23 years old. She lives in the area of Jacob Town, She’s single but unfortunately did not have the means of getting an education. Her fiancée is an auto mechanic and they have a son who is 1 year old.

Haja has been involved in the charcoal business for two years now, but she plans to make her business a very big one. Haja is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, and she hopes that her earnings will increase so that she and her family can be able to live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi; es conviviente; la socia tiene 21 años de edad; la socia tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la venta de artesanía y venta de golosinas y todo lo que implica una tienda con todo lo que se requiere para un viaje a Machupicchu la socia tiene su stand en la estación de tren en Ollantaytambo, el cual se encuentra en la misma estación camino a Machupicchu, la socia se levanta muy temprano por la mañana todos los días y abre su tienda para la cual abasteció y compro mercadería relacionada en artículos de viajero como linternas, repelentes, pastillas purificadoras, medicinas básicas, algodones, golosinas, chocolates, ponchos de lluvia, gorros de lana, paraguas, galletas, energizarte y mucho más, a esto añadió artesanías para la venta a turistas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como agua mineral, jugos y abastecer su stand. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar el stand.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Deysi is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 21 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. Deysi sells handicrafts, candy, and any other items that may be needed when taking a trip to Machu Picchu. She has a stand at the train station in Ollantaytambo, which is the same station for those who are traveling to Macchu Picchu. Deysi wakes up very early in the morning every day and opens her stand so that she can stock it with merchandise she has purchased. These items include supplies for traveling such as lanterns, repellents, water purification tablets, basic medicines, cotton, sweets, chocolates, rain ponchos, wool caps, umbrellas, cookies, energy drinks, and many other products. She recently added crafts to sell to the tourists. Deysi is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as mineral water and juices to stock her stand.

She is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to restock her tourist stand.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Qotohuycho, perteneciente a la Provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Hilda, la socia tiene 36 años de edad; la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 12, 5, 1 años de edad; la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista , la socia tiene un negocio en casa que ella misma ingenio viendo la demanda de la zona en la que vive y ella decidió implementar un espacio en su casa y almacenar leña para la venta, la socia es buscada por ser una de las vendedoras de leña en la zona, ella tiene en casa ahora un espacio grande en el cual abarca sus leños y todos en su comunidad la conocen y la recomiendan cuando los dueños de restaurantes y pizzerías de urubamba van por leña, los vecinos los ubican para que lleguen a casa de la socia; La socia desea invertir en la compra de más troncos al por mayor y poder abastecer a sus clientes. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su negocio y comprar leños para tener en stock.
 
La socia agradece el prestamo que le otorgaran y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called  “SUMAC TIKA-VALLE SAGRADO”.  This bank is locaed in the community of Qotohuycho, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Hilda.  She is 36 years of age, married and has 3 children ages 12, 5, and 1 year.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the años de edad; la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias with retail trade.  She has a business at home that she herself ingeniously seeing the demand in the area where she lives, she decided to make a space to store firewood for sale.  The associate sought to become one of the saleswomen of firewood in the zone.  At her home she has a large space in which she covers her logs and everyone knows her in her community.  The associate desires to invest in the wholesale purchase of more logs to be able to supply her clients.  She requires the loan to enlarge her profits and purchase more logs to have in stock.

The associate appreciates the loan that is being offered and commits to the payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase logs

loans.name: Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucilo is the coordinator of his group Renacer 1 & 2 (Reborn). He lives alone in and he has a grown child. He says that his most difficult challenge is to have his own house built with concrete block.

Lucilo is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for 14 years, which starting with some savings. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying different sizes and styles of shoes, slippers, sneakers, and others foot wear. He dreams of building an orphanage for homeless children, and he will work to have a successful business to make his dreams come true and help others.

His group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production.  Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. 

Lucilo thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers, and sneakers for his footwear business.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta  is from Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Calixta is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Calixta owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Calixta has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Calixta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Calixta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Calixta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Calixta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is 37 years old, and her spouse is Sosten, who is a farmer. They have five children between the ages of sixteen and five. She owns a dairy farm in Kipture trading center and has been in operation for the past five years. She gets around $53 monthly from the milk sales.

Tecla has taken out a loan from KADET LTD of 30,000 KES. This is her third term loan after paying her previous loans successfully. She wishes to use the money to purchase one dairy cow and will use the profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to be self-sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary is 46 years-old and her husband, Veasna, is 43 years-old.  They live in a village along National Road number five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have a son who is a woodcarver. 

Sary and her husband are fishers and farmers. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new boat and motor for her fishing business.   

Photo: Sary and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat and motor for her fishing business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 35 years old and married to Lilian. They have three school-going children.

George has been working in a quarry in Naivasha for the last thirteen years. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET LTD customer. This is his third loan. He intends to use this loan to buy an extraction site, working tools and meet manpower costs.

In the future he aspires to buy several extraction sites and transport lorries.

loans.use: to buy an extraction site, working tools and meet manpower costs.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Salvadora, vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y pollo indio, este negocio lo tiene en su casa y también sale a vender de forma ambulante, además vende pozol una vez por semana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pescado, pollo y concentrado para alimentarlos, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y aumentar los productos que tiene a la venta, esperando no tener perdidas con la compra.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio a través del financiamiento, aspirando a tener un local fijo en el mercado municipal donde pueda tener mayor afluencia de los clientes.
texts.en:
Salvadora lives with her husband and earns her living by selling fish and native chickens. Her business is located in her home, but she also sells her products as a street vendor. In addition, she sells “pozol” (a beverage made from corn) once a week.

She is requesting a loan to buy fish, chicken, and concentrated feed for her animals. This loan will help improve her business and increase the number of products that she can sell. Salvadora hopes not to experience any losses as a result of this purchase.

Her goal is to improve her business by utilizing this loan. She aspires to have an established location at the municipal market where she can sell to more customers.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken, and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Cesar  Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar es  un cliente antiguo antes era socio del grupo solidario raza de bronce, es un cliente  puntual  en sus pagos por tal motivo no se dudo en darle otro crédito.  El cliente se dedica a la venta de comida  en una pensión que es  de su propiedad en la zona  Villa Victoria de la ciudad de la paz. El crédito se destinara en la compra de un televisor de pantalla plana y víveres para su actividad que realiza tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar, tiene  gran visión para  los negocios y quiere superarse  y fortalecerse con su  negocio que es la venta de  comidas y en el futuro desea tener otro negocio de un café internet.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar is a long term client, who was previously a member of the 'Raza de Bronce' solidarity group. He is a client who is punctual with his repayments,  therefore there has been no hesitation in giving him another loan. Cesar sells food in a small cafe, which is his own property located in the Villa Victoria district in the city of La Paz. The intended use of this loan is to buy a flat screen TV and provisions for his business. 

Cesar has two school-age children. He possesses strong business acumen, and wants to improve himself and become stronger through his business selling food. In future he would also like to run an internet cafe business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and a flat screen television for his business

loans.name: Chank

texts.en:
Mrs. Chank is a 53 year old woman who has lived in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She has given birth to five children, two are single and three are already married. 

To make a living, Mrs. Chank and her husband sell some firewood in and around their community and they are able to get an income, on average, of $7.5 USD each day to help support their family with financial expenses. Besides this, they have a good skill for making furniture such as beds and chairs to sell at home for extra-income. Mrs. Chank will be using a loan to purchase additional firewood to continue selling and to buy more wood to produce beds and chairs.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood and wood for making beds and chairs.

loans.name: Zuleyka Alejandra

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

Aquí conocimos a Zuleyka tiene 20 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella estudia Auditoría en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí, está en el séptimo semestre. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 8  ciclos, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta por que recibe ayuda a través de los créditos para tener su negocio y así poder seguir con sus estudios.

Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en un cybert y  también se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes  en las tardes  ya que en las mañanas estudia. Sus ventas las realiza en sus tiempos libres aunque también aprovecha para vender a sus compañeras de estudio y en el lugar donde trabaja, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería.

Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 1 de Diciembre Community Bank meets in the coastal town of San Clemente. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many national and international tourists, has many different beautiful places, and a rich variety of traditional regional food.

Here we meet Zuleyka, who is twenty years old, single, and lives in her parents’ house. She studies Auditing at the Universidad Técnica De Manabí [Manabí Technical University], and is in her seventh semester. She has received 8 loans from the Community Bank, is its secretary, and likes the bank because she has received help through the bank’s loans to be able to have her own business and to be able to continue with her studies.

She works from Monday to Friday in an Internet café and also sells Avon catalog products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories). She works in the afternoons from Monday to Friday since she studies in the mornings. She makes sales in her free time although she does take advantage of the opportunity to sell items to her classmates, and also in her workplace. She offers credit and charges weekly. She tells us she has spent two years working this way, and it’s going well for her.

She will invest this loan by purchasing perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and costume jewelry.

Her goals are to finish her studies and to have her own business.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Chepkirui

texts.en:
Chepkirui, age 33, earns a living through two businesses: tailoring and farming. She has been active in farming for the past seven years, and her farm produces tea and milk. She and her husband live in Litein South Rift, Kenya, with their four children, who are aged between 10 and 14. The three older children are enrolled in school.

Chepkirui has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES. With the loan funds, she will use KES 30,000 to purchase birds for a poultry farming venture, and use KES 20,000 to plant nappier grass and to pay farmhands to till and weed it. The nappier grass feeds her dairy cows, and she will also sell it to local dairy farmers. She says scarcity of animal feed has made nappier grass marketable and the income will help her meet her family's basic needs.

Chepkirui says that inadequacy of farming skills is the main challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To  purchase poultry and to grow nappier grass for feeding her dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 66 años D. edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos mayores D. edad y con familia cada uno D. ellos.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con  los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la confección y arreglo D. prendas D. vestir, que lo realiza mayormente en horas D. la tarD..
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una maquina nueva semi industrial eléctrica, porque la que tiene es una  maquina antigua a pedal.
El trabajo que realiza es en su casa, se da tiempo para estar con su esposo que es el que le ayuda en la casa porque él se encarga D. la cocina mientras tenga costura que realizar.
Va seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque capacitan en temas muy importantes además D. los talleres para las socias que quieran aprender cosas nuevas.
texts.en:
Angela is a member of the Las Almendras Communal Bank from the Calleria District of the department of Ucayali.  She is 66 years old, married, and has five adult children, each of whom has their own family.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 10 years.  Her profession is the sewing and repair of clothing, which she mainly does during the afternoon.

With her new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles she will buy a new semi-industrial electric sewing machine because the one she has is an old pedal sewing machine.

She does her work at home and she gives herself time to be with her husband, who is the one who helps around the house by taking care of the cooking when she has sewing to do.

She is going to continue to work with Manuela Ramos because they offer training on very important issues in addition to the workshops they offer for members who want to learn new things.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Canter Group

texts.en:
Octavian, who is in his early 30s is single.  He has had a t-shirt printing business for two years.  He works from 8 a.m to 8.30 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy equipment for the printing business and has paid his loan back successfully.  He wants a loan to buy another printing machine and a computer.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Canter" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy another printing machine and a computer

loans.name: Hendriter

texts.en:
Hendriter is a 27-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be honest, trustworthy and God fearing. 

Hendriter operates a charcoal sales business, selling charcoal to the local people. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy charcoal. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 46 years old and has three children. Nilda is married and has one child who is in school.

Nilda is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed money two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is 40 years old and he is from Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children. 

Arnulfo operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been in this business for 13 years and he earns 10000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Arnulfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnulfo is requesting a loan of 13,500 PHP, which will be used to pay for the maintenance of and improvements to his motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of and improvements to his motorcycle.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Cristina runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, sugar, etc.. 

Christina is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more stock, such as soap and canned goods, to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math, pictured above, is 57 years old, and his wife, Asiyas, is 52 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five daughters--two are married and live outside the family home, one has full-time employment, and the other two attend school.   

Math and his wife are fishermen and sell the fish that they catch in the local market. Math is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase additional nets and to repair a boat motor.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets and repair a boat motor

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
This is Leonida, 60, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, her business partner, and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leonida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Php worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leonida dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Rocio

texts.es: Elizabeth,  En su domicilio vende ropa , desde hace 10 años atras ella siempre ha sido comerciante. Su mayor dificultad son los ladrones que rondan el sector ya que al estar sola en su casa se vuelve vulnerable a los asaltos. En la actualidad Elizabeth se encuentra sola, no llego a casarse pero si tuvo 3 hijos . Se siente satisfecha con su trabajo ya que gracias a esto puede darle educación, salud y bienestar a su familia a pesar de encontrarse sola. El préstamo le ayudara a aumentar la capital de trabajo con la compra de ropa con lo que espera tener mayores ingresos y seguir adelante con el negocio. Con el préstamo ella comprara ropa  de hombre y mujer etc.
texts.en:
Elizabeth has space set aside at home to sell clothes, jewelry and shoes.  She’s been doing this for ten years now and she’s always been a merchant.  Her greatest difficulty is robbers who roam about the sector since she’s alone in her store and is vulnerable to robberies.  

Elizabeth is currently alone; she never married but did have children.  She feels satisfied with her work because thanks to it she was able to provide her family with schooling, health and wellbeing despite being alone.

The loan will help her increase working capital with the purchase of shoes and clothes she hopes will lead to higher income and to stay in business.  She will use the loan to buy blouses, coats, underwear, pants, etc.

loans.use: comprara ropa  de hombre y mujer

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is a good nature person and thanks to this he has been able to win the recognition of the people in the area who prefer to visit his store to buy their goods.

He works every day to provide a good quality of life for his three children for whom he wants to provide a good future. He is asking for this loan to buy a stock of products for his store to provide a boost for his business.
Rafig hopes to be able to continue his business so he can offer the customers good service.

loans.use: To buy a stock for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply quality fruits and vegetables to a local hospital.

loans.name: Alotonsi

texts.en:
Ms. Alotonsi A. was born in 1963 in Lomé, in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of five who also takes care of another individual. Her husband is an unemployed driver who can no longer meet the needs of his family. So Ms. Alotonsi A., who sells groceries and other items, takes care of her children by herself with the money she earns from her business. She is very energetic, always on the go and capable of managing a loan and repaying it on time. She is requesting a loan of $800 to rent a shop in order to open a proper general store.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1963 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame A. Alotonsi est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec une personne en charge. Son mari chauffeur de profession, est actuellement en chômage et n’arrive plus à répondre aux besoins de la famille. Donc Madame A. Alotonsi, commerçante des produits d’alimentation générale et divers s’occupe seule de ses enfants avec le bénéfice qu’elle réalise. Très dynamique et toujours active, elle est capable de gérer un crédit et de le rembourser à terme. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour la location d’une boutique afin de mettre en place un commerce d’alimentation générale proprement dit.

loans.use: To rent a shop in order to open a general store

loans.name: Norzia

texts.en:
Norzia lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, living with her husband. She always wants to support her family. Her husband is the driver of a water tanker. He sells water to those people who don’t have water. he need for money and his wife’s wants to take a group loan for her husband to repair the body of his truck to be able to expand his business and help his family. He would like to thank AFSG for supporting their family.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur. AFSG only makes group loans to women.

loans.use: Truck repairs

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl is married and has 2 children who are studying. He is a busboy in a restaurant but in order to cover their household costs he started his own business selling food at the weekend. With the help of his family this has gone well and he has increased the variety of foods that they offer as the clients like the good quality of his food. The family union has been key in the development and growth of this business.

In order to increase his earnings he would like to open his business during the week too, and for this he is asking for a loan of $750 which he will use to buy ingredients to increase his production. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Be a part of this growth and help Raúl and his family to take the next step in this business. They thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Raúl es casado y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, él trabaja como mesero en un restaurante pero para poder cubrir con los gastos de su hogar inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, que realiza solo los fines de semana, con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado sacarlo adelante y ha incrementado la variedad de comidas que ofrece al igual que sus ventas porque la buena calidad de sus productos han sido del gusto de los clientes. La unión familiar ha sido pieza clave en el desarrollo y crecimiento de este negocio.

Para poder incrementar sus utilidades, Raúl desea que su negocio pueda creer para lo que planea abrirlo toda la semana para esto está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte en este crecimiento y ayuda a Raúl y a su familia a que den el siguiente paso en su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente works manufacturing cloth bedspreads for babies. His wife sells their product in different markets in the city of El Alto. He purchases his raw material in bolts of fabric. Vicente also works as a high school teacher in Colegio de la ciudad de El Alto. His requesting this loan for use in purchase of the raw material (cloth) necessary to continue running his business. This will be the sixth loan that he has requested from Impro, and his payment history and credit evaluation have qualified him for another loan as a trusted client.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Vicente se dedica a la elaboración de cobertores de telas para bebes. Su esposa comercializa el producto en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Como materia prima utiliza telas las cuales adquiere por rollos; Vicente también trabaja como profesor de secundaria en un Colegio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en la calle General Santalla de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima (telas) necesaria para continuar con su empresa. Este será el sexto crédito que solicita de Impro; su historial de pagos y la evaluación realizada lo califica como un cliente confiable para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capitol

loans.name: Benedita

texts.en: Mrs. Benedita C. is 41 years old and lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is married and has five children. She is asking for a loan of $800 to enable her buy more yams to sell. She has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Idayatu

texts.en: Idayatu A. is 50 years of age and a mother of 2. She hails from  Mushin in Lagos State,Nigeria.  She sells plastics and has been a LAPO member for three years. Idayatu has been in this business since 1998 and needs  the loan to buy more plastic products for sale.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Norma Justina

texts.es:
Senora Norma A. is 70 years old, and is originally from Bluefields.  She is a widow, and although she has 7 children, she only lives with two of them ,and some grandchildren.  She has run her shop for 28 years, where seh sells basic goods, soda, beef, chicken, goat and other products.  One of the advantages of having this business is that it is located in an area ov about three and a half acres where there are only two shops, therefore there are many customers.  Like many similar shops, Dona Norma sells to her customers on credit, but only to those that are good payers, since in the past some were slow with the business.  In order to improve her small business, she needs more products, and for this reason requires financing in order to purchase:  4 quintal (about 400 kilos) of rice at US$42 per quintal, 2 quintals of sugar at US$26 per quintal, 1 quintal of beans at US$80 per quintal, 2 bags of bath tissue at US$10 per bag, 2 cans of oil at US$27 each, 2 cases of soda at US$19 each, 3 cases of 3 minute soup at US$25 each, 2 cases of Maggie soup at US$7 each, and 3 cases of sardines at US$19 per case


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva translator

La señora Norma A. tiene 70 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, es viuda y aunque  tiene  7 hijos solamente vive con dos de ellos y unos nietos.Desde hace 28 años administra una pulperia en donde vende granos basicos, gaseosas, carne de res, pollo, chiverias y otros productos. Una de las ventajas que tiene este negocio es que en ese sector solamente existen dos pulperias las cuales cubren un radio de dos manzanas, lo que hace que tengan bastantes clientes. Al igual que muchas pulperias doña Norma le da credito a sus clientes, pero solamente a los buenos pagadores ya que en el pasado muchos quedaron morosos con el negocio. Para superarse en este pequeño negocio necesita mas productos y para tal fin requiere de un financiamientos para comprar:  4 quintales de arroz a US$ 42 dolares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azucar a US$ 26 dolares el quintal, 1 quintal de frijolesa US$ 80 dolares el quintal, 2 bolsones de belvet (papel higienico) a US$ 10 dolares cada bolson, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 27 dolares cada bidon, 3 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 25 dolares cada caja, 2 cajas de sopa maggie  US$ 7 dolares cada caja, 2 cajas de gaseosas a US$ 19 dolares cada caja, y 3 docenas de sardinasa US$ 19 dolares cada caja.

loans.use: To purchase 4 quintals of rice, 2 quintals of sugar, 1 quintal of beans, 2 bags of bath tissue, 2 cans of oil, 3 cases of 3 Minute Soup, 2 cases of Maggie soup, 2 cases of soda, and three cases of sardines

loans.name: Paskalia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 32 year old Paskalia Z.. She is married with four children. In 2006, Paskalia established a crop selling business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase an additional stock of crops. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of crops

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim N., 52 years old, is a housewife who takes care of six children. Three of her children contribute about $6 a day to the family income by working in the garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Prak Khen, is a motorcycle taxi driver and earns about $2 a day. They live in the Khpup Veng Village in Kandal Province.

She is now requesting a loan of $500 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband’s transportation. This loan will also help to pay for her children’s school fees and daily living expenses.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband's transportation

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
From the time she was very young, Casilda had the immense desire to contribute economically to her family’s well-being. It was because of this that once she formed her own family she worked in various jobs so that her children would not be disadvantaged. When her husband decided to leave and abandon them, she sought refuge in her activity. Since she felt capable of moving forward together with her beloved sons, she decided to open her own grocery store and in her free hours, without wasting time, she dedicated herself to knitting with great patience beautiful traditional Peruvian sweaters, scarves, and underskirts, etc. to sell to her friends and neighbors, who are delighted by the beautiful work that she does. Her greatest wish is to provide higher education to her beloved children; it is for this that she works insistently because she considers education to be the best inheritance that she can provide to her children. With this goal she comes to you with the hope of receiving your help.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Casilda desde muy niña tuvo las inmensas ganas de colaborar económicamente con el bienestar de su familia. Fue así que cuando formó su propio hogar trabajó en diversas labores para que sus hijos no tengan inconvenientes, cuando su esposo decidió marcharse y abandonarlos para siempre se refugió en su actividad ya que se sentía capaz de seguir adelante junto a sus queridos hijos, actualmente decidió abrir su tiendita de abarrotes y en sus horas libres sin perder el tiempo se dedica a tejer con suma paciencia hermosas chompas, chalinas, enaguas, etc.; para venderlas a sus amistades y vecinos que se sienten encantados por los bellos trabajos que realiza.Su deseo más grande es brindarles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos, es por ello que trabaja insistentemente ya que considera que la educación es la mejor herencia que puede brindarles a sus retoños, es con ese fin que recurre a tu persona con la esperanza de recibir tu ayuda.

loans.use: Increase of capital to strengthen her small store and buy a greater quantity of raw material

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia Bibi, wife of Mr. P., has been married for 25 years and has five daughters. The eldest and the next to her are married and the remaining three are acquiring an education. Mr. P. drives a rented rickshaw and Razia has a shop of video games. She has hired an employee to look after the shop and games in her absence. Razia herself operates and looks after a canteen in a local school, which she has done for the past 15 years. She needs a loan to improve her games store and canteen.

loans.use: Improve game store and canteen condition

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.en:
Sadagat M. is 32-year-old woman who owns a shop where she sells textiles. She started her business in 1993, selling textiles in her home. She is the manager and salesperson at the same time. From the money she earned she opened her own shop.

She is married and has 2 children. As the children grow up it is getting harder to cover all the family's needs. Keeping the store is the only source of income in her family and Sadagat decided to start a livestock business. She believes that purchasing one milk cow will increase her income and will help to cover her children's needs. She applied for 800 USD to purchase one milk cow and start her livestock business.

loans.use: Purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mr. H. Sam Bath (not in the picture), 50, and his family live in a small village off of National Road Two, about 15 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. He and his wife, Mrs. Saret Korn (shown in the picture), 48, have been married since 1979 and have eight children, one of whom studies in school. Another three work in nearby garment factories and the other four are married.

Saret has been selling groceries and other household goods from a small stand in front of their house for 10 years, while H. has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for the same amount of time. Phnom Penh may well be one of the world’s largest cities without even one municipal bus. Motorbike taxis and tuk-tuks are the preferred and, with the rare exception of an automobile taxi, the only way to get around. On a good day, H. can make about $6. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new motorbike for his son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos Antonio requests his third loan; this time he will invest it in building a kitchen for his home. He is a school teacher and has worked at the Rafaela Herrera school for 3 years. His monthly salary is about $165 US dollars. Marcos Antonio has two children: a 10-year-old girl, who is in fourth grade, and a 2-year-old son. His wife is a stay-home mom. Marcos is eager to improve as a person and as a worker; he is responsible and well-known in his community. His dream is to have a steady job, health and a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

El cliente Marcos Antonio está solicitando refinanciamiento de su tecer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( construcción de una cocina), su ingreso mensual como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 3 años es de C$ 3206.25 equivalente a U$ 165.00, este cliente tiene dos hijos, la hija mayor de 10 años de edad estudia su cuarto grado de educación primaria y su hijo menor de 2 añitos de edad ,su esposa se encarga del cuidado de los niños. Marcos es una persona con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, responsable y sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, salud y una vivienda bonita.

loans.use: Build a kitchen in home

loans.name: Muibatu

texts.en: Muibatu S. sells clothes in her shop, which she opens at 8:00 am and closes by 6:00 pm. She has been selling clothes for the past three years. Muibatu is 45 years old and married with six children. She is a LAPO client. Muibatu needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more clothes so that she can meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Luz Viva Ii Group

texts.es:
La asociación "Luz Viva II"  pertenece  al centro focal de villa Tejada ala cabeza  de Laureana Q. trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer  hace 10 años aproximadamente. Ellas cuentan que luego de tener problemas con sus parejas en algunos casos necesitaban de independizarse económicamente, pero no tenían nada de capital para emprender un negocio propio. Actualmente algunas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comida pero la mayoría de ellas se dedican a la venta de ropa variada , para todas las edades, estas prendas son comercializadas principalmente en el mercado tihuanacu ubicado en la ceja de la ciudad de El Alto .
Afirman que necesitan de mayor capital para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad para poder viajar al interior del país y vender sus prendas, con  la seguridad de generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The association "Living Light II" is the focal center of the village of Tejada. It is headed by Laureana Q., who has worked together with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for approximately 10 years. The women say that when they have had problems with their companions sometimes they have needed to become economically independent, but they didn't have any capital to start a business of their own. Now, thanks to the group, some of them are dedicated to making and selling food, but the majority of them make a living selling various clothing items for all ages. These products are sold mainly in the Tihuanacu market located in the city of El Alto. The women affirm they need more capital for the purchase of these products in larger quantities so they can be able to travel to the country's interior and sell their clothing items so they can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase larger quantities of items for resale

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada, 41 years old and married with three children aged one, two and eight, has been selling food items in Zanzibar since 2002.  Working from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. everyday, she earns a profit of approximately $150 each month.  Saada is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can stock more inventory and increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her food shop.

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Hassan T., age 59, is married and has four children (ages 29, 25, 22, and 15). He has been selling empty bottles for 3 years now. He works from 8am to 5pm daily, and he makes about $292 per month.

He hopes to get a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his capital so that he can buy more bottles to sell. Hassan will share this loan with his group, New Africa, which has 21 members.  These members hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.  

In the picture, Hassan is the only man squatting in the front row.

loans.use: To buy bottles to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
“To work as hard as I can is one of my goals in life, because I know that as I aim to uplift the life of my family, I really have to make things to make it a reality,” Yolanda said. Yolanda N. is a 46 year old businesswoman. She is married to Agustin, a furniture worker and they are blessed with six children, and another who has passed away. Their children are: Imee Rose – 24 years old, married, a high school undergraduate; Sheryll – 22 years old, a college graduate and now working in Manila; Ferdinand – 21 years old, in his 1st year college; Richard – 18 years old, an elementary graduate; Val – 9 years old and Ramil Jay – 8 years old, both are studying in their elementary grades. They live in a community where furniture making is the major source of income for most of the residents.

Yolanda is engaged in the vending business. She put up a small stall in front of their house where her customers go when they needed to buy something. Some of her merchandise includes fish and meat. Her store is located beside their small furniture shop which is managed by her husband. The couple is working hand in hand to make sure that they can provide the needs of their family and the education of their two children.

She dreams of improving her business so she requests a loan of PHP 10,000.00 which will serve as additional capital for her vending business. She will buy additional products to sell in her store in order to increase her income. She also saves some of her income for them to have enough money to renovate their house.

loans.use: Yolanda would like to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is currently in the business of selling tea at a local restaurant.  Teresa is thirty-seven years old, married, and has 5 children who all go to school.  With the loan she will expand her business and with the profit she will support her family.  She will also approach poverty issues with the additional profit.

loans.use: expand business; pay children's tuition

loans.name: Humay

texts.en: Humay (her husband is pictured) is 38 years old. She lives in Khachmaz town. This family has 2 children. Her husband has been in business for 3 years. Now, they need a loan of 950 AZN to buy a new door and spare parts for their bus.

loans.use: To buy a new door and spare parts for their bus

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.ru: Солихов Маъруфджон проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает водителем частного такси по маршруту Душанбе-Гиссар-Душанбе. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 5 лет. Для того, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов путем снижения цен на предлагаемые услуги, хочет получить кредит и установить газовое оборудование. Кредит планирует получить на 12 месяцев. Таким образом он улучшит финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Marufjon S. lives in the Gissar district. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He drives a private taxi along the Dushanbe-Gissar-Dushanbe route. He has 5 years of experience in this sphere. Marufjon would like to receive a loan to install a natural gas based fuel system so that he can lower the price of his services and attract new customers. The loan will have a 12 month term. This will help him improve the family's financial standing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Komla  Mawusi

texts.fr: Monsieur W. réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il exerce comme activité la vente de mortiers qui est utilisé pour piler le fufu, le fufu est un aliment très apprécié dans la cuisine Togolaise, il expose aussi ses marchandises  non loin de la route  qui mène à kpalimé, ce qui lui permet d’attirer les passants. Il fait face en ce moment à une demande très élevée, il conquiert tous les jours de nouveaux clients, pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle il a besoin d’un crédit pour acheter  des mortiers, il est marié et a deux enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. W. resides in the Adidogomé district. His work involves selling mortars, which are used for pounding fufu (a highly appreciated food in Togolese cuisine). He also displays his merchandise not far from the road leading to Kpalimé. This allows him to attract people passing by. Right now, he's facing very high demand. Every day he wins over new customers. To satisfy them, he needs a loan to buy some mortars. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mortars

loans.name: Aprocap Group

texts.es:
Aprocap pertenece a un proyecto especial exclusivamente para productores, los socios son D. la comunidad D. Vacahuasi, distrito D. Ocros, Provincia D. Huamanga, La comunidad se ubica al borD. del río Pampas, este río viene a ser el limite con el departamento D. Apurimac.

La principales actividades D. la comunidad son el cultivo D. frutas como naranja, papaya, paltas y mango.

Mariano es socio del Banco Comunal, Mariano es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 8, 6, 3 años, Mariano se dedica al cultivo D. paltos hace 9 años, recibió capacitaciones para el manejo D. paltos, actualmente tiene 80 a 90 paltos, su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. abono y insecticidas. Mariano sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Por otro lado Fortunato es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 18, 14, 9 años, Fortunato tiene 60 plantas D. palta y tiene proyectado instalar mas paltos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abono para el cultivo D. paltos, Fortunato sueña con mejorar su producción y sus hijos sean profesionales.

A los productores D. la comunidad D. Vacahuasi, se les ofrece un préstamo a 12 meses, debido a que este es el periodo D. cosecha, el dinero recibido sera invertido en el cultivo. Los productores podrán cancelar su préstamo al finalizar este periodo que es D. 1 año.
texts.en:
Aprocap is part of a special project exclusive to growers and is maD. up of members of the Vacahuasi community in the Ocros district, Huamanga province. The community is located next to the Pampas River, which forms the boundary between this and the Apurimac district. The community focuses its efforts mainly on cultivating fruits such as oranges, papayas, avocados and mangoes. Mariano is a member of the Communal Bank and lives with his partner and three children, aged 3, 6 and 8. He has worked for 9 years growing avocado trees, having been trained in their care. He currently has 80 to 90 trees and will use his loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides. Mariano dreams of his children becoming professionals. Fortunato lives with his partner and has three children, aged 9, 14 and 18. He has 60 avocado trees and intends to plant more, to which end he intends to buy fertilizer with his loan. Fortunato dreams of increasing his production capacity and of his children becoming professionals. The growers of the Vacahuasi community need a 12-month loan, due to the year-long harvest, which will be invested in cultivating produce. It will be repaid following this year period.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru: Ходжаев Назар житель города Яван. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе с отцом работает разнорабочим по найму. Живут вместе . Семья большая поэтому они вдвоем очень много работают. Кроме подсобной работы они занимаются животноводством. имеют небольшое хозяйство , где разводят скот. Сейчас хотят увеличить поголовье мелко рогатого скота. Для этого он решил получить кредит .
texts.en:
Nazar H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 29 years old, married and has three children. Together with his father, Nazar works as a handyman for hire. They live together. They have a big family which requires the father and son to work a lot. Besides the handyman work, they also have a small farm where they breed livestock. Currently, they want to increase their livestock headcount. This is why Nazar decided to obtain the loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Lides

texts.es:
La señora Laura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Huicungo”, vive en el Jr.  Magdalena s/n –, Distrito de Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 35 años y es madre de 03 niños aun en etapa escolar, quienes son quienes lo impulsan a seguir adelante.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  negocio de venta de carnes de ganado vacuno y porcino en kilos que los ofrece a diario a sus clientes,  con  el carisma y la buna atención que le caracteriza. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará  un ganado vacuno para sacrificarlo en el camal y vender su carne y vísceras en kilos. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura, belongs to the Comunal Bank ““Huicungo”, she lives in the Jr. Magdalena s/n, Huicungo District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín State. She is a partner, 35 years old, and is a mother of three children still in school, and those are the ones who pushed her forward. Before needing to support the economic income of household, driven by her husband, she began her business selling beef and pork by the kilo, which she offers daily to her clients. She is characterized by her charisma and good attention to her customers. At the moment, she continues with this same business, operating in her own home where her main clients are neighbors in her vicinity. With the loan of 500 S/ she will buy a beef cow for slaughter in the butcher house and sell its meat and entrails by kilos. Today she feels very happy about the service offered and thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue in this way for a long time and help many entrepreneurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy beef cattle to take to the butcher

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en:
Enyonam A. is fifty years of age. She is a married mother of six children – three daughters and three sons. She says some of the children are in the junior high school while others are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Enyonam is a food vendor. She cooks and sells kenkey (prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kinds of soup and fried fish or meat). She prepares the food in her house and sells on a table in her community. She buys bags of maize and other ingredients from shops in her town.

Enyonam has been in business for over eleven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.en:
In the city of San Roque G., about 13 kilometers outside of Carapeguá, a group of women of limited resources joined the program Committees of Women Entrepreneurs.  
These women are very active, and the majority of them sell their products on the streets, or participate in other activities.  They are looking for a little more support through credit so they can increase their income and improve their quality of life. 
They need this operation to invest in their respective jobs in order to achieve a sustainable amount of growth that allows them to develop individually and as a group. 

1	Justina A.-	   Small grocery store 
2	Gladys A.-	   Food sales 
3	Juana C.- 	   Undergarment sales 
4	Ana R.-	   Avon cosmetics sales 
5	Anatolia P.-	   Herbal medicine sales 
6	Norma G.-	   Small grocery store 
7	Estela G.-	   Vegetable sales 
8	Selvina B.- 	   Perfume sales 
9	Rosalia C.-	   Hen sales  
10	Andresa G.-	   Clothing sales  
11	Faustina R.-	   Chipa (a local bread) sales  
12	Ma-Norma Z.-	   Clothing sales 
13	Luciana F.-  	   Undergarment sales  
14	Florentina D.-  Vegetable sales 
15	Fidelina G.-	   Vegetable sales 
16	Gricelda D.- 	   Traveling sales 
17	Mirian R.-	   Herbal remedies sales  

There are 18 members of this committee, however one member decided to save her money, rather than take out a loan this cycle.

loans.use: The majority of the participants invest their credit in their respective businesses.

loans.name: Edwing Antonio

texts.es: Don Edwin C. tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 6,17 y 19 años de edad, los cuales estudian y ella trabaja como docente de primaria para apoyar a su hogar. El señor Edwin es dueño de una unidad de Taxi  el cual día a día recorre la ciudad de Managua, para obtener el sustento de su familia, aunque cansado por la trayectoria que hace buscando cliente. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar como cadete, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privad, pero al recortaron personal y con su liquidación compro el taxi. Con esta solicitud de crédito lo invertirá en repuestos y mantenimiento de la unidad de taxi para dar un buen servicio al usuarios. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con sus préstamos a plazo ya que podrá realizar las mejoras. Su meta es poder tener otra taxi para obtener mejoras utilidades.
texts.en:
Edwin C., 36, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have three children; they are 6, 17, and 19 years old. The children go to school. His wife works as an elementary school teacher to help the household. Edwin has a taxi. He uses it every day to travel the streets of Managua in order to support his family, even though he gets very tired from his travels looking for customers. He has worked as a driver for four years. Before that he worked for a private business. But, they cut back on personal, and with the liquidation he bought the taxi. He will use the loan to invest in replacement parts and maintenance for his taxi to be able to give his customers good service. He is grateful to the institution for the support of loans and terms because he will be able to make the improvements. His goal is to be able to have another taxi to get better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and do maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Brigitte F., 32 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans l’élevage et le commerce de moutons. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son activité. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Brigitte F., 32 years old and married, with 6 children in her care. Her business is the raising and selling of sheep. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her goal is to improve the condition of her family's life.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling sheep

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 25-year-old mother of one who owns a boutique in the Embakasi area in Nairobi..  She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 15,000 in order to expand her stock. Esther hopes to one day grow her business into export and import of new clothes. On a personal level, she would like to one day own her own home and build rental units. Esther describes herself as diligent and determined.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Expand her clothing business

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth C. de 28 años reside en el municipio de Armenia departamento de Sonsonate. Sandra vive con su esposo quien es empleado de una tienda de zapatos, y su pequeño hijo Sergio de 3 años de edad. Sandra monto una tienda hace un año, tras las necesidades económicas Sandra tuvo la idea que poniendo un negocio en su casa era la única manera para no descuidar a su hijo y su vez ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares. De esta manera hoy Sandra  posee su pequeña tienda la cual pretende ampliar por medio del crédito que usted dará, de esta manera ella podrá comprar mayor cantidad de productos que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth C. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Armenia, located in the district of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband, who is employed at a shoe store. Their young son Sergio is 3 years old. One year ago, Sandra started her business from her home out of economic necessity. Her store was the only way for her to continue caring for her son and still help her husband with the family expenses.

Today, Sandra hopes to expand her small business with the help of this loan. She will be able to buy a larger quantity of products, which will help increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Victoria Enríquez T. es socia del banco comunal el Paraíso, vive en Cumbe en el barrio 3 de Noviembre en la ciudad de Cuenca.  Ana  tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos de 24, 17, 14, 8, 6 y un nieto de tres años, su hijo mayor se encuentra viviendo en unión libre formando su propia familia, sus dos hijos de 17, 14 estudian en el colegio Cumbe, y los dos últimos estudian en la escuela Gabriel Arseminio Villauri de ese sector, no tiene casa propia por ello viven en casa de sus padres.

Ana se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar  y algunos días de la semana a su negocio de comida,   los miércoles  trabaja vendiendo café con tamal o humitas, los sábados y domingos se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, nos dice que le va muy bien porque tiene su clientela fija.

Ana es socia de la fundación hace un año y le han ayudado mucho nos dice porque está generando su propio ingreso y saliendo adelante junto con sus hijos, el préstamo que la fundación le entrega lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando materia prima como (embutidos, papas, aceite, salsas, etc) y artículos desechables como tarrinas, fundas, sorbetes y muchos artículos más que necesita cuando solciitan el pedido  para llevar y le hacen falta en su pequeño negocio.

El sueño de Ana es ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana Victoria Enríquez T. is a member of the Paraíso Communal Bank. She lives in Cumbe in the 3 de Noviembre neighborhool in the city of Cuenca. Ana is 41 and single. She has five children, 24, 17, 14, 8, and 6. She has a three year old grandson. Her oldest son lives with his significant other and has formed his own family. The 17 and 14 year old children go to school in Cumbe. The last two go to Gabriel Arseminio Villauri School in the area. She does not have her own house, so she lives in her parents’ house. Ana does the household chores, and some days of the week she works at her food business. On Wednesdays she sells coffee with tamales or “humitas” (a type of corn cake). On Saturdays and Sundays she sells “salchipapas” (food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes). It is going very well because she has steady customers. Ana has been a member of the foundation for one year. She tells us that they have helped her a lot because she is generating her own income and getting ahead together with her children. She will use the loan from the foundation to invest in her business and buy raw material like sausage, potatoes, oil, and salsa, etc. She will also buy disposable items like containers, casings, straws, and other items she needs for when they are asked for and she does not have them in her small business. Ana’s dream is to save to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for sausages, potatoes, oil, salsas, and disposable products like packages and straws, etc

loans.name: Darcy Group

texts.es:
El grupo Darcy esta conformado por tres mujeres audaces, diversas y motivadoras. Estas son Lucia del Carmen C. A. de 32 años quien vende cosméticos y productos lácteos como leche, queso, crema, leche agria y cuajada. El lema de C. es satisfacer a los clientes e invertir en la compra de productos de calidad y variedad.

Mientras Fátima G. A.  de 30 baños  y Elvira de los Angeles I. M. tienen cada una un salón de belleza e invertirán su crédito en la compra de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
El grupo Darcy comprises three audacious, diverse and motivated women. They are Lucia del Carmen C. A., 32 years, who sells cosmetics and dairy products like milk, cheese, cream, leche agria (similar to buttermilk) and curds. C.'s motto is to satisfy the clientes and invest in a variety of quality products. Meanwhile, Fátima G. A., 30 years, and Elvira de los Angeles I. M. each have a beauty salon and will use their loans to invest in the purchase of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and dairy products

loans.name: Jolven

texts.en:
Jolven A. is a successful 26-year old fruits dealer from Silang, Cavite.  Jolven has been selling different varieties of bananas for five years now.  He is happy that he is able to send money to his family in the Visayas, but he laments that income is low due to frequent heavy rain.

He is requesting a loan of $200 as additional capital for his banana dealership.  Jolven dreams of being able to work abroad and of starting his own family.
 
About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for fruits dealership

loans.name: Gleysi Del Socorro

texts.en: Gleysi has three children, ages 13, 9 and 5. The youngest is not yet in school, but the older two attend.  Gleysi started her clothing sales business 12 years ago when her husband left her and she had just had her first child. This business has provided her enough income to support her family all these years. Gleysi has a very good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000. She dreams of building her own home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena M. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.
